description:
Sat 11am 45 min wait for 4 people. 

We used the yelp sign up so didn't have to wait as long at the restaurant. The farmers market was on the same street so tough to find parking, but got to wander that in the meantime. 

Iced tea - served in a cute carafe and perfect

Breakfast sandwich - big and delicious! Good to share if you're not too hungry. Get the potatoes on the side; they're so worth it. 

I want to try the breakfast burrito next time.
author: Leslie K.

description:
2x eggs with mushroom for my buddy. Eggs cooked very well. Just the right size for a correct portion. 
And mushroom and spinach Benedict. Potatoes were crisp and poached egg was cooked to perfection. Although the hollandaise sauce wasn't my favorite. It was still enjoyable but it just wasn't the classic sauce flavor. 

I will get French toast next time, and update this review. Stay Tuned & See you soon.
author: Gage S.

description:
I've gone to Eats a few times and I like it. However, I did take a break from going back after the time prior to last because the food was very disappointing; but they have redeemed themselves. There is always ALWAYS a long wait. I have never waited shorter than 20 minutes for a table. However, now you are able to put your name on the waitlist through Yelp, which is very helpful. 

I enjoy having the spinach and portabella mushroom benedict half ben ($8.50) and the strawberry lemonade ($4.25). The benedict half ben is one egg benedict rather than 2. It comes with sautéed spinach and portabella topped with a poached egg and their home made hollandaise sauce served on top of an English muffin, and a choice of salad or potatoes. And their strawberry lemonade is sweet, refreshing and YUM. However, if you're looking for a semi-sweet beverage to go with your meal, this is not for you.  

Although the wait to be seated may take a long time, the waiters are very nice, the restaurant is kept clean, and the food is delicious and comes out fairly quickly. I would definitely recommend this brunch spot if you're in the area!
author: Victoria H.

description:
Food: 3/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 3.5/5
Overall: Food had good flavor but the portion size was a little disappointing.

The extended review...

Food:

Bacon Waffle - The flavor of this dish was great.  The bacon interestingly enough was place smack dab in the middle of the waffle.  The only issue is that I left the restaurant hungry.  

Service: Friendly and attentive service.

Ambiance: The seating is a little bit cramped.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Reserve your seats through yelp! It gives you a good estimate on when to arrive, and you won't have to wait in line/put your name on the waitlist when you get there. The place is pretty small with limited seating (there's two additional tables outside). 

I ordered the avocado and salmon eggs benedict, and it was really good. There was a lot of avocado and the eggs benedict were cooked the right amount (my friend's was cooked a bit too much even though he ordered the same thing). I wish there was more salmon though because the avocado definitely overpowered it. Also, the English muffins were extremely hard to cut. It was way too rough (these English muffins were on the thicker side too). I think the highlight of this dish was the side of potatoes. Perfectly seasoned with a nice crisp.

Overall, a great place for brunch that I'd definitely come back to!
author: Aileen J.

description: Another good find , nice place on the corner location comfortable friendly great food & service  we ordered the Mexican scramble & waffle bacon,  the scramble was a hybrid chilaquiles & breakfast nachos to me very good and the waffle bacon sunny side up eggs over a stuffed waffle filled with cheese bacon peppers try this place won't be disappointed .
author: Aaron B.

description:
Love that you can join the waitlist (aka wait in my apartment instead of outside on the street). 
Came here for a Sunday brunch and started with the strawberry toast which was pretty delicious. Will probably try to recreate on my own. I was too hungry to wait and take a pic before it was gone ‍
Also got the Mexican scramble which maybe could have used a little more cheese on top. But still pretty great and filling! Avocados were perfect!
author: Maggie R.

description:
Brunch spots get competitive in SF and I can't see how it wouldn't be for Eats! I ordered one blueberry pancake and eggs Benedict. I really enjoyed this version of eggs Benedict because they had tomatoes on it, which takes away the heaviness of this dish because of the eggs and hollandaise sauce. Also, their sauce tastes very different from that of other places: it has strong hints of miso, which is interesting. I'm so glad the ham was not salty. The Benedict came with a generous portion of mixed greens and cherry tomatoes, lightly marinated with balsamic vinegar. I strongly recommend the blueberry pancakes!! The berry pieces were fresh and juicy. The pancake was cooked just to the right fluffiness!! 

For a weekend brunch, I was fifth in line for a party of two, but we were seated within five minutes (could have just been luck). The restaurant is an open kitchen format, but you did not feel the greasiness! Eats made excellent use of their limited space, stocking a corner with a large inventory of prosecco. I'm impressed with their layout. On top of that, they had nice modern decor: wooden slabs with holes that had vegetation peeking out.
author: Louis Suo L.

description:
1. Long lines over the weekend, so be prepared to wait. The board where you put your name and party size down can be super confusing bc they erase the names at the top off, and new guests puts their name at the top. Just make sure to keep checking where you're at and make sure you know where you are in line.

2. Service is usually pretty good even though they're busy. 

3. Food is consistently good as well. My favorite dish on the menu is their spicy tomato skillet. It's a simple dish, yet packed with flavors. Easy to eat and delicious. It's always something I order. I've had their chicken & waffles, and Benedict's but they're just ok. I've had better ones. 

4. Shared a pitcher of their grapefruit mimosa. Don't know how I feel about it though. I think I prefer a regular mimosa over it. Worth a try, but probably won't order it again. 

5. The only thing that bothers me about this establishment is the mossy green stuff growing on their wall. It looks cool and all, but being in the food safety side for my career, it kinda worries me what grows in there and what if things fall into food :/ it's probably nothing but just a thought I have!
author: Elle T.

description: I lucked out there was no wait this morning. I had the suite breakfast (upgraded it to the berry waffle) and fresh orange juice. The berries and fresh whipped cream made the waffle sweet enough without syrup, which would have made me want to take a nap in an hour due to carb crash, so I skipped the syrup. Really good breakfast and cute little place in San Francisco. They have a few outside tables which is perfect on a warm sunny SF day.
author: Kim B.

description:
I would definitely recommend anyone going to Eats to start their day or for brunch! It's a small, neighborhood-y eatery that serves up quality, well-seasoned and balanced dishes! 

The Yelp waiting list is super clutch to ensure that you get seated in a timely manner. If you do need to wait a bit Clement Street is almost a hidden gem in SF and I would suggest you take a stroll around while you wait! 

My boyfriend and I ordered a blueberry pancake to share and this was my personal favorite of the whole meal -- I have an affinity for blueberry pancakes and it's quite hard to find some good ones in SF surprisingly! I ordered the hash and my boyfriend ordered the huevos ranchero -- we both thoroughly enjoyed both of your dishes! 

All in all, a great experience with great food to match!
author: Danielle D.

description:
Pretty darn good stuff...

I can get used to eating breakfast especially like this.  Again, having an appointment in the neighborhood on a weekday morning, we changed it up by trying another new (for us) breakfast place.  We found metered parking a half block away.  After a short wait, we were seated at a two top near the kitchen.  The restaurant was full but not overly bustling likely because it was a weekday.  After we were given menus, it took a few glances at the Yelp listing and peeks at the menu before I decided on my breakfast.  

Contrary to my usual pattern, I did NOT order corned beef hash (was it on the menu?, there was a pork hash) and instead ordered the chicken and waffles (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wXPh9hPtS6KL7GGf6lqbXQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  The description is what sold me:  Panko crusted all natural chicken, mushroom gravy (yes, sold!), honey butter, powder sugar.  The chicken was crispy and boneless, yet not dry... even if it was, the mushroom gravy, sigh.  The waffles had a nice texture, not overly crisp and the syrup was not too sweet striking a great balance between savory and sweet.  

Service was good and not overbearing.  Drink glasses were refilled and empty plates and dirty utensils removed promptly.  In a word, efficient.  Don't expect long explanations or chit chat conversations with your waiter or waitress as they are briskly meeting the needs of all diners.  And this was on a weekday...

Yes, I will be back and my big decision will be to have that chicken and waffles again or try one of their interesting egg menu options...  Or grow another stomach and do BOTH!
author: Mike C.

description:
We love Eats! A lot of variety, fresh, yummy food! We have been here 4 times now and it hasn't disappointed us. 

Eats uses the "waitlist" feature on Yelp which is amazing bc it allows us to wait at home until it's time to be sat. 

At our last visit, they were out of fresh juices, but we did come towards the end of their morning hours so I guess that's to be expected. 

I like their champagne in a can option, I feel like it's way more than just 1 mimosa so that makes me a happy bruncher.
author: Andrea P.

description: This was an excellent choice for breakfast for us while we were vacationing in San Fran. Hubby had the special two eggs with potatoes and toast and I had the eggs benedict with mushrooms and spinach. We enjoyed the food and the service was top notch and very friendly. I will come back when in town.
author: Mireya M.

description:
So far this is one of my favorite places to eat at scrambles and waffles at. Their berry waffle is super delicious, their whipped cream looks homemade, and very fruit on it was ripe and tasty. The rosemary potatoes were cooked perfectly with rosemary and scallions used to garnish. I had the farmers scramble which I highly recommend, it had a roasted garlic which spread on the sourdough bread elevated the taste.
The coffee is equator 
We also tried the vitamin C juice which was super fresh tasting or they use high quality juice. Either way hella good.
author: Mar L.

description:
Love the option to reserve seating at Eats via Yelp. So, so helpful. I put my name on the waitlist on a recent Saturday and my table was ready as soon as I arrived! 

Eats is a fairly small brunch spot in the Richmond. The service is quick, the staff are friendly and the food is tasty. My first time, I tried the waffle, egg, sausage combo plate and it was great. That being said, the serving sizes are small and the menu is pricey. I get that San Francisco is expensive but an Arnold Palmer should never be $4 without refills. I would probably return to Eats (and use Yelp Reservations) but I would be wary of the menu prices.
author: Katie C.

description:
So good we went two days in a row! A friend recommended this place that I had somehow never go to and upon trying it we knew we had to come back again (the very next day). Food is divine, nothing too snobby, decent prices and if you join the waitlist ahead of time and arrive when estimated it's a really enjoyable experience! 

Do: Use Yelp to join the waitlist then get coffee and meander the local shops until you get the alert.

Don't: Try to hurry the staff, they're all working really hard despite the constant rush! Also don't just take an empty table outside, those are part of the waitlist too and you're cutting people in line.
author: Bianca H.

description: Oh. My. God. I don't think I can really describe this place except I always thought: "ahhh it can't be that good...look at that yelp sheep crowd." If you have a week day morning to kill and DO NOT want to wasted it in traffic or you've rolled out of bed and you have a hankering for breakfast or brunch then by all means head to Eats. The atmosphere is all about what your foodie desires are...enjoy.
author: Papa Dadoo B.

description:
Had Eats for one of my firsts times eating breakfast in SF. First off, being able to reserve a table online through the yelp app is extremely convenient! I would definitely recommend if you are interested in coming and don't want to wait in line.

When I first walked in the friendly staff greeted and seated us fairly quickly. I ordered the Breakfast Suite, and needless to say, it was amazing! The sausages were juicy and flavorful, the egg was just a perfect sunny side up and the waffle was soft but a bit crispy. 

Overall, I think it's the ambiance of the restaurant that really does it for me, the decor compliments the the overall feel of the restaurant, would definitely come again!
author: Brandon T.

description:
So me and a friend came here today for brunch. 
There's plenty of people and there's a wait list, so I'd recommend you to put your name on the list before you go out, so you won't have to wait for so long. 
We've waited for about 35-45 minutes. 
We got a table outside. 
We both ordered coffee, I also ordered a small detox juice (tasty). 

I had the spinach mushrooms Benedict with potatoes, it was super yummy. I really liked the potatoes, they were surprisingly good since I've never really liked the potatoes somewhere else. 
My friend had the farmers scramble with salad and we shared a banana chocolate chip pancake. I didn't try the scramble, but the pancake was delicious. 
After all that, we still managed to eat waffles with berries, banana & whipped cream. It was delicious. 
As for me, I'm not eating anything else today lol 

The food arrived in around 10 minutes, which surprises me, since it was really full. The staff is super friendly and helpful. All over a great experience. I'll be coming back for sure :)
author: Diana F.

description:
Good place for brunch or breakfast. Lines can get long at times. Weekends are impossible unless your willing to wait an hour plus. If you get here early your good. Weekends can also be busy.

Food is fresh and tasty. Good selections. Service can get slow as they get busy, but they are friendly.

Parking can also be a problem as the neighborhood businesses get busy and parking is difficult. Sundays are the most difficult as they hold a farmers market which closes two streets and with the combination of people and less parking makes it difficult and you'll have to park several blocks away.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Last time I dined here it was called Cheers. Apparently this spot likes monosyllabic names: Now it's "Eats."

And even on a Saturday which doesn't normally seem to be a big brunch day, there was a moderately sized crowd waiting for tables.

We only waited 15 minutes for our table of two (waits were much longer for tables of 4 since most are deuces- bigger groups were waiting over 40 minutes since the restaurant is small).

The menu was extensive for such a modest spot and had a bit of everything, from a delicious variety of interesting sandwiches and salads to omelettes, breakfast burritos, steel cut oatmeal, fresh fruit and "fancy toast."

Feeling brunchy, we both ordered the Breakfast Suite (2 eggs, bacon or chicken sausage, mini waffle (or a "waffle berry" with fruit, whipped cream and honey syrup for an extra $2.75, definitely the way to go!)

Unfortunately, our server made a computer mistake, input only one order and my breakfast was delayed by 10 minutes. He was very apologetic and brought a beautiful cup of fruit and took 20% off our bill which made up for the error.

The breakfast was excellent, the coffee and fresh juices were terrific and it was nice dining al fresco (though a bit nippy).

I'd go back to Eats in a hot minute to sample more of their menu. Maybe we'll go next when school's out to avoid the weekend crowds.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Service was fine, but food wasn't great. Expected a bit more with the amount of reviews and rating they had, but it was not up to standards.

-Spinach and portabella Benedict: There were barely any covering the muffin and the muffin was not good. It was chewy and thick like when bread is soggy. The hollandaise sauce wasn't bad. Potatoes weren't crispy at all and just oily.

-Cowboy Burrito: This was pretty good with the amount of tri tip they had inside. I liked how they fried the burrito for a bit so the tortilla was slightly crispy. The salad was nasty. Originally, I thought it was the dressing, so I asked for it without, but I had trouble eating it by itself as well. Not fresh and the leaves looked dead...

-Fried Chicken: I had high hopes for this, but it wasn't fried well and the chicken wasn't juicy nor tender. It was smaller than I had expected given that they said it's the same one they use for their chicken and waffle.

Came here since the wait time was available on yelp and I was able to put my name on the waitlist, but probably wouldn't come back for the food.
author: Tina P.

description: This place has been going down for years.  The service is very slow. After sitting, I waited 30 mins today to get a glass of water and order taken.  The food portions are small for the cost. Since when is a side of bacon two small pieces?  The quality of the food is mediocre at best.  Much better brunch places all over SF
author: Spencer G.

description: I love this place! We've been here a few times and it was at least a 30-45 minute wait each time, but now they have integrated the yelp waitlist system and now you can check in nearby on your phone and just wait from there.  It'll also tell you when you are coming up so you can go back towards the restaurant. The potatoes are to die for! They also serve good coffee here and mimosas too! :)
author: Ben Z.

description:
Delicious breakfast!

Cute little place, friendly and hip staff, limited seating. Had the breakfast plate here which was great - eggs, bacon, and upgraded to the berry waffle.

My goodness that berry waffle was the best fruit waffle I have ever had! I wish I had ordered more of that. I'm still dreaming of that waffle.

Would definitely recommend eating here, but come early because it gets crowded and there is a wait!
author: Shelley C.

description:
Came here at 9:15am on Sunday thinking that there wouldn't be much of a wait but there was approximately 5 tables ahead. You write your name on the board outside and you can state whether you prefer indoor (I), outdoor (O), or any (A). I didn't wait too long for seating and given that I chose either outdoor or indoor, we were seated outside fairly quickly.

My friend and I got the ham and tomato benedict ($~15) as and well as waffles with berries and creme (~$10) to share. The benedict was interesting because I think they used a baguette rather than an English muffin. The egg was poached perfectly. The country potatoes were flavorful and delicious. The waffles came with berries, bananas, and whipped cream. The whipped cream was light and the batter for the waffle was just right. There was too much whipped cream for my liking but I was easily able to scoop some away.

Service was fine. We had 3 different servers ask if we were doing okay.

Overall, food is tasty but it is on the more expensive side.
author: Julian Y.

description:
I walked to Eats on a typical windy and foggy SF day, only to see a waiting list to go inside. Some people think that waiting lists are tedious, and with that, they'll head somewhere else instead. However, I am a firm believer that the wait is for a reason. I think I waited about a solid 20-30 minutes until I got my table. Once sitting down, it's business. I quickly gazed through the menu and ordered the cowboy burrito and a decaf coffee. I then patiently waited while sipping my water and coffee. When the food arrived, I was so happy. Everything on the plate existed in such a harmonious fashion, and I thought to myself, "am I about to ruin this thing?" 

The burrito was as great as breakfast burritos come: huge and filled with various veggies, egg, and some satisfying steak. A bit messy to eat into, but totally worth it. The potatoes were well seasoned, and as you can see in the picture, are cooked with roasted garlic cloves, giving a full-bodied, bold flavor to the potatoes. It was all so good! After barely finishing my meal, I finished it off with a fruit cup, which was one of the best fruit cups I've had. It had berries, pineapple, and kiwi--none of those lame placeholder fruit cup fruits. To top it off, I felt that the waitstaff were attentive, prompt, and just great at their job.

tldr: really amazing food. good value. great service.
author: Lydia M. And Connie C.

description: I have not been let down with anything each time I have come here. I first tried chicken and waffles here and I can not believe I had never eaten it before in my life. Their potatoes are absolutely amazing too. The farmers omelet is very refreshing too. The wait can seem like it is crazy but you can check in via yelp before hand so you're not standing outside for too long. It's a small space so they really can only serve so many people at a time but it is 100% worth it!
author: Yochabel U.

description:
Been here a few times with my boyfriend, always on the weekend and figured it was time to review this place! Like everyone's mentioned, definitely a longer wait and on the pricey side but I think it's worth it for a nice brunch! 

When we started coming to Eats a year ago, you had to put your name and party size on a little whiteboard outside the restaurant. Now, you can add yourself to the waitlist through Yelp and it'll give you a time that you should be there and how many people are ahead of you. It updates as people are seated as well, which is so convenient for those of us who live in the neighborhood just walking distance from Eats! My boyfriend and I only waited at the restaurant for 10-15 mins tops, where as before this we'd wait up to an hour to get seated! Huge improvement, thank you Eats! 

Onto the food, which is excellent! We always get the two egg special with toast and potatoes, as well as sausage which is extra $$$ but worth it! This time, I decided to get a waffle as a side because I was craving some sweet to my savory, and it did not disappoint. Downside, it was tiny! I literally ate it in 4 bites! So considering the size, the price was steep, unlike the two egg special which I find a little more reasonable! Drinks wise - they only have regular coffee, no fancy lattes or cappuccinos for all you fancy coffee drinkers so keep that in mind! They do have mimosas as well, although I'm not sure if they have a formal boozy brunch. 

Service was great - the servers were attentive making sure we always had coffee and water refilled but weren't chatty as they were busy (which we appreciated!) Atmosphere wise, the place is a little small, so I oftentimes feel very warm, but of course some might prefer it to the outside when SF is cold! There are 3-5 tables outside, although we've never sat there, I can imagine that it'd be nice on a warm day!

Overall, highly recommend, just docked a star because it is definitely pricey, our bill is consistently $50+ which seems like a lot for a basic brunch with no alcohol!
author: Abi R.

description: This place is great! My fiancé and I enjoyed coming here during our most recent visit to SF. It's food is of great quality and you can't ever go wrong with hash browns, scrambled eggs, and an apple sausage. Everything was done to great standards and the coffee didn't disappoint. Although, it is a small place and it gets busy, make sure to go ahead of time! Will be coming back again
author: Ralph A.

description:
I absolutely love brunch and San Francisco is perfect for this.  The wait is crazy and quite pricey but I thought it was worth it.  I waited about an hour and a half for this restaurant on a Saturday morning in San Francisco.  

Ordered: home-made waffle berries & creme ($10.25), side of bacon ($3.50), and iced coffee ($3.25). 

Everything was delicious!  I highly recommend!
author: Mikayla M.

description:
Another hip and trendy brunch spot in the city! 

The wait wasn't bad on the Sunday we went because the nearby farmers market helped pass the time. Prompt staff and quick service. They were busy but we got our food shortly after ordering. I had the spicy tomato skillet with two sunny side up eggs. It was tasty and had a mild spice. The eggs were perfect. I also ordered the detox drink with beet, carrot, apple, and ginger. All good stuff! 

Parking was fairly okay to find since it's in the residential area so not too crazy.  

Would love to come here again and try their other items - they have lots of sandwich/eggs options.
author: Ying Z.

description: Yum! All around yum! The tri-tip sandwich and cucumber-kale-pineapple refresher are a revelation. :))
author: Ryan A.

description:
Loved the pancakes. Loved Loved Loved.

Divorced egg was mixed - great eggs and red sauce. Potatoes and garlic were good. The added pulled pork was dry and not that flavorful. 

Fried chicken and waffles were ok. Chicken was breast meat which I loved but some people could want dark meat. Waffles were a little dry. 

Fresh squeezed orange juice was so yummy. Fresh. Sweet. Perfect. 

Pretty small and packed inside.  They have high chairs but it was quite a tight squeeze.

They don't quite have their watlist figured out.  They had some on a chalk board and some on the Yelp waitlist ipad.  It wasn't clear what order they were going in and it wasn't how many people were ahead of you.  I hope they figure it out because it was a great brunch spot but super crowded. If they go with the Yelp waitlist ipad then definitely log on to yelp and add your name to the waitlist ahead of time!

Lots of street parking right outside. Cute shops to peruse while you wait too.
author: Traci H.

description:
I love this place!!! Definitely my favorite breakfast place ever. Their bacon waffles & eggs are so good! when I first got it I thought it wouldn't make me full but it's definitely very filing. their Arnold Palmers are also the best i've ever had. 

definitely get there early if you don't wanna wait. I'm here right now (10am) & it's a 45 minute wait. you have to wait outside because the restaurant itself is tiny inside but they have these small heat lights that help. it's definitely worth the wait for me 

ps. I have a instagram dedicated to food for all you food lovers lol @fatkatmunchies
author: Katrina F.

description:
Great place in heart of clement street. Nice to pit stop here before the farmers market on Sundays. Easy and quick breakfast joint. Service was good, food was good, and brunch drinks didn't disappoint. 

Reserve your spot in line through yelp from home. Waiting outside due to lines isn't worth the hassle. Reserve and then wait till it gives you a time to show up. Once you show, it's super easy to be seated. 

Their chicken apple sausage is the best I've ever had, their batter for the waffles and pancakes are to die for (so airy, not doughy, and so yummy), and the pork hash is a must! We love eats!
author: Emily A.

description: Wow, this place is great. Expected greasy diner food but turned out to be healthy and delicious tasting. Ordered the 2 egg special, with scrambled eggs and mixed greens. They eggs were moist and light topped with flat leaf parsley. The greens were fresh with shredded carrot, radish, halved cherry tomatoes and tossed in a very mild vinaigrette. Left feeling light and satisfied.
author: Heather S.

description:
My favorite breakfast place so happy that San Francisco has such a convenient little restaurant around the corner for everyone to enjoy !! Thank you for your wonderful service and delicious, creative dishes ! 

Recommend for everyone !5 stars
author: Claire F.

description: Brunch is super good!! Definitely make reservations before hand it's a super popular fun spot! Pro tip: there's a Sunday farmers market right next to it with amazing fresh food
author: Hannah W.

description: Super awesome place!! Found where to get my Benedict!! Use the yelp app to join the waitlist so you don't get stuck waiting outside!!
author: Stormy E.

description: Good morning!   Wonderful, generous portions.  Delicious coffee.  Terrific staff.  And we could waitlist!  E
author: Becky M.

description:
COME HERE FOR BRUNCH!

It's a cute place with a cute atmosphere. I wasn't feeling particularly hungry this day, but my friends wanted to try this place, so I decided to tag along. I'm glad I did. 

My order was the half waffle with the fruit. The waffle was fluffy and the strawberries were juicy and sweet. They do give you a good amount of fruit, even for just half of a waffle.

My friends really enjoyed their food as well.

I would definitely come back when I'm hungry and get a full meal .
author: Allyson L.

description:
Zazie. Plow. Mama's. These are some of the quintessential San Franciscan brunch spots with a guaranteed wait. Walk by on any morning or afternoon and you'll probably see people waiting outside, desperately trying to pass time until one of the servers calls their name when a table is ready. To my surprise, I recently discovered that there was another one of these popular restaurants in the unsuspecting Inner Richmond.

Relax, the wait never gets as long as it does for Plow. But you'll be greeted with a short wait even if you come around noon on a weekday. You can kill time on the conveniently placed bench right outside -- our wait couldn't have been more than ten minutes. We had the two eggs special (over easy) with a salad, the spinach portabella benedicts with potatoes, a half order of the berries and creme waffles, and a single banana chocolate pancake. 

What I like the most about Eats is its homey, laidback ambiance. Find yourself unable to decide what to order, as I did? No worries, just get a berries and creme waffle and a banana chocolate pancake. It'll add up to $11.50, which is pretty standard for a brunch dish in the city, but I was surprised by the large portion size for that price! If I'm being honest, I don't usually care for sweet breakfast foods, but I was pleasantly sated after I had devoured both dishes.

While the service isn't overly friendly because of how busy it usually is, the servers do their best. One of the servers non-creepily lingered behind our table (after our dishes had been cleared) while we were putting our coats back on so she could say the customary parting words -- "thanks, hope to see you again soon" -- which I thought was a really nice touch, staying true to the local vibe of Eats. I can tell why this is a neighborhood favorite, but I'd definitely only try to swing by on a weekday morning next time.
author: Amy C.

description: Coming here for years, I can't believe that I've never had their grilled ham and cheese. Five stars for food, service and efficiency.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I come to Eats with my family every time we have an occasion to go out to breakfast. Their scrambled eggs are all divine and they make a mean French toast. Make sure you get there early becomes sometimes there can be a bit of a wait. Enjoy!
author: Sydney G.

description:
So damn delicious! I stumbled upon Eats and am so happy I did! I went here this morning for a quick breakfast and it was honestly one of the best breakfasts I have ever had! I am so happy I know of this place now and will for sure be recommending it to all my friends who come down to San Francisco! 

I ordered a really basic breakfast, but was blown away by the flavors of the food! I got the two egg breakfast with the pork sausage and eggs over easy with the potatoes. I also got it without the toast due to gluten allergies! The potatoes were for sure the highlight of the breakfast! They were paired with roasted garlic and the seasonings were incredible and perfection! I don't know what they do to them, but they are the most amazing breakfast potatoes I've ever eaten! The eggs were cooked perfectly and seasoned really well also. The sausage was also very flavorful and the texture was good (coming from someone who isn't a pork fan). 

Overall, the staff was also super friendly and really helpful! Please note there was a big line for tables, but I was seated immediately because I was by myself and wanted to sit outside even though the weather was not super favorable. Otherwise there can be long waits and the restaurant is not very big, so any group over four people is definitely gonna take a while! 10/10
author: Raeya D.

description:
People from all over the Richmond district come here to dine (trying to not say eat). 

They got breakfast fare, good coffee, and al fresco seating. Their heat lamps are on steroids, which is good for adipose-challenged people like myself. 

I'd give 5 stars, but their waffle is forgettable. Did I even order one?

Anyway, I'd like to give big-ups to the host with the longish hair. He noticed that some idiotic millennials decided to cut in line and write their party name above people that had been waiting (while snickering and trying to play stupid). I was one of those people. So he erased their name. THANK YOU, GOOD SIR. 

Yeah, I'm calling you and your lame friends out, Nadya. Or whatever your parents named you. Clearly, they didn't teach you crap about etiquette.

Yeah, your sense of entitlement is exactly what's wrong with this city. Go away, Nadya et al.
author: Aren A.

description:
Best breakfast I've had in the city. I'm already craving it after a few hours. 

The service was great. Food came out quickly. We ordered the portobello and spinach benedict, omelette, and banana chocolate pancake. The English muffin that they use for their benedicts was so delicious! The side of salad was fresh and tasty. 

The omelette was fresh and the veggies and bacon were portioned just right. 

The banana chocolate pancake was just wow!!


Very impressed with this spot and definitely recommend.
author: Raisa G.

description:
WE LOVE EATS!!  My family has been coming here for over a year. It is a staple of you weekly family routine. The food is alway awesome, staff are friendly remember regulars and are 5 -stars on service.

Love the yelp waitlist. saves us so much time we can play in the park while we wait for our table.
author: Rayannah S.

description: Excellent excellent little hole in the wall breakfast place close to Chinatown in San Francisco. I got chicken and waffles $15 and wife got some pancakes for $11 and she got a mimosa which was 8 more dollars every meal we got in San Francisco is like 50 bucks so you know it is what it is we live in Louisville and stuff just doesn't cost as much like it does but the meal itself was phenomenal I won't ever be back to San Francisco but if I ever was I would definitely go here 5 out of 5 Stars excellent breakfast
author: Jeremy J.

description:
Eats is definitely one of the better places to eat for breakfast/brunch in the city but that also means it comes with the requisite wait. On weekends there's always a crowd milling around outside waiting for a table so unless you come early or late expect to get a little hangry.

We had a random weekday morning off and decided to take advantage. The place is not huge so we did have to put our names down but we got lucky with tables leaving and managed to get inside in less than 10 minutes.

The servers here were so genuinely nice!  They were very professional. The host updating us that our table would be ready soon and both of the servers making sure to thank us upon leaving. I really appreciated that. It's the kind of thing that I don't expect the average restaurant to pay attention to but when it happens it's really nice!

Breakfast options were varied and I don't think you can stray too wrong with anything on the menu. There's definitely something for everyone with the menu ranging from a variety of omelettes, chicken and waffles, pancakes, huevos rancheros, toasts, and an acai bowl. Waffles were more dense than I like but still tasty and served with a generous helping of homemade whipped cream. Our ham and leek omelette was nice and leeky but missing the gruyere component or it was so subtle that I couldn't taste it. I love that they put whole garlic cloves with the potatoes. Only downside is for the price they don't have the largest portions but at least everything tasted solid. They serve equator coffee which was excellent. I'm a fan.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
So satisfied with the food! Ordered the Fried Chicken Sandwich and the Banana Chocolate Chip pancakes. My friend and I always share our food to get the best of both worlds, especially at new restaurants we are trying, we ordered one savory and one sweet dish. When our food arrived, the sandwich was cut in half and placed on two plates! How thoughtful of the staff! Those mind readers!

The sandwich-- bread was toasted goodness, chicken was spicy good. Yum!

The pancake-- chocolatey, and had a bit of a crisp! Perfection

Tip: if you don't enjoy a long wait, avoid peak dining times
author: Jenny C.

description: This place definitely meets the Yelp hype! The salads, sandwiches and waffles are delicious and worth the long wait time. If you plan on coming here for brunch, I highly recommend making a reservation through yelp beforehand- wait times can go between 30-60 minutes.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: I went to eats for Sunday brunch and was not disappointed! Although the wait was a little long since we came around 1:30, it wasn't too bad because the farmers market was just across the street so it was easy to kill time. I got the pork hash, the boyf got the spinach & portobello Benedict, and we shared the half order of the waffles. Everything was sooo good! They made the eggs PERFECTLY, and the waffle was so satisfying for the end of our meal I wish we got the whole order. The service was fine, seating might have been a little to cramped for my preference. They have an outside seating as well and I think I would've preferred outside on sunny days since the inside was pretty small. Overall good experience!
author: Erica L.

description:
On a friday morning me and the family came by and sampled some of the food. Let me break down what we got to sample and how all of it faired

Chicken and waffles - chicken was crunchy and it was tender, flavor wise it was lacking seasoning, the gravy and mushrooms was thick not heavy more on the healthier side. If you are doing chicken and waffles you already know you are eating bad, mite as well have gravy with bits of sausage on it haha. On a whole the dish have its good points but lack of flavoring and portion wise I would not order it again. 

Mexican Omelette - topped with chips and some bacon, I have to say this dish was my wife's plate, I would rather have had her plate and returned mine, flavor wise, distinct seasoning on her omelette not super heavy but enough to take notice on biting down, definitely recommend her dish over the chicken and waffles

Michelada - served in a older type pickle container I believe, it was heavy and good, always refreshing to start your day off with one of these drinks 

On a nice day this place is decent, I would recommend coming by, but I do not recommend getting the chicken and waffles

food ***
price $$
service **** very friendly staff
ambiance **** quaint, several bikers (not motorcycle bikers) in area
author: Clarence A.

description: This is a good breakfast joint, but expect a long wait. We waited an hour on Monday at 11 am, but luckily we weren't in a hurry. I would've went somewhere else, but my brother loves this place. I had the fried chicken sandwich and tomato basil soup. The sandwich was tasty, but my soup wasn't very creamy. Not a bad place, just not knock your socks off.
author: Ha D.

description:
Great neighborhood spot of brunch/lunch.  Love the cozy feel of the restaurant with a good selection of breakfast and lunch items.  We ordered breakfast items, though it was quite filling and I found that I didn't need to have lunch!  I ordered a breakfast omelette with toast and salad, liked that they could make my omelette dairy free.  Pretty reasonable portions for a reasonable price.  Great to catch up with friends, as there is lots of seating.  Would love to try their wonderful selection of juices next time.

The only thing is that they don't have wifi - would love to see if you can improve this in the future!  Would also love to see if you can offer gluten free bread for those who have sensitivities.
author: Carolyn L.

description: Holy awesome breakfast!!  The Spicy Sausage Polenta is incredible!!  The servers are friendly and talkative and on point!  If you're in San Francisco you have to eat breakfast here.  Sorry for the half eaten pic but I couldn't stop eating it!
author: Brian P.

description:
I came here for Sunday brunch with my friends and the food was good but probably not worth the wait. I got the eggs Benedict and something that I liked is that you can order for half a Benny which is great if you have a small appetite. 
The wait here is very long especially when you come on a weekend and on Sunday's it's pretty crowded because of the Farmers Market on Clement Street. They were giving out waffle samples to the people waiting in line which was really considerate :)
author: Deki T.

description:
Eats has a very chill vibe that can be hard to find at a "trendy" brunch place. The mix of worn wood and plants gave it a modern rustic feel (that I high key want to steal for my own home). Upon arriving we were seated immediately and within minutes we had 2 much needed cups of coffee. The staff here was super attentive, our food was brought to us quickly and our cups were never more than half empty.

The food was great and the use of fresh ingredients made it both instagram worthy and delicious. The cream on my waffle was house made and so fresh it almost made me think I was eating something healthy. I would definitely come back if I'm in town again.
author: Caitlin C.

description:
Eats is yummy! My boyfriend and I came for brunch after he recommended it and I would definitely come back. We got a half order of waffle with fresh berries and whipped cream for the two of us. It was sooo good; that waffle still pops up into my mind! Besides that my boyfriend got the spicy tomato skillet. Again, delicious. I liked his meal more than mine. After some chit chatting with the waitress, she convinced me to get the divorced eggs (she let me know the salsas are made in-house). Maybe it's because I live in Tucson, but the salsas didn't blow me away. The meal wasn't bad per say, it just wasn't as tasty as the other food items we got. 

Service here is good. My cup of coffee was constantly getting refilled (yay!) and food was brought to the table much quicker than I had expected. The place gets busy (there was a bit of a wait to get seated) so quick service is a plus.

One thing I did not like was how the "wait list" was arranged. You basically walk up to dark metal sheet on the side of a dark pole and write your name in with a dry-erase marker. It wasn't made apparent that this was how one got their name on the list and I just think there could be a better way to arrange this. Perhaps simply adding a sign (in a noticeable color) above the board which lets guests know to add their name would suffice. 

Overall, really enjoyed Eats. I still think about that waffle.....
author: Camille G.

description:
I was in baker beach and decided to give this place a shot. I was glad that I could put my name on the waiting list but even though I got a message that my table is ready the waiter explained that we still had to wait for 15 minutes! (What's the point of the waitlist then?) 

Besides that I got the mushroom and spinach eggs benedict and it was pretty good. It came with garlic potatoes and they were well made!
author: Haya D.

description:
This is a popular brunch spot and rightfully so.  Ended up waiting about 30 min around 11:30am on a Sunday and the smiles of satisfied customers as they exited said it all.  

Ended up getting the polenta, tomato and spinach Benedict, and a fruited waffle. 
The food was delicious, portions were decent but could have been a tough larger.  Otherwise this is a good brunch spot and does live up to the hype.
author: Dan O.

description: Good brunch place in the Inner Richmond! I came here with a friend on a Friday at around 11:30am, and there was a line (no surprise since brunch is no joke). We put our names down and decided to walk around for 15 min. When we came back, our names were crossed out so they must've called us, but as we were putting our names back on the waiting list, they seated us immediately outside. I got the Farmers scramble, which is a vegetarian scramble and it comes with potatoes and toast. The scramble was delicious, but I was most disappointed with the potatoes (and they're usually my fave part of the meal!) The potatoes were cold, not crispy, and a little too salty for me. The service wasn't that great, as the server didn't check on us/refill our waters. Not sure if it was because we were sitting outside and we were the furthest table from the entrance or anything. Overall, the food and service was alright, nothing special.
author: Lisa C.

description: one of the best brunches in San Francisco. Consistently delicious and truly never ever gets old.  Always the most amazing servers too. This place is special
author: Leah H.

description: Truly never disappointed. Best pancakes and breakfast sand which. Staff really nice as well
author: Eva A.

description:
I often walk by Eats when going to the farmer's market on Sundays. It is ALWAYS packed! If you come here expecting to be seated in under 30 mins during bunch hours, then you will be a very unhappy guest. That said, I got really lucky and was seated right away when I arrived. Probably helped that I was by myself and the tables here are all very small anyways.

I was really happy with the service here! Everyone was just attentive enough (yay for iced coffee refills) and made sure I was taken care of without being intrusive.

I ordered the acai bowl and fancy avocado toast. The acai bowl is SO WORTH IT! It wasn't too sweet and had just the perfect amount of granola, dried fruit, coconut shavings, and fresh fruit. And it looks beautiful to boot! The avocado toast was alright. I did enjoy the sunflower sprouts on top, but I felt it was a bit oversalted.

All in all, I was happy with my experience, and I will be coming back :)
author: Alice L.

description:
Nothing special. 

Beginning with the iPad's seat list there were upsets. 

It is a shady system to not give a guest a time estimate. Expecting customers to just wait outside until their names reach the top of a list is unrealistic. People have lives and need to know if they'll be here for 30 minutes or 2 hours (we waited for an hour) without warning. 

There are countless other breakfast places I can spend my time at that can cater to the many appetites and pallets of a large group. (Less than a block away) 

When our plates arrived they were soggy in wet, cold yolk. 

The sandwiches fell apart instantly. Very awkward to eat. Ingredients can easily be prepared in smaller cuts that actually fit in a mouth.

Idk how one can mess up a breakfast sandwich they are easily supposed to be a crowd pleaser. 

The potato's were the restaurant's saving grace. 

Go somewhere else with your money and time
author: Rachelle E.

description: Eats is a great brunch spot in the city. You will definitely have to wait to be seated, but it's well worth it. They use Yelp for their waitlist, so once you sign in on their iPad, you can see where you are in line through the Yelp app. Once we were in, I ordered the strawberry lemonade which was a huge win. It was very refreshing. For food, we ordered the huevos rancheros and the waffle berries and cream. Both items were fantastic. The entire menu looked fabulous so I'll definitely be coming back for more.
author: Radhika G.

description: I've been working in the neighborhood for over 2 years now and have just recently found out about this spot. The service was great and I love that they have a waitlist!
author: Marie C.

description: Cool little spot with outdoor seating. They also have an online waiting list which saves a little time. Thought I had my mind set on what I wanted to order for brunch until a waiter walked by with the chicken and waffles which could've converted me from a vegetarian to a carnivore, except I'm not a vegetarian. Needless to say the chicken was delicious and it also had an incredible mushroom gravy. The waffles, however, was ehhh and hence the four stars. But I would definitely come here again.
author: Betty T.

description:
I do know that the people who work at a restaurant don't make a 5 star review. I also know that those people CAN make a 1-2 star review. So who at this restaurant pushed those stars and what did that someone do? 
The affable, and efficient Lars is his name. The food is delicious yes-those succulent roasted potatoes bathed in butter-most everything was so yummy. Waffles and egg dishes done with care and great ingredients but there are a lot of good eats in SF. 
So why wait here? 
Well, not many brunch places have an available waitlist. You can access this from your phone and it tells you when your table will be ready and when to come in. Terrific!! Then there's the food which is scrumptious and filling. Nothing wildly creative, just solid yummy fresh food. 
And then there's Lars. So patient. So nice. So funny. So personable. I'm sure he can read the table so if you're not chatty he'd know that too. 
Love brunch. What a great way to start a lazy Sunday. 

So good this place. 100% sure we will be back.
author: Peddie A.

description:
Solid breakfast place.  Service was excellent.

small place but they move you in and out but you do not feel rushed.

First up, on a chilly SF summer morning, my wife ordered up coffee.  Now if the coffee is not good, that could be the end of breakfast.  It came hot and delicious.   So started out well.

we both ordered the breakfast suite:  eggs, bacon and a waffle berry.  eggs were tasted and good portion.  The bacon was excellent.  Hobbs Bacon.  Cooked as my wife wanted, crispy but not overcooked.   

finally, the waffle berry.  now that is the way to start the day.  Whip cream was solid, the berries were fresh. and waffle was cooked just right.

the pricing was right on.

Oh and across the street was a farmers market.  got some great fruit.

one recommendation is the use yelp app to get on the waitlist.   no reservations accept but yelp app can get you the waitlist.
author: Tim F.

description: This is a small but really nice brunch place in Richmond. Came here around 11:45 am on a weekend we were lucky we didn't have to wait. The menu was pretty extensive for a small restaurant. They had a bit of everything ranging from Benedict's, oatmeal, etc. The wait to order took a few minutes but it wasn't too bad. I've had better chicken and waffles but their other food was good. I also liked the mimosa with the mixed juice.
author: Aimee R.

description:
This is a quality brunch spot. 

The chicken and waffles is one of the best examples of the dish I've had. It comes with a small bowl of surprisingly light, flavorful mushroom gravy, a tiny carafe of syrup, and two roughly 4" square waffles. The chicken reminded me of chicken katsu, was well seasoned and had a nice crisp. 

The basic breakfast, upgraded to the berry waffle, was another nice surprise. Two fluffy scrambled eggs, three pork sausages, and one square waffle absolutely loaded with fresh sweet whipping cream and topped with banana and strawberry slices as well as a sprinkle of blueberries.

At eight on a Monday morning there was no line, but this is the kind of place I wouldn't mind waiting for.
author: Shoole S.

description:
Delicious brunch spot in the Inner Richmond. Be ready for a wait, but they move quick. I recommend the B.A.T. scramble - the bacon was phenomenal and they lost up the cheddar just the way I like it.

They're super friendly and I love the green living wall installments.
author: Krista J.

description:
This is probably my new favorite brunch place. The wait wasn't too bad, especially for a San Francisco brunch spot. Honestly though, any wait would be worth it for their food!! I shared a bowl of fruit with friends (pineapples, bananas, cantaloupe, strawberries, blueberries and raspberries). The fruit was so fresh! I also had their breakfast burrito. AWESOME! It's a huge burrito and I ended up saving half of it for later. I chose the potatoes for my side, and I give those a 10/10. The outside was a little crispy, and the inside soft. And I need to know what they season them with!!! So good. The staff was also very friendly, and so accommodating. They also dressed up as characters from Grease and decorated the place with Rydell paraphernalia. SO CUTE! 
Highly recommend this place!
author: Gina B.

description: Eats is probably one of my favorite breakfast spots in SF. We ordered the Homemade Waffle Berries & Creme and Blueberry Pancakes. The waffle was definitely my favorite out of the two, it was soft and the berries gave it a sweet touch. The blueberry pancakes were thin and there were blueberries inside and on top, which made the pancakes even tastier. I can't wait to come back! I'm definitely getting the waffle again next time.
author: Sophie S.

description:
We went to Eats for breakfast prior to leaving San Francisco. It was definitely worth the mile walk. The place is very inviting and just want you want for a breakfast spot. I had the BAT scramble and it was served with delicious salad and sourdough toast. My wife had the açaí smoothie bowl which was different than anything she had had before. 

The staff was very nice and we will go back when we return to SF!
author: Mike W.

description:
Came to this brunch spot after getting my nails done. We were a party of 2, arrived around 11:15 and got seated around 12 on a Saturday. There were a lot of people waiting and quite a few party of 2's in front of us. So be ready to wait if you want to try this place!

I ordered the huevos rancheros and my friend ordered the divorced eggs and we both ordered the loaded Arnold Palmer. My huevos rancheros was okay, it had avacodo, pico de Gallo, beans, sour cream, pepper jack cheese and over easy eggs all top of a crispy tortilla. My loaded Arnold Palmer was made up of ginger soju, with lemonade and iced tea. My huevos rancheros was good, but I don't know if I would come back here and wait again. If there was no line, sure I would come back. 

I would recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood and want to eat brunch. The staff at eats are very friendly and helpful.
author: Tina W.

description:
Eat's creates an awkward and uncomfortable experience for their customers.  They have for the 3rd time in a row sat us at a table with strangers.  Table for 4, adds us 2, with another random 2 who are already sitting awkwardly waiting for food.  Thought this was a one off.  Second time, different table same thing.  3rd time and last time same thing.

Antisocial you say? Well eating breakfast, groggy, tired, early in the AM I'm not in the mood to "meet new people" or stir up "small talk" with people who don't really want to talk with us either.  It's so uncomfortable I could care less or even remember what the food taste like.  Just wanted to eat and get away each time.

I live one block away so it's frustrating to have a top breakfast place that forces such an uncomfortable experience especially after waiting in line/list for a long time.  

Saw someone busted the windows out recently and they are boarded up.  Guessing others felt the same way and ran straight through the glass.

Just beware: Table for 2 = Table for 4 with strangers.  Possibly cool people, possibly people jacked on too much caffeine, possibly not.  Wouldn't mater either way it's too early for that drama.
author: Shawn L.

description:
Great breakfast spot! They also have tasty Equator coffee. Everything was fresh with quality ingredients. 

Service was speedy and with a smile! Will definitely return when in the neighborhood.
author: Steve S.

description:
Line is always long whenever I pass by here on Sundays.  The secret to getting to eat here without waiting in line is go early when they open since the hipsters/millenials are still asleep. Finally got to eat here with my son one Sunday morning around 830am. It was already a bit full since it's a small place. There were kids since most wake up that early. 
My son and I shared I believe the avocado bacon omelette. Good portion. They have a lot of options including pancakes and waffles. 
Service was good. 
I'd come here when wait is short or no wait at all when I'm with my kid.
author: Claire J.

description: The Mexican scramble is super yummy! They are also very accommodating to gluten free and dairy free diets.
author: Daina L.

description:
I usually see a long line outside of Eats but we came here the day after Christmas for brunch and only had to wait 15 minutes for a group of 3 of us. Service was steady and all of our food came out at a reasonable time. I ordered the Acai Smoothie Bowl and it was delicious. My other two friends got the Cowboy Burrito and it was pleasantly filling. You can also choose a side of potatoes or salad with it. They also have a friendly kid's menu of pancakes and eggs.
I would say I wouldn't wait more than half an hour to eat here but if you want to experience the San Francisco brunch scene, you should definitely try Eats.
author: Grace L.

description:
This place has out of this word brunch and cocktails. I highly recommend the Arnold palmer, it was balanced but also packed a punch. The breakfast items came out perfectly cooked. If I lived in the area I would be there for brunch all the time.
In addition to the delicious food there was a farmers market right across the street!
author: Christine M.

description: Everything was delish! Had a scramble with spinach. My friends had the fried chicken with egg.  Service was great. Small but very cute!
author: Lissette T.

description: The food here was great, so was the service except for one problem.  When I walked in there was no line, and I was seated immediately at one of the front tables next to the window (indoors).  Then after being there with coffee and waiting for food, the waitress randomly asks if it's okay to move me.  I said sure, but then I realized she took everything on the table to the back corner of the restaurant.  I didn't want to be rude so I just went with it.  She didn't say why I was being moved, I wasn't being disruptive or ask to move.  Then soon after being seated at the new table I see two men being seated at the table I was originally at.  Did they ask for the table specifically or did she decide to put them there?  I honestly don't understand why, they came in after I did.  The food and drinks were good, I like how they serve refills but this situation made me feel unwelcome or low priority in the restaurant.  At restaurants I never ask to move and I have never been moved by an employee in order to make room for another party.  I would have gone somewhere else but my friend invited me here and I had to meet them here.
author: Lola S.

description: Between the quality of food, wait staff, and cooks, this was by far one of the best brunch spots I've been to. Everyone was so kind and the food was everything you'd want in a brunch. Waffles, omelets, eggs, + so much more. If we weren't in Cali for travel this would be a definite reoccurring go-to spot.
author: Leah T.

description:
Super hospitable staff and an easy breakfast experience... 

I enjoyed a light breakfast consisting of avocado toast with a poached egg and a cup of their house coffee. They serve Equator, which is an awesome blend that will really get you ready for the day! I tried a bit of my friend's almond butter/banana toast. It was a healthy alternative to pancakes/waffles!

I will definitely try to stop in again to try other things on the menu.
author: Sarin P.

description: Came here for breakfast while on my vacation to San Fran and I'm so glad i did ! The food is amazing ! And the service was great too ! I got fried chicken and waffles with a side of potatoes and the refresher juice ! It was so good
author: Candace H.

description: Delicious food, you have to try the waffles with cream and berries, they are the best! My son got chicken and waffles. The omlete was freat and full of veggies
author: Angie G.

description: Wow, this place was amazing! My husband ordered the Huevos Rancheros, however what he got was chilaquiles, which caused entree envy. The dish was executed perfectly, everything was crisp and savory. I went for sweet and got a banana chocolate chip pancake, although not difficult to make, again it was a perfect pancake, as this seems to be something that is easily messed up. We also really enjoyed our mimosas that were served in regular drinking glasses instead of champagne flutes, which made them more generous in size which we appreciated ;). Can't wait to come back to explore the menu further. Also, I was impressed that although we were sitting outside, the staff came out multiple times to come check on us, so we were not forgotten - good job!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Based on reviews I decided to give Eats a try.  Strolled in around 9:15 on a Tuesday morning.  Place was about 3/4 full and we were seated right away.  Service was very prompt and courteous.

Perused the menu and settled on the spinach and portabella mushroom eggs benedict with a side order of the spicy Italian sausage.  Let's start with the benedict - perfectly poached eggs, succulent spinach and mushrooms with just enough bite for a wonderful mouthfeel.  The hollandaise was perfectly tart and creamy, and the muffin was extremely fresh, with an almost brioche-like taste!  The Italian sausage was split lengthwise and grilled on the flat top - nice flavor but not nearly enough kick to be called "spicy."  Oh and don't forget the potatoes - crispy exterior, exploding with herbaceous flavor courtesy of the whole roasted garlic cloves and fresh sprigs of thyme.

Can't wait to go back and explore the menu further.  Nom Nom!!
author: Damon C.

description: Yeah. That Lox omelette has been my go- to here. They have (so far) accommodated my allergy limitations.    Service is always good and speedy.
author: J. G.

description:
The fruit and waffles are DELICIOUS. Probably the best waffle I've ever had. Real maple syrup and the whip cream so tasty. Ugh I wish I could eat here every morning but my waistline is happy that I can't. 

It seemed like the chefs messed up the orders a lot because the waiters were annoyed and kept pointing out the things they didn't notice on the food orders which I'm writing this more so for the owners... also makes service slower, it was busy the day I went and took a bit to get my food but I wasn't in a rush so it was fine. I'm sure it's quicker other times of day or maybe the chefs were new? 

Anyway I love this place for the waffles and will be back.
author: Ellie R.

description: Long wait, but you can check in on yelp and it lets you know your wait time and the number of parties in front of you. Worked great, so really only had a short wait by the time we got to the restaurant.  Had the spicy tomatoes skillet, which was really good. Also got an English muffin with jam--the jam was amazing and the muffin was different than any other I've had, sort of a cross between an English muffin and a biscuit.  Friendly service with a smile. Overall great spot!
author: Umesh J.

description: Fooood is delicious, the best part is display & appearance but I promise it even tastes better than it looks. Beautiful area to sit outside and the service was great! I am going to be back Eats...
author: Amani K.

description: Great breakfast place. We ordered the Spicy tomato skillet and Lox plate. Both were delicious. A plate of fries is also a great way to start your morning. Will return!
author: Jake D.

description: I love it here. I've been a 3 or 4 times in the 4 wks I've been here and the food is great. Just authentic good meal. Will be going again. Fast service and drinks are good too.
author: Sonya F.

description:
Breakfast sandwich is the go to! Potatoes are to die for & their garlic tastes like potatoes after taking the shell off. The portions are pretty small. 

We came here on a Sunday & it was PACKED. There's always a farmers market so plan to Uber or bus here because it took forever to find parking.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Yaaassss!

Excellent chicken and waffles. And that mushroom gravy? That's some serious deliciousness right there. Their beet juice mix was also delicious. The coffee was kinda just "diner coffee," imo, but ymmv.

I should probably try other things on the menu but, damn, the chicken and waffles just keep calling my name. And who am I to say no.
author: Neha B.

description: Enjoyed the breakfast suite and sipped some coffee at this pleasant little eatery! Tried their homegrown with organic ketchup and was blown away by the flavor! Great breakfast place in the area! Will definitely be there again.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Fantastic breakfast, brunch and lunch spot! Wonderful staff and a friendly atmosphere.
author: Catherine M.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by the great service here.  Didn't get our waiter's name, but he had longish half black and brown hair.   Really nice dude, very welcoming.  

Now the food, important part; we had Power C juice that was fantastic, a breakfast sandwich that exploded perfect egg yolk when bitten, the pork hash, and the cowboy burrito.   All were great, only thing I wish was that the burrito had a little more tritip in it!  

Will be coming back soon.
author: Calvin D.

description: Definitely get here before 10:30am lol especially on the weekends..I come here when I'm craving waffles plus it's close by lol...service is fast and pleasant, on my pass two visits I got the sweet homemade waffles with fruits and whip cream.. once with a side of bacon and the today home fries...good balance between sweet and savory,if your in the area check them out
author: jonathan h.

description: Came here for brunch on Friday , pretty busy, service was okay, food was good. I ordered huevos ranchero and it was awesome. Overall good environment . Will recommend !
author: Cynthia L.

description: This place I found was by mistake cute little corner restaurant. Party of two seating was fairly quick. Ordered a bagel for a starter along with mimosas nothing really special about that. Now to the good part; Top 5 chicken & waffle. Simple yet the perfect crisp for these stars of a dish. Everything was good, I only give 4 stars because it's not much space or privacy but overall great experience! Can't wait until next time.
author: Unique T.

description: Woooonderful benedicts, great and friendly service, and the cozy atmosphere make this a perfect breakfast spot. Beware that there will be a line outside on weekends BUT you can use Yelp to sign in before you get there. Also, the pancakes are really good and come with real maple syrup!
author: Bernadette S.

description:
RE: Katy C's review:

Just to help out other Yelpers, Katy's review must be for some other restaurant:

1) Her review says that Yelp "reserve seating" is available- but Eats on Clement Street in San Francisco does not take reservations of any kind. Plus, Eats does not have this functionality on on Yelp app - I have just now confirmed this. Eats uses the same metal sign-up board outside that they have used for years. Busy and NO reservations..... She must be thinking of another restaurant.

2) The review says that portions are small. I cannot image anyone referring to Eats portions as small. Again, she must be thinking of another restaurant.

3) No such thing as "combo" meals on the menu. She must be thinking of another restaurant.

4) For San Francisco, Eats is average price - definitely not pricy. As mentioned before, she must be thinking of another restaurant.
author: Aric H.

description: Excellent brunch.  20 minute wait at 9:45 on a Saturday, not terrible. Service is super fast, food is realllly good and portions are correctly sized so you don't feel like dying afterwards.  Great spot!
author: Jenna C.

description:
Spinach Portobello Benedict: Although a little more flavor wouldn't hurt, this dish was enjoyable. The poached eggs were cooked wonderfully! The accompanied salad was a bit overdressed, but that wasn't too big of a problem.

Pulled Pork Hash: The pulled pork itself was soft and tender, and the overall dish was full of flavors and textures from the potatoes, bell peppers, onions... topped with two beautiful sunny side eggs. This eaten with some bread was delicious! 

Chicken & Waffles: Chicken was unappetizingly dry... to the point where I actually ate just the crispy skin with the waffles...!! The waffles were also extremely dense, thick, and hard?? It was no doubt the least favorite dish..

Service was good. We sat near the door and it was pretty cold, especially every time the door opened and closed... maybe that's just us.. haha. 

I don't see myself wanting to come back.
author: Kris C.

description:
One of my favorite place for a Brunch! Always a line during the weekend well even during the week days :)
But it's worth the wait! Sunday put your name and walk to the farmer market!
The food at eats is simple but so well executed!
The side of potatoes with the garlic is the best side to pick!! I highly recommend the waffle bacon .
author: Geraldine F.

description: Came in on a Sunday with a large group and they were able to get us a table pretty quick (but definitely not the spot for a large group due to the small inside seating). The food was great but when we were there they ran out of bagels and english muffins which was disappointing for a breakfast place especially when we came in at noon. The mimosas were the best part and this is a great lil spot in SF. Friendly staff as well. Definitely would come back. Its a little cold inside so don't forget a jacket!
author: Lejla S.

description: Came here for breakfast a couple different times within a week! The first time was pretty good. A couple of us had waffles with our dishes and were definitely too dry and even butter and syrup couldn't save them. The fried chicken was great-crispy and flavorful. The eggs were also delicious. Great service, large portions and good prices. Would recommend!
author: Emily F.

description: Super crowded can be super frustrating, but not here!  You can 'put your name in' on Yelp or at the tablet there so It's easy to keep track of when youll be seated and you can run around to the little shops if you're that person, and on Sun a great farmers market right there to kill the time.  Courteous but efficient staff. Real food, delicious.  After a night out and a hotel stay at Hotel Dumb, this was the perfect way to remind me of how triumphant it is to find the gems in SF!
author: Karen C.

description: A cozy space with lots of sunlight on a corner serving quick meals with friendly service, breakfast or brunch. Food always seems consistently good, but I can never order anything else but the pancakes. Just great. Weekdays, after 10am is when you will find me there.
author: scott p.

description: A solid brunch with a little something special. The food is really reliably good. Great options, with not too overwhelming of a menu. Definitely somewhere you could feel comfortable after stumbling out of bed on a Sunday after a rough night out- try the tomato skillet, fried chicken sandwich or just a good ol bacon egg combo
author: Nina S.

description:
Good breakfast menu. Liked my omelette with fresh pico.

Wife had a chicken sando that was killer
author: Dave D.

description: Love that you can get on the waitlist through yelp. we only had to wait 5 minutes to get in. Only 4 stars because as my 18 year-old son said portion were on the small side. But the food you did get was delicious and comforting. I recommend the chicken and waffles. Thick waffles boneless breast. Side of mushroom gravy.
author: Rebecca N.

description:
Great place for breakfast.  Knowing the wait during the weekends, I was hoping there wouldn't be during the weekday.  There wasn't, but it was crowded.  

I ordered the Breakfast Suite that comes with 2 eggs, a choice of bacon or sausage, and a waffle.  It's quite filling even though it doesn't look much.  The waffle was crunchy although the syrup was a bit bland even though I kept pouring it on.

I'm hoping to come back again to try other items.
author: Karen L.

description: Very good breakfast. There were four of us and all enjoyed thoroughly. Portions were ample. The farmers omelette was sensational (mine) the others had fried chicken and waffles and salmon eggs Benedict. There was a wait but worth it. Would go again.
author: Mike H.

description: We waited about 45 minutes at 10am on Sunday. We did not know you can add your name to the waitlist through the Yelp app before you arrive. Expected the long wait so we walked around the farmers market. We sat outside and were greeted shortly after we sat down. We ordered two dishes the waitress recommended-- the cowboy burrito and Mexican scramble. The scramble was crunchy and tasty. The cowboy burrito was good but didn't have that much tri tip steak. Overall solid breakfast and left very full!
author: Rachel Q.

description: The egg sandwich with the avocado would bring me back  and my daughters pancakes were also tasty. My husband had the suite and liked his scrambled eggs but the waffle was smaller than my daughters kid pancakes  .  Prices weren't bad either.  I would come back.
author: alex p.

description:
It's a small little cafe, but really hipster. The food is typical for any brunch spot, but a little on the pricey side.

Still really good and plus they have different flavored mimosas, which is always a plus.
author: Nicole N.

description: When you're closed you can turn off the waitlist so people don't park, pay, and then walk to find out you're closed.
author: Sharon G.

description: This place is great! I've had the eggs Benedict and berry waffle and both were great! The staff is friendly and attentive. One star off because their tip calculator on the bottom of the receipt gives you the percentages after tax is added. It should go before tax. Feels sneaky!
author: Stephanie L.

description: 4 star rating on yelp???? No thanks. I was really enjoying my waffle berries and cream til I found plastic wrap baked inside my waffle!! They were nice enough to not charge  me for my food I guess.
author: Alissa T.

description:
Walked in around 1 pm on a Sunday for a late brunch and it was extremely busy! We waited almost an hour for a group of 2 outside in the cold to be seated (after being told the wait would be under 30 mins) so get there early. The perks: if you go on a Sunday, there's a Farmer's Market nearby on Clements so you can explore while you wait. 

What we ordered: 
House coffee, which was average but did the job and wasn't bad. 
Spinach and Portobello Mushroom Benedict w/ a side of Chicken Sausage. Potatoes had rosemary & roasted garlic - all delish!! 
Very bland Mexican Scramble that was pretty much unseasoned scrambled eggs with soggy tortilla chips and black beans thrown in, do not recommend especially after waiting so long to get seated!! 
Also ordered the waffle as a side and was very good! 

Other than the long wait and Mexican Scramble, the service was great and the food came out surprisingly quick. Would we come back? Probably not. But was it terrible and do we not recommend? Not at all. Definitely give it a try... possibly on a slower day!
author: Tricia Angela L.

description:
We enjoyed eating at Eats when we were in San Francisco. Coffee was good, mimosas were obviously fantastic, and everyone liked their breakfasts. I had Ghiradelli Chocolate and blueberry waffles and whipped cream (their special of the day), because when in San Francisco! They were heavenly and magical. Everyone else in my group got normal adult meals (where's the fun in that?) and everything was delicious. 

It is a small cafe and we were 4 people squished at what should have been a 2-3 person table max (one side was a wall). We were squeezed next to the table next to us and I was brushing against the lady and her baby most of the meal. I think they could have done better with fitting the groups they had at the various tables, or waiting to seat groups more appropriately. They also forgot a couple items we'd ordered and we had to ask a few times for water/coffee/sides.

All in all, food was great, and we'd come back again.
author: Gabbi W.

description: From the food to the service to the food again! I had such a wonderful experience at Eats! We sat in a large group and we had a great time. The ambiance was welcoming and cozy. Everything we ate was delicious and memorable. I highly recommend the pork hash! Absolute perfection! Our water glasses never went empty and all of the restaurant staff was so warm and friendly. My new favorite breakfast spot in the city! I'd totally Eats here again!!!!!!!
author: jordan L.

description:
Usually the lines are really long on the weekend so I'm glad to see seats available on a sunny Friday afternoon.  I was gona get the waffle, bacon, and eggs but made a last minute switch and got a sandwich.

Breakfast sandwich with bacon and fries - The bacon was nice and crispy. The runny egg made it really messy to eat but then again, I'm naturally a messy eater so it could've just been me.  The fries were fried twice making it crispy just like how i like it.

Ben (server) was fun to joke around with.  He actually recommended double frying the fries to make it crispy; he knows me so well! *swoon*

Friendly service.  Good fries.
author: Linda N.

description:
The go-to brunch place on Clement.

It's very popular for brunch on Sundays (and Saturdays, although the line is slightly shorter) and expect to stand in line for about 15 minutes - if you're more than three people that would be about 30 minutes.

The staff is super nice and friendly. Would definitely wanna go here again!

I had the Eggs Benedict with spinach and portobella which was near-perfect (in my book at least) and some really nice roasted potatoes. The saltiness of the English muffins in the Eggs Benedict complemented the sweetness of the spinach and poached eggs quite nicely, and was just overall a great brunch meal. 

For mimosas - if you're 3 people go for the caraffe - if you're more go for the MYOM (make-your-own-mimosas) which will give you a bottle of sparkling wine and a small bottle of juice which will give about one mimosa each for 6 people (although there's not that much juice).
author: Malthe J.

description:
