Not recommended for bigger parties (i.e., more than 4 people).  We came as a group of 7 after mass this past Sunday, knowing we would probably have to wait.  Luckily the farmer's market was going on, there was something to do and fruit samples to munch on if the hanger kicked in.  We were third on the board, but because we were a big party, we had to wait for the bigger table in the back to open up.  I would say we waited for 30 mins or longer.  They kept us in the loop the whole time, so that was nice!  Waiting sucks, but sometimes it's worth it!  Once we got seated, they took our drink orders and dropped a waffle with berries and whip on our table!  The followed it up with a "thanks for waiting."  Super nice surprise, since other places just treat it as the norm.  The waffle was SO good by the way.  I would get it again and again if I didn't worry about my waistline.

I got the polenta with spinach, just because I never see that on menus.  It was delicious but not something I would get again.  It was very savory and heavy, so not recommended if you want something on the lighter end (which I usually opt for).  Everyone else at our table also gobbled their food up.  Zero complaints on the food end.  Everything was great, including our waiter and all the other staff we interacted with. 

Great experience at Eats!  Awesome staff, awesome food.  Definitely be prepared for a wait (and don't be a jerk about it - being nice/patient pays off sometimes).
author: Vivian L.

description:
Eats.....where everybody knows your name. Well, mine at least. Especially if you eat Eats' as frequently as I do.

What makes this a great dining option? First, it is locally owned. Great diverse menu for breakfast and brunch options. I am more of a one trick pony, choosing to stay within a narrowly proscribed set of selections, namely the side waffle and two eggs scrambled (hard). And then there are the oatmeal, blueberry pancakes, cowboy burrito and huevos rancheros. 

Friendly service, clean environment and fairly reasonable prices (if you live in SF you really no right to complain about the cost of a meal as you are already choosing to live in a city with the highest rents). 

A few of the downsides would be access: Street parking on 2nd and Clement streets are very difficult to find, so you might consider public transit or a taxi. Can't dine outdoors due to the weather, but that is beyond the control of management. And on the weekends they do fill up quickly so get there on time.
author: Eric K.

description:
I'm addicted to their pancakes. such a cute spot. Service is always on point and friendly.

I get up early to beat the crowds, which flock to this place, understandably.
author: rik p.

description:
I enjoyed the Ham and Tomato Benedict with potatoes on a typical cold morning in San Francisco. My mind was heavy during the time I was being served, but if there's something that can somewhat cheer me up-- it's food. It sure was comforting and allowed me to enjoy the goodness of the food in the moment. Our server was sweet, and therefore lightened up the start of my day. 

Eats is a bit of a wait on weekends, and when we came to put our name on the board that is located outside, we had 10 names ahead of us. I walked down the street to grab some coffee and came back and we were halfway near the top of the list. Overall it was about a 45 minute wait but worth it. 

I would come back to try something else. Possibly pancakes since thy serve REAL maple syrup!
author: Annie N.

description: Eats was a great way start the morning, really great food and good vibe for a little restaurant and all the waitstaff is super friendly and accommodating. Downside is that long line on the brunch wait but I guess that's every good spot.
author: Negeen E.

description: Best breakfast joint in SF. My wife and I used to live in the neighborhood a couple of years ago. We came back to visit and this place is still the same great breakfast and juices. Always a great choice.
author: Sean S.

description: Best bloody mary evveerrr!!!! Its my first time having a bloody mary with soju and i may never have it with anything else everr again!
author: Mixa M.

description:
Came here on a whim while looking for a late brunch place in the area, and so glad we did! It's a small, cute place but was empty since we arrived thirty minutes before closing on a Wednesday afternoon. I was disappointed to learn that they took the ricotta pancakes off the menu, so we settled for their Homemade Waffle Berries & Creme and it was amazing- light, fluffy, and the perfect amount of sweet. The pork hash was delicious and not too salty, as I find most hash dishes to be.

Also, the waiter was super friendly and even chatted with us about cameras, seeing that a couple of ours took up half the table.
author: Winnie N.

description: Good, not great. Omelette comes like an egg pancake instead of feeling being integrated in the eggs...but ok. Service not great, was pretty cold and I was alone waiting outside at 10:30 in the middle of the week and a young woman made me wait outside in a pretty rude way... refill of regular coffee never came
author: Patricia W.

description: Quality brunch. I have tried nearly every item on the menu. The brunch is always excellent. I come here often since there is no wait on weekdays.
author: Martin N.

description: I went there once and was ready to go back again. I had the tri tip sandwich and it was great. Unfortunately I had to take the meat out and cook it further because you can't eat any semi rare meat what so ever pregnant and they cooked it perfect at medium. It was so juicy. , I wanted so bad to eat it the way it was. The flavors were bold and the fries were crispy.  I forgot to tell them to over cook my meat. I also had the refresher which was great (cucumber flavor). I am looking forward to going back . It was a nice find while visiting the CPMC.
author: Tiff J.

description: Want to give one star so no one else will go there. Best place in the city for breakfast.
author: Emily R.

description:
SERVICE: I want to emphasize the service I received here. It. was. amazing. The waiter was very friendly and I was very impressed with his personality. He came to our table, and put his hand on my shoulder and asked me how I was doing today. I know that not everyone likes to be touched so this could be noted as a red flag in some cases but I personally thought it was a very warm approach and it made me feel welcomed. He would throw in jokes when he checked in on his tables and was quick on the coffee refills. I did not catch him name but he was an Asian gentleman with tattoos on on his arms and legs. 5 stars for service. 

FOOD: The food was very tasty. I ordered the chicken and waffles (~$13). The chicken was prepared sort of "country fried" style. Very tender white meat and came with a side of mushroom gravy and lemon wedge. The waffles were a little burnt on the edges but it was insignificant to the overall experience. 

ATMOSPHERE: Ambiance was trendy. Tables and parts of the walls were covered in dark wood and the restaurant was well lit with natural lightning, giving the interior that modern, hipster vibe. 

OVERALL: 4 stars based off my first impressions. I will definitely come here again to see if my initial thoughts are met with consistency!
author: Greg Y.

description: This place is ridiculously yummy and turns over tables rather quickly - so don't let the wait list scare you.
author: Nick S.

description:
BIG FAN! Just tried this place on the advice of my friends. WOW! Only a handful of people in the place so I got a lot of attention from Jonathan who by the way couldn't have been more fun or full of energy. He told me his three favorite items on the menu so I decided on his first favorite. The Breakfast Sandwich! (arugula, cheddar, tomatoes, spicy aioli, over-easy egg on a ciabatta bread with potatoes. I added a side of the mushroom gravy just because I wanted to taste it. SHUT THE FRONT DOOR BECAUSE DADDY IS HOME! The breakfast sandwich was outstanding and I'd have it again in a heartbeat. The potatoes were cooked perfectly and enjoyed the big hunks of garlic they grilled with them. Finally the coffee... they could've missed the mark and made weak coffee.. they again didn't disappoint me. 
Solid work Eats! I will be back and have a feeling you'll be my go to lunch stop.
author: Kyle G.

description: Excellent breakfast. The wait was brief given it's popularity. Ashan is a wonderful server; very attentive and gracious.
author: Laura C.

description: Had Brunch here today. Pretty good. Service is good and attentive, actually, all the food presented seemed nice. I had the steak salad, the salad of which was very nice, the steak was only okay. Not sure what was going on there, seemed like it was twice cooked or something. Could have been more rare for my liking. People I was with got a smoothie of some kind, beet ginger something or other, which I tried a sip of and was quite tasty.  Amazingly, the total for three people was $51! Seems like a miracle these days. I would return here if I was in the area, but no reason to go out of my way to come back.
author: Alex O.

description:
As someone who has lived In the neighborhood for my whole life, I have experienced the change in ownership and seriously wanted to hate this place after the kind Korean couple retired. But it's really hard when they give quality food made with fresh ingredients. There is a nice spread of options. 

Other bonuses include:
Clean well lit bathroom
Friendly service
Dog friendly outside seating 
Multiple flavors for mimosas including Granny Smith 
Also check out the freshly made juices
author: Elaine L.

description:
A firm solid.

If you're in the richmond, & you need breakfast, then you're going to end up here.

The neighborhood breakfast joint on the corner.  

The space itself is light & airy...it's just small.  So it gets cramped.  And it can get crazy busy.  

And you can forget about parking.  

But once you get your coffee & eggs, all is pretty much forgiven.

If you make the mistake of coming on a weekend, it better be early.  No reservations, so you'll have to wait for a table.  It's not a crazy wait like at Mama's, though.

If you have the option, I'd recommend going on a weekday.  It makes all the difference between a leisurely breakfast, & a hurried one.

I've done the french toast, & I've done scrambles & omelettes.  This is a good spot for a hearty, comfort breakfast.  

All good, but nothing extraordinary.

They can't all be Mama's.  

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Went here on an early Saturday morning weekend trip to San Francisco and loved it! We started with Bloody Mary's, which ended up being delicious! My girlfriend and I got the chicken and waffles and the Mexican scramble! They were both great! The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is because it did take a little while to get our food, but other than that I would highly recommend this place!
author: Dain M.

description: Three weeks ago, My Auntie and I went here for the first time. The place was easy to spot, since it was located right on the corner. We sat near the entrance. The atmosphere was friendly and the decor was modern. I had the Patty Melt. They reinvented it. Definitely refined and classy. More on the healthier side. It looked and tasted Amazing! Not at all greasy or fatty. I requested fresh ginger to be placed in my jasmine tea.  Our waiter, Jacob (if my memory serves me well) was kind enough to honor my requests without hesitation. It felt good to know customer service is still alive and my needs were met. I will definitely go back just for Jacob's services and personality.
author: Toi E.

description:
Service was great. We weren't aware or rather didn't look at closing time but showed up at 2pm. We were greeted and sat promptly. The server was nice and attentive. She noticed we were debating on flavors of mimosa and suggested green apple freshly squeezed which I'm glad she did it was Delish. Food was fast and delicious. I wasn't looking for Heavy so I went with the lox plate which did not let me down. My friend got the pork hash and was very satisfied. My boyfriend got the Tri-Tip sandwich and only comment was there wasn't a lot of meat. The Spicy Aioli was very good though. Ate it with the fries. 
Overall great atmosphere and service. 
Will be back for sure
author: Myrhissa B.

description: A small yet delicious brunch place to try out. I came here with my friend and we had the spicy tomato skillet, the banana and chocolate pancakes, and the bacon waffle. Everything was so delicious and filling, and the staff were very friendly!
author: Monica-Leah A.

description:
I've been here 3 times. The first 2 times would have warranted this place an easy 4 stars for the location (The Richmond isn't the spot for brunch) and convenience, with classic brunch options and some Mexican inspiration. The food hits the spot, but isn't the creme de la creme of SF brunch. I believe hot coffee comes with free refills, which I appreciate a lot.

The 2 star review is for the service. I was very surprised with the lack of service today. I know that today in particular is a holiday ("Easter Sunday"), but we came at about 1:50pm when it wasn't as busy as Eats typically gets. We were seated immediately with no wait, but received little service after that... We were ready to order quickly because we wanted to be respectful f their time, but it honestly took 5+ minutes to flag anyone down. It seemed like there were 6 staff members of the floor, but only 1 woman was really serving. The majority of the staff seemed preoccupied with closing chores. As a waitress myself, I understand on busy the days you just want to GTFO of work, but failure to pay attention to customers only makes it longer for everyone. The food was ready pretty fast, but no one was serving. The cooks were definitely rushing since I'm sure they wanted to get out too. I watched for a few minutes as the hot food just sat there in a long queue, waiting to be served. Staff was busy either 1) closing the store before closing time 2) hanging out with customers. I really do have empathy for seeing your friends and doing your closing chores early, but there's a certain balance with work that you should strike to be productive and save everyone's time. Our eggs benedict was cooked all the way through, like a 100% boiled egg. 

This restaurant is a fine establishment, and hopefully my review only applies to holidays or busy days.
author: Jacquelyn T.

description:
It was late afternoon last Saturday, and we were in the Richmond. I was doing some historical research for a novel, with my husband and a writer friend in tow. On weekends, when in San Francisco with brunch intentions, it pays to wait and go late - helps you avoid the sidewalk crush of pert and early birds clamoring for avocado toast.

Eats was still semi-populous around noon-thirty (they close around two, I believe), but not overrun - and they have a pretty great kindergarten-tested method for wrangling the unruly masses: you write your own name and party number on a chalkboard posted on a pillar outside, and the house staff works off that.

It's something of an honor system with intermittent oversight. Knowing human nature, I had some doubts - otherwise upstanding people can get pretty sociopathic about brunch, and one could see where some Unconscionable could attempt to game the system; obviously as people are seated, names get erased, leaving tempting blank space above those still waiting.

Theoretically, an unscrupulous would-be diner could attempt to exploit such a loophole while feigning ignorance. And indeed, some sketchy late-comers did attempt to write their names above, instead of below, visibly worrying two foreign tourist girls with the same party number, who had been politely waiting for at least a half-hour.

Would America prove to be a land of chicanery and vice and brunch deferred?

Resoundingly, no.

The guy playing the part of host/waitron/houseman/line monitor that day was a seasoned do-no-harm-but-take-no-shit professional hospitality maven - firm and directed, but never once crossing the line into brusque or rude, which is frankly a tough line to walk. With an iron command of both chalk and board, he took one glance at the rogue names, re-wrote them below, erased them with a definitive flourish, and slapped the eraser back onto the board like it had personally insulted his mother.

I didn't catch his name, but he was super cute, Asian, and had the stone-faced gravitas of a young Chuck Connors in dealing with the general shenanigans of the huddled and hungry denizens. As a former waitress, I swooned.

Despite his (admirable) chalkboard tough-love, as a server he proved to be charming and good-natured, with a sense of humor and general savoir-faire that is rare and valuable in someone who works with the public.

When I couldn't decide between the Mexican Scramble and the Divorce Eggs (come on, you want to eat them based on the name alone, don't you?), and asked his opinion, he said, "Tell you what - get the Mexican scramble, and I'll bring you the tomatillo salsa so you can have the best of both worlds."

A man of decisive generosity - who could ask for anything more?

My husband quite happily ensconced in his cowboy breakfast burrito, my friend was favorably impressed by her lox scramble with capers and cream cheese, and I have to say the bloody mary was just great - a perfect savory balance, well-seasoned and served in a wide-mouthed mason jar, apropos for the classy person we all are on a Saturday afternoon.

Eats is a nice space, too - a neighborhood joint with actual aesthetic, close and cozy tables, but a clientele you don't mind cozying up to, and with less customer competition to beat off, being slightly off the beaten path.

We shall certainly return forthwith on our next sojourn from Seattle!
author: Nicolase M.

description: Delish and worth the wait on a busy Saturday. The spicy tomato skillet was so hearty and healthy. It was an unexpected treat for breakfast!
author: Nicole Y.

description: This restaurant understands me.  Delicious breakfast with vegetarian options.   Mmmmmm.   Can't wait to go back.
author: Dennis W.

description: Small brunch spot, make sure you're ready for the wait!  Like my omelette =).  Will be back soon.
author: Allie D.

description: Stopped in for breakfast and got the "Breakfast Suite". It was simple breakfast food, nothing fancy but very fresh and delicious. Will definitely return.
author: Katie K.

description:
The wait staff exemplifies great service. Cowboy burrito, Pork hash, the chilequiles (differently named on the menu but I can't remember right now), egg sandwich, waffle bacon, all winners. 

Remember that the board to put your name down is on the load bearing column outside, and while you wait you can people watch folks fail to realize this, only to have the ever patient service team remind someone who goes through the door with a curious look on their face.

Go early, or expect to wait awhile, but it's worth it every time. If you have kids they are accommodating with street chalk to provide some entertainment.

An anchor in the neighborhood - go here then grab fresh fruit and vegetables at the Farmer's Market!
author: Jordan M.

description: Eats holds a special place in my heart because it's where my fiance and I had our first meal together (insert "AWWW" here). Besides that pretty big conflict of interest the food and service are great! The last time I was here there was a minor incident during our meal and their customer service to address it was phenomenal.
author: Emma B.

description: Solid 4+ Stars. I was pleasantly surprised by this weekday breakfast. Food was really good (4 stars). I had the monstrous breakfast sandwich with potatoes (that I could only eat half of). Where they really got me was the service. This was the best service I've had in SF in a while.
author: Naomi W.

description: Great Breakfast! Staff isn't super friendly and defiantly don't check on your when you are eating. But good food.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Great restaurant but they do NOT have tofu reviewers on Yelp mention. The waitress confirmed that yelp has misinformation about this. There is very little for the plant-based types to eat here. That said they do try to be accommodating with things like avocado and making veggie versions of sandwiches. Overall it's a challenge though. Example :Vegans can order whole wheat toast w/avocado, EVOO & Balsamic. It's quite good and only $1.75 for the bread.
author: Athonia C.

description:
We came here for brunch.  I got the chicken and waffles - something I always wanted to get but never tried for fear of high calories.  Well we hiked in the morning so I get a treat right?  Chicken was fried to perfection.  It was dipped in panko crumbs.  Waffles were good too.  Not too dry.

Service was stellar.  They leave you alone but when they come over they are friendly.  

Food here is expensive.  I think we paid $22/person (tip tax healthySF etc).

Great local brunch place!
author: Wendy H.

description: Thoughtful menu. Delicious food. Nice decor. Highly recommend.
author: Freya-Loki O.

description: Yum! This place did not disappoint you are able to add yourself on to the waitlist right on yelp so by the time I got there my table was almost ready. Great food and great service I would definitely come back.
author: Ashlee S.

description:
Great neighborhood restaurant. Come after 1pm if you want to miss the brunch rush on the weekend since the place is small. Otherwise if you're coming on a Sunday, put your name down on the board and wander around the farmers market! 

Top choices:
- spicy tomato skillet (good flavor, but pretty spicy)
- waffles (love the berries)
- chicken and waffles (good but its a breaded chicken piece versus a fried wing)

Great service and vibes at this local brunch spot.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I love having a cute little breakfast spot right around the corner from my apartment! It's especially great since a lot of the Inner Richmond options are Asian Restaurants and not open for brunch!

I'm a huge fan of the breakfast sandwich. It's large--definitely sharable! The eggs are soft cooked so they ooze everywhere. The ciabata bread is soft and soaks up the yolk perfectly. The sandwich includes a thick piece of melted cheddar cheese, an aioli sauce, arugula, tomato, and avocado (if you get the vegetarian one). The coffee and juices are great and I loved the mugs so much I even bought two of them. The potatoes that come with the sandwich are awesome. I've been here quite a few times but have stuck with this each time because it's so good! 

I will admit that the quality goes down depending on how busy it is. I've gone on quiet weekdays and been completely satisfied with no complaints. However, on a Sunday when they have a crowd, there were some problems. Most recently two of us got the veggie breakfast sandwiches and neither of them had avocado and the cheese wasn't melted all the way on mine. Another time, it took almost an hour for our food to be brought out because we were one of the larger groups on a busy morning and my eggs were cooked through and I had to send it back.
author: Sophie S.

description: I can't get over how amazingly delicious the food here was. Took a party of 10 here for breakfast on Thursday morning and everyone was in love with the food. I ordered fancy avocado toast and it was by far the best avocado toast I've ever had. If I'm ever in the Bay Area again, Eats will definitely be my go-to stop for breakfast.
author: Kathy M.

description:
Cute little cafe with good food. Expect a wait if you are going for Sunday brunch but they are quick at clean up and seating.

Friendly staff who work their tails off attending to tables.

Sat us next to the pick up station. Biggest complaint was the open trash can less than a foot away from our table.
author: Stacey D.

description: Small place, but the food was DELICIOUS and the service was great! We had the Eggs Benedict, Mexican Scramble, and a half of the waffles with whip and fruits. I have no complaints on any of the food, definitely recommend!
author: Diana C.

description: Great local spot. Kind of diner meets rustic-chic hipster vibe. Especially great egg/scramble options, plus mimosas (MYOM)!
author: Anne N.

description:
Came here on a Monday morning so we found parking right across from the place and didn't have to wait for a table!

I really like the place, it's very cute and homey. The wall plants are adorable! 

They serve equator coffee in big mugs (yes please!) and they really aim to never let your mug be empty (which I appreciate). 

We got waffles, home fries and a breakfast sandwich. The food was normal, but not amazing, the service was standard but not out standing and that is why I'm giving 4 stars.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
I ate breakfast here this morning. EATS does an adequate job of serving some basic breakfast foods.

It is a small neighborhood spot so I don't think they really need nor want a more extensive menu.

Service was good. No complaint from me.
author: Paul N.

description: I love this place. It's great if you live in the area and are looking for a good breakfast and quaint atmosphere. Expect a wait after around 9-9:30 on weekends especially if you want to sit inside. My favs are the fiesta scramble and the half waffle with berries and cream. Good bloody Mary's and the make your own mimosa is also great if you want to get some bubbly. Their OJ is delicious ! Service can vary depending on the staff working, but overall it's been consistently friendly.
author: Shawn H.

description:
Decent place for brunch. It's nothing extraordinary in my books, but not terrible either. I came here with a group of 5 on Sunday around 11 AM for brunch. The street was blocked off for the farmer's market. The wait was about 40-50 minutes to be seated, which is to be expected for Sunday brunch in the city. 

+ DECOR/ATMOSPHERE: Very trendy. Sorta loud. Quintessentially SF. It's a small cafe on the corner with a few tables outside and a bunch of wooden tables inside. You can see the kitchen if you're seated towards the back so we were definitely anxiously staring at every plate that came out since we were all starving after waiting 40+ minutes LOL. The walls are decorated with large wooden boards with like little moss/grass chunks in a grid pattern -- I think it adds a quirky vibe to the place. The restaurant is hip without being too pretentious. 

+ FOOD: I ordered the spinach portabello mushroom eggs benedict with potatoes and a loaded Arnold Palmer. The eggs benny was delicious! It was fresh and not too heavy. The only complaint I had was that the eggs were a little overdone. No runny egg action here. They were most like soft boiled and slightly gooey on the inside. Which I dislike. It grosses me out. LOL. So I picked out all of the yolk from my eggs. But aside from that, it was a solid meal. Great portion size and I was not left feeling overstuffed at all (which I frequently struggle with because #neverstopeating). There were also a couple of roasted garlic cloves on the side too! I LOVE GARLIC. So this was a definite plus. The loaded Arnold Palmer was tasty. Supposedly had ginger soju in it. Did not taste very strong at all. There wasn't anything SUPER extraordinary about the food -- it was just overall good. Solid. A 7.5 or even 8/10. Definitely better brunches out there in the city though.

+ SERVICE: Mixed feelings about this. Most of the wait staff was VERY friendly and fun! We'd joke around with them and they were all super nice. They were all fairly young so it was like joking around with your friends. It makes the atmosphere of the restaurant seem very friendly and laid back. HOWEVER, one of the servers from the kitchen that was passing our food out to us was kinda rude. It was hard to hear/understand him since he didn't enunciate very clearly but he kept saying that it was a spinach benedict and I kept saying that I had the portabello mushroom benedict and wondering if that was what he meant but he clearly got really annoyed with me because I couldn't understand what he was saying...eventually he gave me my food. But ya know, I wasn't trying to be a rude customer T_T I just couldn't understand what he was saying! Short tempers man. Oh well.

Overall, a decent place for brunch. The menu is pretty expansive. I'd definitely want to come back to try the waffles. But the wait time is sort of ridiculous for average food. There's definitely better brunches to be had at other places in the city for the same amount of time spent waiting.
author: Amy T.

description: Best place to sit outside, drink a coffee, and catch up with you best friend. Veggie scramble  and customer service .
author: Hannah B.

description:
Got here just after 9:30 a.m. this past Sunday and the wait was not even 10 minutes. Decor was cute and the staff was helpful and nice. 

I got the huevos rancheros and it was awesome. I don't even like eggs over easy, but I didn't mind it at all with this dish (you can also ask for any style eggs. I'm just dumb and didn't read the full description). I also had to add a waffle because it just looked so good. It's a buttermilk waffle with honey butter and powdered sugar. It did not disappoint! Coffee was good, too! 

Tip! When you walk up there's a board outside where you write your own name. At first you hope and wonder if the servers inside are paying attention to the board outside, but rest assured, they are! Definitely write your name up there right away. Another girl was unaware and ended up being shuffled down a few more places than she should have been because she didn't get her name up there. However, she wanted outside so they were able to seat her without her having to wait. 

Also a great spot for your pet as there's outside eating!
author: Meghan L.

description: Consistently good. The Mexican scramble is my go to, but you can't go wrong with any order. Kale salad is great if you're feeling healthy and the açaí bowl is worth a special order. Coffee is great too
author: Rex L.

description: Sadly overrated. Cute spot and what looks like a good menu with reasonable prices. The line gets pretty long and is a self-serve board, but the waitstaff doesn't keep track of it-- most of us were squeezing our names into the margins to respect the names above, though there were lots of empty holes at the top. The restaurant ran out of oatmeal at 10am on a Saturday. Oatmeal. At 10am. Avocado toast is a great price and on fantastic bread, but the greens were all brown, bruised and the sprouts are HUGE and too big to take a bite out of without the whole thing tumbling apart. Good trendy spot but needs some serious work.
author: Sarah L.

description:
The wait is pretty bad but there a farmer market you can checkout. So I guess that can make up for the wait time. 

I got the make your own mimosa and I felt like the freshly squeezed orange juice wasn't fresh squeezed nor did I fill the tiny jug it was in was 12oz and I wish they gave refill on that. 

The service was ok. Inside feels really cramped the elder lady at the table beside us kept hitting me when she would move around. 

The food was nothing special nor did it have a wow factor.
author: Mo N.

description:
Eats is on my Top 5 list of bruncheries. The vibe is relaxed and friendly, the food delicious!

There is typically a wait if you come during the later brunch hours on the weekend. Put your name on the board outside and make sure your full party is present to be seated.

My server - I had him both times I've dined there - was super friendly and quick! I didn't have to ask and he was there refilling my coffee and asking if everything was all right. He even read the mind of a pup sitting outside waiting for his companion (who was inside) and brought the furry guy a container of water.

The Mexican Scramble (a.k.a. breakfast nachos) and the waffle were delicious! 

Menu includes a wide array of comfort food - i.e. pancakes, waffles, fruit and yogurt, scrambles & benedicts, salads. I'm getting hungry writing this review!
author: Cathy K.

description:
Fantastic!  Went with my sis for late brunch on a Sunday (noonish) and there was NO parking because of the farmer's market on the neighboring block.  Although there had been a wait when we put our name in, by the time I was parked there was no more line.  

The ham and tomato benedict was delicious, the sauce was unexpectedly spicy but I loved it!  I don't know if the english muffins are made there but they were not like any I'd had before - very thick and fluffy.  They accidentally brought it with potatoes when I had ordered salad, so I ended up with both.  The potatoes were way better than I would have thought, almost buttery (they must use really good potatoes?) and I loved the salad, dressed with a subtle red wine vinaigrette.  Coffee is delicious, and they kept our coffee and water filled.

The staff are awesome, super friendly and great customer service.  And they had a great playlist on, so we had a great dining soundtrack.  

For what it's worth, the bathroom is a single, and quite large.  I always appreciate not trying to squeeze into a stall without touching nasty things, and I was pleased.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Ate here a few times and finally decided to write a review. 

The atmosphere is pretty lively here with families, friends, and couples. Oh, and the occasional dogs that wait outside.

Every time I go there's always a wait list  (no surprise there since we always go on a Sunday), but the wait is never long. Everyone that I've brought to the place has always loved it, and I've always enjoyed everything I ordered. My highlight of Eats would be their Berries and Cream Waffles. I order a half order every time (gotta save room to try new things to ya know) and I've never had a better waffle dish than theirs, so you better believe that I'll be stopping by again!
author: Sherry Y.

description:
EATS has been one of my go to spots for brunch for several years now and I'm surprised that I haven't written a review sooner.

When I first came here there was some type of dish on the menu which I LOVED, some vegetarian sandwich I think that they don't have anymore and I'm just sad that I don't remember what it was.

I'm never disappointed whenever I come here and one of my new goals for EATS is to try to eat something new everytime I come here.

So far the favorites have been:
Waffle bacon (bacon is actually pressed inside the waffle)
Tuna Melt
Side of Potatoes with big pieces of roasted garlic (love the garlic!)

Granted, there are still many other things I need to try on the menu and some things that I've forgotten from previous visits but I'm excited to come back again.

They also serve half sized portions for some of their menu items but in my opinion, that's not entirely worth it when the price of the half sized portion for some is only $1-3 less than the price of the regular size portion and then you only get half the size of the dish. My recommendation - get the regular sized dish and save half for later if you can't finish
author: Michelle C.

description: Food is pretty good... Better than most places in this area. Service is alright. Price is high like everywhere else. Wait is long. They close too early.
author: Jessie A.

description: Addie was an amazing server! The food was amazing. I had the chicken sausage with a kick of habanero and blueberry pancakes. Perfect portion size. My mother and grandmother thoroughly enjoyed their waffles with fruit and whipped cream. The atmosphere was chill and very cozy. Check them out.
author: Adyna J.

description: One of the best breakfast places Ive ever been to. I don't know the guy's name, but he was the nicest manager/waitstaff/owner of a place i've ever encountered. I had the Breakfast Suite which was 2 eggs, a waffle, sausage and something else...and oh, cup after cup of perfectly brewed Equator coffee. I strongly suggest don't try to fight the crowds after 10....on a Wednesday (week between Xmas and New Year)! No, none, zero complaints. I love this place. It is easily my new go-to place which blows the pants off any other place.
author: Kevin F.

description:
This place serves wonderful breakfast. it was fairly priced and our meal was delicious.  

Service was attentive. I will miss this place.
author: Anelya S.

description:
I told myself that I am NOT going to wait in line for another crazy SF brunch...not doing it! But then, Shirley Y. told me about this place and she said that it's really good. You don't have to tell me twice about good food... 

So we stood, in the rain...watching people go by, staring at people's food very awkwardly through the window like creepazoids. I mean that guy's polenta looked on point! 

They are very strict about all people in the party being there on time. Honestly, if my party was not all there and my name was next, it sure would turn into a party of one real quick. But that's just me. 

We get seated and the service is SO NICE! I don't know why I get surprised by good service. Maybe because it's starting to get few and far in between. When we get seated, I had to choose between a glass of mimosa or a carafe of mimosa. I'd say that I went with the carafe MOSTLY because it was a more economic deal. But yes, I ordered my carafe for one and the waiter did not judge me. In fact, he encouraged it. I appreciate that! 

My friend ordered a bloody mary. We also asked for an extra glass so that I didn't look like I need to enroll in AA. We then ordered our food. I got the pork hash and my friend got the polenta (see, it helps to stare at people's food in the window). SOOOOO GOOOD! Basically, the only way you can be my friend is if you share your plates with me so that I can try everything on the menu. Shirley Y. made the cut for that reason (and she's awesome). 

I'm still thinking about that pork hash. But let me tell you my favorite part. Did these beezies put green chilies in the pork hash? I mean, you have to be pretty bold to do that and be an American restaurant! It was the perfect addition. So beware if you do not like spicy food, but if you do, you will be pleasantly surprised. 

Next, I want to try the pancakes. But really, I want to go back and order the pork hash and I want someone else to order the pancakes so that we can share.
author: Leena B.

description: Hands down the best brunch I have had in SF. Food is super tasty, service is great, and not a long wait (they have a good waiting list system). Went on a Sunday and enjoyed the local farmers market while we waited for our table. Very friendly and attentive workers. Fresh Oj. Eggs Benedict with potatoes was delicious! Next time I am trying the waffles!
author: Ariel C.

description:
Food is definitely tasty, but the serving staff could improve. They can be short enough at times, and only start smiling when it comes to paying the check and leaving a tip. 
I've been here a lot, because I like the food, but whoever owns this place should really have a word with them.
author: Alb N.

description: I rarely come to inner Richmond for breakfast but Eats has amazing food, spectacular service, and reasonable prices. We ordered the huevos rancheros (recommended by our server) and salmon scramble. Both dishes had a special touch, the huevos tortilla were crispy with a type of white bean and sauce.  I loved the leeks/ green onion in the salmon scramble. My brother meant to order the salmon omelette, but the scramble arrived on the table instead. when we asked our server to clarify whether he had the omelette or scramble our server, who may have been the owner, gave ordered us a new salmon scramble. We said it wasn't necessary to do that since we already had a plate of food, but he responded now you can take some home. This is some of the best hospitality I've ever received in my dining experience. Eat at eats for a personal experience! Highly recommended!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Besides Friday night dinner our weekend breakfast is the second most important meal of the week. I was really disappointed with our first experience at Eats.

I always order coffee first for breakfast. My coffee was served in a filthy cup. I didn't realize it until I was halfway finished and the film on the inside started coming off, bastards. We never saw the our waitress again after she took our order. My wife's pork hash was so spicy; I don't see any reason why they have hot sauce on the table. It was more like pork stew than pork hash. The diced potatoes on her dish were under cooked and the leeks on my dish were also under cooked. I would suggest sautéing the leeks a little longer before the rest of the ingredients. 

"Maybe we ordered the wrong dishes, everyone else seems to be happy."

"Everything on the menu should be good."

If they are having a off day, Saturday morning was a bad choice. Now if this is everyday, then the cooks need to be monitored and the staff needs to be supervised.
author: Bebe L.

description: My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to eat for brunch and came across this on Yelp. The pictures of the food looked delicious so we decided to give it a try, and I'm so glad we did!! It was so cute and cozy. Both indoor and outdoor seating, a plus when carl the fog isn't around. We got the huevos rancheros and the waffle berries and cream to share, both were amazing!! Heather was our server and she was very sweet. Mary Joy, a regular at Eats, was filming a documentary for the show Vice!! Was really cool to see!! Definitely be coming back for more
author: Olya M.

description:
I've been a few times now -- get there early or prepare to wait in line, outside.
The main server (the funny guy with the tattoos) is clearly a staple that keeps customers coming back, not just the food. 
The first time i went I got the lox omelette and it came with... no lox. 
The second time I went, things were on point, and the service has been good despite the lox mishap. 
Would go again, but only if it's early in the morning without the wait that tends to occur around 11AM and onward.
author: Mima G.

description: Great spot to go on a weekday! I avoid it on weekends because it gets so busy. The menus got a large selection, and everything I've had is great. Nice, friendly staff. Yum.
author: Kaitlin S.

description:
So I was taking my car in to be serviced at the Toyota shop on Geary. Yes, I know you're shocked I own a Toyota. I'm an engine-operating cliché. With an hour to kill on a brisk Saturday morning, I had a hankering for a full-fledged breakfast. You know what a hankering is, don't you? It's somewhere between a yen and a desperate craving. Never been to Eats. Walked by it many times, mostly when it's closed at night. So there would have been no point of breaking and entering. It was moderately busy inside, so I decided to be a sport and dine al fresco despite the chill in the air. I sat for quite a while tapping on my iPhone until I realized I better just get a menu myself.

Just as I got up, the waitress made a rare appearance and handed me one. As I was about to ask her for coffee, she responded to the fidgety, curled finger of a gluttonous woman already wolfing down a plate of waffles. Crickets. Ah, she finally comes back and asks me if I want coffee. As she was turning around in haste, I exclaimed that I was ready to order. I decided upon the $10 Blueberry Pancakes with a $3.50 side of Spicy Mango & Habanero Chicken Sausage (photo: http://bit.ly/1D9RaR3). And a $4 six-ounce glass of Freshly Squeezed Orange Juice please (photo: http://bit.ly/12v5A2R). To her credit, the $3.50 mug of House Equator Coffee arrived quickly (photo: http://bit.ly/1DKo7FT).

I needed it to warm myself through the Big Chill. More crickets. More iPhone tapping. Ah, the food arrives. Ten bucks for two flapjacks? OK, they are thick, not too spongy. Just a few blueberries in the pancakes, many more just plopped on top along with a shake from the powdered sugar canister (photo: http://bit.ly/1wqXuT7). Good but not as Aunt Jemima-transcendent as I was hoping they would be. The sausage has kick and provided enough protein to balance with the sweetened carbs. The best part of the meal could very well have been the orange juice. Uncomplicated and truly fresh. Oh, there's my phone. My car's ready. Yes, I came, I conquered, I eats. Soon after I belched. Acid reflex, y'know.

FOOD - 3 stars...decent enough hotcakes with plenty of berries
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...I was outside, I wouldn't know
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...it was more tortoise than hare here and guess who lost the race
TOTAL - 3 stars...probably good enough for the 'hood, not worth a crosstown bus though
author: Ed U.

description: Was in the neighborhood so we decided to try this place...loved it! Fresh food, friendly service, reasonably priced, perfect portions...just right! If ever in the neighborhood again, I will sure to come back.
author: Lissette I.

description: Went here for Mother's Day brunch- amazing food, would definitely come back! All of the waitstaff was very friendly, special shoutout to one of the the bussers Josh, who was very attentive.
author: Mel B.

description:
Good food and poor service.  

Came here on a Wednesday morning around 11:00 a.m. The place wasn't busy, only a few occupied tables.  However, when my friend and I walked in, the waitress barked at us to put our names on the board located outside at the entrance and wait to be seated.  We waited outside for 15 minutes before being escorted to a table.  Another 15 minutes and our order was taken.  Another 15 minutes before water and the coffee were served.  It took 45 minutes before the meal was brought to the table.  The wait was ridiculous long and I had to run down the block to add money to the meter. 
Interestingly, during our meal I watched arriving customers getting seated and served immediately.

The food was good.  My eggs were cooked perfectly and the herby, garlic roast potatoes were delicious.  My friend ordered the waffle which she described as OK.  It wasn't crisp which is her preference.  Coffee was good.

I would return for the food, but it isn't worth the staff indifference. It made our experience a bit unpleasant.
author: Donna P.

description: Super good breakfast. I had the pork hash, which was awesome, and a lovely cup of earl grey tea. Get there early if you don't want to stand in line -- I got there at 7:45 and there were already a couple of people waiting outside.
author: S M.

description:
I met my friend for brunch here on a Friday around 12:30PM and she had wrote her name down before I got there. So, we waited for maybe 10 mins until her name was called. 

We decided on this place because it was nearby to where I was and she had been here before and really liked the food, specifically the waffles.

We were seated on the stools near the window, and were given the menus and some water. After a few minutes, my friend ordered the "Spicy Sausage Polenta" and I ordered the "Homemade Waffle Berries & Creme" with a side order of "Spicy Mango & Habañero Chicken Sausage."

Our food finally came out and I couldn't have been more excited to taste the waffles! The waffles were nice and thick. The fruit was fresh and I could definitely taste the honey butter. I enjoyed the chicken sausage as well. It wasn't overcooked and I liked the spicy kick to it. My friend said her dish was really good too. 

Overall, the service was friendly and no complaints about the food! I would come back again for sure!

Total before tip:
$30
author: Fallon P.

description:
Pork hash: My friend decided to get this and I was so jealous! Everything about this dish was perfect. They placed this on a skillet before but the waiter told us the pork got too dry so they decided to just put it on the plate. The combination with the pork, eggs, and potatoes were perfect. It tasted wonderful. I plan to come here again to get this dish for myself! 

Breakfast suite: they ran out of waffles around 1:30pm on a Saturday. I was quite disappointed because that was one of the reasons why I wanted this dish. However, they substituted it with a pancake! The pancake was fluffy and probably the best thing on that plate. I got pork sausages and scrambled eggs. I would probably pass on the pork sausages if I ever choose to get this dish again. The pork sausage tasted like something I could buy from Safeway.

Service was amazing! Our waiter was so friendly and made sure we really enjoyed our food!!
author: Shirley S.

description: Local breakfast + brunch place with limited tables inside. The ambiance is really pleasant-- feels like a local place that provides chill music + great company. Food is great-- B.A.T and chicken waffles never disappoint! Their potatoes are incredibly soft and taste amazing. Staff is also welcoming as well; however, a few of them neglect their tables the whole time except when taking order, giving their order and completing the transaction. Price is pretty decent-- ~13 per plate. Enjoy!
author: Honest R.

description:
Not sure what all the hype is about. I got the ham and asparagus Benedict but wasn't very impressed. The asparagus was thin and not the stalky type I was expecting. The ham was thin, not even a very good chunk of meat. The muffin itself was delicious was disproportionate. One was thin and small the other was almost an inch thick. The sauce was unique and not in a good way. I personally found it too tangy and it didn't mix well for me. The eggs were also small.. The potatoes I ordered with it were absolutely delicious and almost saved the dish for me but they only gave me a little bit :\
If I were to ever come back here they'd need to fix their portions because it doesn't seem like I'm getting my money's worth.
The food was good but nothing special. I prefer Zazie's
author: Bianca M.

description:
not sure why there is a line... always... wait, i take that back. this neighborhood is lacking in brunch spots now that Q is gone. that place was the real deal!

my fried chicken sandwich was bland. dry on one side (it came cut in half) and sloppy wet on the other (which was tastier). 

the fries were good. 

my friend had huevos rancheros which she also said was bland (maybe that's why there are four different kinds of hot sauce on the tables (but no ketchup). 

i have stayed away for years since my last meh experience util recently, and this time i believe i'll stay away for good *unless i just want a small portion of fries for $4 (Mcdonalds is closer tho). 

meh.
author: Wendy X.

description:
Eats is a good place for brunch, but in a city where there are so many spectacular brunch eateries, this place gets a 4 star.  The food was good, but nothing special.  My taste buds weren't delightedly impressed or anything.  I would go back again if I was in the area.  

I got the chicken & waffles.  If I find myself back here again, I will definitely try the spicy tomato skillet.
author: Jessica D.

description:
My boyfriends friends recommended this place as one if their favorite brunch spots. And we were definitely not disappointed, the only bad part is the fact that it's a small spot.

Waffles with berries: 4/5: thick, crispy, sweet and tasty. It was absolutely delicious and best when eaten hot. I loved that it was thick and it had whipped cream and berries on top. It was delicious and a must get if you like waffles. The half order is one waffle, it's decent sized but felt small for $5.

spinach and mushroom Benedict: 4/5: absolutely delicious! I loved the combination of both, it was really tasty. But the disappointing part was the egg, it was slightly overdone so it did not ooze when you pierced it, it was solid. Almost perfect but a slight miss.  Hopefully it's better the next time I try it.

Overall, a decent brunch place in the Richmond district. The line can get long on the weekends but they go by pretty quickly! 

Total for 2 with tax and tip: $40
author: Stella J.

description:
From the jump, the staff was friendly and awesome to work with. There was a line so we knew it was a happening place. We didn't mind the wait. 
As I'm writing this review (which I normally don't ever do) I am unable to stand up because I ate so much. Everything we ordered was better than expected. Hold on because it could be a long list (this was just for two): Waffle berries, Pork Hash, Mexican Scramble, Fried Chicken, House equator Coffee, a large refresher, Chicken sandwich, Banana chocolate Pancake. 
Ixchel and Addie were a riot and we felt super welcome. Give em big tips!
author: Deji A.

description:
As I write this review, Eats has a 3.5 star rating here -- that's too low. The food, vibe, and tunes at Eats are on point. I've had 4 or 5 of the breakfast items, all delicious, but I particularly enjoy the spicy tomato skillet (grilled bread..mmm). Soju cocktails are solid for being soju. There is almost certainly a wait, but groups of two should be seated pretty quickly since they have a bunch of tables lining the outside of the restaurant. Otherwise, plan to wait because it's worth it. 

Highly recommend getting yourself a savory entree and sharing either the fancy toast or pancakes/waffles with your dining partners.
author: Kevin K.

description:
I don't understand the 3.5 star rating at all.  Perhaps because there are no other American breakfast places in the entire area - no other choices or competition.  This place is for you If you don't cook & have nothing else to do all day.

Why only 1 star?
- The wait for a table on the weekend or a holiday is nearly 1 hour because of the lack of alternatives.  It's also a small space.

- There is nothing special/unique on the menu.  I dine out to have food that I won't/can't cook, there's practically nothing on the menu that I cannot make myself.

- To compound the 1 hour wait for a table.  There were 9 people, count them NINE, who were seated after us, ordered their food, rec'd their food, ate their food, paid their check & left BEFORE our food arrived!!!  I could only see half the room from our cramped seats so I'm positive that there were more than the 9 I witnessed!!!  The same server seated us & still she took our order after taking the order from 5 people (2 parties) who were seated AFTER us.  That doesn't equal the time difference for receiving our food.  I think our order was lost, it wasn't noticed until they were leaving checks for other people & there was nothing done to expedite it.  Bad management!  Complete waste of $40 for brunch!

- The seats we were given were ridiculously hot & sweaty, terrible conditions for any meal.  It was practically in the kitchen & there is absolutely NO ventilation at all in the restaurant.  It's usually the area reserved for employees to eat their meals.

- Despite the heat, the water had zero ice.  We had to ask for ice or drink warm water, ick.

- The hollandaise sauce for the benedict was absolutely gross!  It looked like congealed cheese, disgusting!  Luckily I was smart to ask for it on the side so it didn't ruin all of the food.  I had to eat the benedict without hollandaise, what is the point of that??!  It was basically a dry egg mc muffin, except instead of Canadian bacon, they use cheap ham.  The only reason I ate it was because it was 12:30pm (our name was on the list @ 11am!) & I was starving because I didn't eat anything all morning.

- The side of potatoes were sooo greasy!  There was an oil slick on the plate & yet the potatoes lacked flavor.

Only plus - the side of fruit is fresh with various kinds of fruit & berries.  Gee, well that saved me some chopping time in the kitchen.
author: Kim S.

description: Small dining area but staff was friendly and food was good. Enjoyed a nice morning meal with friends. The spinach and portabella Benedict was really good. Will be back soon!
author: Veronica C.

description:
This is the best place to eat brunch on Clement. Friendly wait staff and delicious food. It's worth waiting for.
STRONGLY suggest the strawberry lemonade.
author: Ali S.

description:
It's been a long-time trend for casual/classy brunching in San Francisco, and this summer's heat wave has certainly made little places like Eats even more essential. I would not travel across town to pay a visit, but I do have friends in the area, so I end up here 1-2 times a year. It feels independently owned and has a lot of character -- unlike the mini-Chain 'Toast Eatery' which are popping up around San Francisco like bland little mushrooms. (Sorry. Had to get that dig in.)

So, Eats is clearly a great neighborhood place, in a great neighborhood. On the weekends, there is ALWAYS a wait. But again, it's a great neighborhood; so get your name on the list, gauge the wait time, then go for a walk. The last time I visited, there was a farmer's market on the same block. A perfectly fine 'wait.' 

To me, brunch means eggs, so I have only had the egg dishes. But they're all ways perfectly prepared (i.e., eggs not too hard), and the ingredients are always varied and interesting. My go-to is the smoked salmon omelette w/ cream cheese, capers, tomatoes, pickled red onions and dill. With friends, they have had the sandwiches, hotcakes, fruits, etc. All have reviewed them well. 

They do have beer, bubbly, and a soju Bloody Mary. But even better, they have wonderful fresh squeezed juices and juice mixes, à la the 'Refresher' w/ cucumber, pineapple, romaine, lime. (If only I could get some vodka in that.)

It's kid-friendly. You decide if that's a good thing or a bad thing...
author: Corey M.

description: Stopped by the other day, but the wait was super long so came back today (Saturday) around 1PM. Parking took awhile, but it was ok. We waited about 15 minutes for a seat inside since it was way to chilly outside. We ordered half of the waffle with fruit, which was super delicious! The strawberry lemonade was good, but I could pass on it next time. The pork hash was satisfying, but the bread on the side was too hard for me haha. Also, got the Mexican scramble which was okay as well. Overall, food was okay. The waiter was awesome and he checked up on us, which I always appreciate. When he noticed I didn't get my lemonade by the time the food came, he still remembered it and made sure I got it. Therefore, service was great. In case you were wondering, the restroom was pretty clean haha. I'll be back...Especially for the waffle! It was a bit pricey, but my belly was fine with it. I think a lot of the dishes don't come with meat, so they charge extra for it.
author: Maggie W.

description: We got in before the crowd on Sunday.  Wait wasn't too long.  Love the pancakes here!  We'll come again.
author: HQ S.

description:
If you want to stand outside and wait for terrible service you should come here! The dry erase board where you write your parties name and inside outside preference is a mess. The women who is supposed to manage it doesn't and once anyone complains that they might have been bumped down the line by accident is seated. We waited for almost an hour to sit down and they let a couple that was after us sit down first. When I brought it to the staffs attention they said "thanks for bringing it to our attention" no apology. Once we sat down (the worst table in whole restaurant right by the door) our server proceeded to tell us they were out of grapefruit juice, chicken, tortillas and more. It would have been nice had someone communicated that before we waited an hour for brunch.

We begrudgingly ordered a caraf of the orange juice mimosas which were not blended and poured 1 glass of all orange juice and 1 glass of champagne. Our food just came and I can't wait to quickly eat my eggs and never come back here. Wouldn't have even given it a star had yelp not forced me.
author: Megan C.

description:
The food is tasty and well-made. It's a neighborhood gem and I appreciate the hard work of the cooks that prepare meals for the local Richmond customers and wider Eats patrons.

One point that was unexpected and infuriating was that one of the petite hostesses sat us to our table and my mother and I were minding our own business - getting seated into our space, happy and excited about our mother daughter breakfast. My mother took her napkin to wipe the table out of habit since she is a caregiver of young children. The lady in an aggressive tone, questioned why my mom wanted to wipe the table. She then kept saying it again to make a point in an angry demeanor. Her communication was needlessly rude and was out of line. This approach with customer service is not in step with my positive experiences at Eats. "I already wiped the table and now you've already used your napkin. I don't know why you're doing it again!" She was needlessly aggressive in tone. Management team, please make note and consider a course correction because the community here does not need this when supporting your business.
author: SpringAutumn P.

description: One of my favorite brunch places! It's always crowded here on the weekends, so get here early (or get a friend to come early and put a name down) but expect to wait. The first time I came here, I ordered the waffles with fruit. I loved that I didn't have to use the syrup for the waffle because it tasted so good all by itself. The second time, I was in the mood for eggs and ordered the huevos rancheros. I highly recommend it! It has eggs, tomatoes, avocado, and pinto beans on top of a crispy taco-like shell. It's a filling brunch dish for sure! You really can't go wrong with ordering at Eats. Like everyone else mentioned, get there early on weekends. Weekdays are much better though.
author: Joanne K.

description: Hands down favorite breakfast in the inner Richmond. Great food and service. I always get the seasons scramble with chicken sausage.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Pros:
-Delicious food, I recommend their eggs benedict 
Cons: 
-when its busy the waiters aren't as attentive so if you're out of cream or need something it can be hard to get their attention
-long line during prime time 

I still love going to Eat's but in order to go I either have to be craving something off their menu or accept that I'll be waiting a while for my food
author: Carmel G.

description:
We haven't been there in a few years and the food now has more of a Mexican slant.
The size of the restaurant hasn't changed but the staff seems a lot nicer. Our waiter, dressed in tattoos from torso, arms to toes was ultra nice.
We did like our breakfasts but they're definitely not like the traditional breakfasts you'd find.
My bacon waffle had bacon sort of embedded into the waffle and they were quite generous with the thick slices of bacon.  It came with a small salad.
Hubby had an egg benedict and said it was OK.  

They have outside seating for warm weather days.
author: Ry T.

description:
To start, HORRIBLE service- not the bad service where they are slow, but the type of bad service where they are RUDE, down right RUDE. We got there and asked if we could sit outside; and the response we got was so rude- I wanted to leave. She yelled at us and said "the only one in control here is US!" 

THEN- I got their Benedict and when I got it, my English muffin was soft and mushy! Like it had been sitting there for awhile. The food had potential but what I got was horrible. 

If I could leave 0 stars I would.
author: Kyra D.

description:
This is a toughie for me, how can I express my feelings for Eats by just clicking stars??

The CHOCOLATE BANANA PANCAKE is to die for. I'd never die for any food really, but this was definitely DEFINITELY the best pancake I've ever eaten. Ingredients were plentiful and evenly spread out, and chocolate syrup was drizzled on top. A single pancake is great to split for two, on top of whatever orders you're getting individually. This fine delicacy (yeah, really) was so hot and crisp on the bottom after sitting out for a bit that it'd be a crime to even use the syrup or butter that came along with it. 

What else did I love? The STRAWBERRY LEMONADE. Most restaurants serve their drinks in mason jars nowadays, but none are as amazing looking as this drink here! There's a beautiful layer of fresh lemonade topped with strawberry puree (on ice, so it stays afloat), which is further topped off with fresh strawberries. YUM! 

And finally, the rest of our order: bf ordered some omelette that sounded tasty, and I ordered the Huevos Rancheros. Not bad, not excellent, and a little bit difficult to eat. The pancake was the real star, by far. Onto the service: I get that usually you have to write down your name to get seated, but the place was near empty when we walked in. We promptly got waved back outside to write our names & wait, only to be brought back in a moment later. We were seated with the wave of a hand by a fellow who couldn't bother to look our way. Could I be overreacting? Maybe. But I'm pretty sure it's because the guy's girlfriend was coming in and he was too preoccupied to pay attention to us. It's kinda crazy how you can bring up a brunch place and people will suddenly remember and refer to 'that one rude waiter', right? Anyways, every one of the parties that came after us were promptly greeted with a friendly smile. 

Anyways, if I could get these pancakes delivered fresh daily, I'd be a little bit poorer and a whole lot happier.
author: Christine L.

description: Today was my first time being here with my family and it was awesome. The restaurant was small the food was portioned, and the bill was reasonable. Child friendly restaurant:) The food was awesome and that's why I rated the restaurant a 5! The coffee was a bit strong but the food was DELICIOUS
author: Melinda E.

description: This is my favorite breakfast spot in the Richmond. Service is excellent, food is fresh and delicious, coffee is refilled all the time. You gotta try the fried chicken sandwich, sooooo bomb. Plus the waitress with the red hair is super cute. 10/10! Stop by if you're in the area.
author: Lachlan D.

description: Pretty great everything here. Even Equator coffee, which makes it better than what you get at most breakfast places. Although I like the pancakes and scrambles, the fried chicken sandwich is the star here. I'd stopped going after a couple so-so health scores, but will return now that it's back at 90.
author: Owen S.

description: Best brunch I've had food wise in the city.  My friend and I split the jyevos rancheros and waffles
author: Joti L.

description:
Eats always has a line or a crowd of people waiting during brunch time. They have tables outside for outdoor seating. There's a whiteboard near the front door with a marker to write down your name and how many in your party.

== Food ==

Asparagus and Ham Benedict. The muffin is a nice thick one that's soft. The poached egg is done pretty well. The dish isn't drenched in hollandaise sauce so that's very good. The ham they have is very tasty and nicely grilled. There's nothing special about the asparagus. It comes with potatoes or a salad.

The side of bacon tastes good. There isn't bad bacon.

Cappuccino tasted alright. There's a nice layer of frost on top.

== Service ==

Like the other yelp reviews say... The service here sucks really badly. It may be because I had the outdoor table. It's hard to get a waiter/waitress' attention outside. My benedict came but, my cappuccino and side of bacon never came. I finished my benedict before the waitress showed up again. Should've just canceled the missing items, but I still wanted them. Also when paying, I got the check from my waitress and gave her my credit card. Then another waitress comes out to give me the check again for some reason. Then a waiter comes out with my charge slip a few seconds later. Talk about disorganized.

== Overall ==

The food is pricey, but decent. It's not worth the money since the service is very lousy. I would suggest getting on seat on the inside. Things may be better inside. Bad service ruins a meal.
author: Steven B.

description:
The service is excellent. Suitable for parties of about 4 if you don't want to wait too long. 

The price is just about right for a brunch place and reasonable for what they give you. The waffles are delicious and the Mexican potato with chiles are super bomb also. The portion for that was just about right but could use a bit more. 

The waffles with fresh fruit I got was so amazing, watered my mouth when I ordered and it really satisfied me. :) 

I would definitely come here again.
author: Jenny S.

description:
OMG, Yes! 

Great food and wonderful friendly staff. Worth the 10-30 minute wait for a table.
author: Noelle N.

description: Can't believe this is my first time here. Eats is a complete breakfast gem in the city! The service and food were 10 stars in my book. We ate the the portobello mushroom Benedict and the Egg sandwich with a side order of Banannas chip pancakes! The service was outstanding
author: Amber S.

description: Super friendly crew with super awesome grub. Locals eat here. Kids were all thumps up for their choices and I got the breakfast burrito. Seriously the tastiest breaky burrito. "Broke da mouths" as they say in Hawaii. Wife was equally impressed with the friendliness of the waiter. We got there on a Tuesday morn around 9:30 am after Christmas and the wait was only about 10 min but looks like the line grew after that.
author: Vid R.

description:
Best breakfast in San fran!
I took the sandwich breakfast veggie with smocked salmon on the side and it was fabulous. 
My wife took the chicken fried sandwich and  bingo too perfect. 
The waitresses are nice and the place is just pack. 
The menu is fool of good stuffs to choose and healthy too. 
Really perfect for breakfast.
author: Idan A.

description: Delicious breakfast food and a charming ambiance! The fresh squeezed oj was delicious and there were some fun brunch menu items including pulled pork hash. I went during the week, which was great since I know the weekend lines can be long!
author: Danielle M.

description:
We came in a party of three at 11:30am on. Friday. There was no wait but we occupied the last table before the wait began after us. 

I had the smoked salmon scrambled without the capers. It was pretty good at first, but after awhile it didn't seem like they complemented each other well. 

The potatoes were delicious though! Yum, ketchup. 

This place is quirky and I am sure it has various delicious plates, but I just don't taste the awesomeness. However, I'm not saying you should try this, you should as you and I have different taste buds; it just would not be my first pick.
author: Jess W.

description: This place is super delicious and boujee without being ridiculously expensive. However eat the potatoes with caution as too eagerly bit into a giant hunk of garlic!
author: Lily P.

description: This breakfast place is worth the wait.  Better yet, go on a weekday morning and avoid the line.  The food is traditional comfort with a cosmopolitan twist.  Get a mimosa and savor the experience.
author: Jarrodious M.

description:
Cmae here on a sunday at 11 22 am for brunch and the wait was about 1 hr and half. It was a busy packed day and by the time we left, people  were still waiting to get a table. We were done in an hour. 

We ordered

One happy pancake 

This order came wirh 2 pieces of normal soze pancake with poppyseed inside and lemon zest. When the ordered came i thought for 11 bucks it look skimpy with strawberry and only 2 pancakes. I thought they should give 3 pieces instead of 2 and more strawberries as well for 11 bucks. The pamcakes weee very refreshing anf zesty to my taste buds. You cant really taste the poppyseed inside but u can smell and taste it. 

Half order of happy pancake 

This is same as the above review but it was only one pancake.

One order of tri tip sandwich with green salad. 

The bread was ciabatta and it was hard on the outside and inside was soft and the bread was thick as well. The big chunk of trip tip was a turn off because on the first bite the whole tri tip comes out. The carmelized onions were so dark and it was very sweet too and made the bread inside soggy. 

The salad that came with it was very good i liked the dressing to it and tasted refreshing.  

One order spicy sausage polenta. 

This had a great taste but the presentation is horrible and sloppy. The eggs were over easy so when u cut into it the yolk spills out. The sausage was mild spicy and had a great flavor and texture as well. The sauce on this place was over flowing and had a tomatoe taste to it. It also had polenta on the bottom of the plate and was not dry because of the over flow sauce on top of it. I love the extra corn inside and was good. 

One farmers scramble. 
This looks like a normal breafast plate and came with a mixed salad. It was so so. 

Oveeall food was so so meaning ok not good or great or excellent. So overall is 3 out of 5. The long wait is not worth it. There are not alot of tables in there for large parties so not recommended. Plenty of 2 to 4 people sitting. 

The presentation of the food was sloppy and plain and didnt stand out. I had to rearrange some to make it look more appealing. 

Also inside was very hot for a 70 degree weather. I think they need some sc in there because we were all sweating and rhe windows canr cover the sun that is also beaming in with those see thru shades. Ir they need some more vents to get rid of the smoke from the cooking. 

The sevice was slow and didnt refill our drinks or ice til we reminded them. also they dont have bottomless minosas its 22 for a bottle and fresh squeezed is included. I did get a bottle of beer and it was laguinita which was strong for beer. It was 9.9 oz so that was a strong beer for sure. And it was beer of the day in a bottle for 5.50. I dont think i wjll come back because nothing attracts me and just waiting for over an hr is too long.
author: Alex T.

description: Great food, but even better service. The waiter decked out in tattoos was super nice and friendly and checked in on us a lot to make sure everything was good. Very welcoming and cozy place to eat. Definitely will be coming back. I got eggs Benedict with chicken apple sausage and salad with a fresh juice with pineapple, cucumber and romaine and everything was on point! I also feel healthy and perfectly content.
author: Jessica Lilly R.

description: Grabbed a quick bite to eat for brunch at "Eats" . Small / intimate cafe with a great selection of breakfast /brunch / lunch items . I ended up getting the " Chicken & waffles ". The Chicken reminded me of ' Chicken katsu ' provided with a side of mushroom gravy . The waffles were soft & flavorful with a crispy perimeter . I also grabbed a side of potatoes which contained whole cloves of roasted garlic with the skin (impressive & roasted to perfection ). Staff were friendly & prompt . I highly recommend this cafe for a quick quality bite , especially for brunch .
author: Portia S.

description: CALL BEFORE YOU GO if you're going past 2pm. We love this place but arrived today at 2:17 and were told the kitchen had just closed. Rushed to get there and were bummed. That said-- Great food. Creative menu. Totally awesome service. Busy on weekends but the wait isn't too too bad.
author: Meghan C.

description:
Eats didn't have much of a menu showing. i was in an hurry anyhows. no (legal) parking. one very buzy waitress had time to service me with a cup of brew.

brews: dark roast, (2.2)
-bold, robust taste, barely enough to kept me awake.
-didn't ask about vintage, just got coffee and split.

drips:
-this place looks busy all the time.
author: Victor G.

description: It's a cute little breakfast place.  The owner is super nice and the food is reasonably priced.   I love their kale salad.  It's busy most of the day and closes early.
author: Urban E.

description:
Came here on a Saturday morning. My first time here.you are asked to write your name and number of party outside on a black board. It's a small place and I thought it would take a while to be seated but we were seated in less than 10 mins. 
Food was great! Large portions with great prices. Very tasty! The only thing that was not so great was the craf of mimosa for $16. The craf only serves 2 1/2 cups therefore it's best just to order a glass on your own. 
Servers were friendly and funny! Great send of humor. 5 stars for great service and great food. I'm definitely coming back here for brunch again!
author: Stacy G.

description:
Came in for brunch on a Thursday afternoon and it was packed with a few tables available. 
I got the B.A.T scramble which is served with a side of roasted home potatoes and bread of choice. I felt like what I got was really mediocre. Just a egg scramble with pieces of tomato and avocado thrown on top. 
Don't get me the wrong, it was good but for the price ($13) I expected better. I'm spending about $19 with tax and tip and I felt like I could've easily put this together at home which kind of defeats the purpose of eating out. There are a lot of other brunch spots in the city where I've had better for the price. 
The service was quick, and the waiters were efficient. 
Although I wasn't impressed with what I got, I might be back if I'm in the area to try the other stuff on the menu.
author: Joanne L.

description: I was in San Fran for the weekend and this was an amazing brunch. For two people, we shared a sweet toast and ordered our own small plate. It was great food! A bit of a wait on a Sunday morning, but moved fast and very organized.
author: Maria J.

description:
Got lucky and only had a short wait on a chilly Sunday morning.  By the time we left there was quite a line of folks outside.  Well, I can certainly see why it's worth lining up for.

Love their take on chicken and waffles.  Definitely get the mushroomy gravy on the side so that you can portion it as you please.  That breaded crust on the chicken...wow!

Being the sucker that I am for eggs benedict, I actually ordered the portobello, spinach and feta cheese version.  It was cooked perfectly, but somehow I still wanted a thick slice of ham to kick it up the final notch.  But that's just me.  Their muffin was a thick and hearty one, certainly up to the task of handling the runny egg and hollandaise.

Friendly service and good coffee rounds out this excellent experience.
author: Al C.

description:
This is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city. It can get a bit crowded since they don't take reservations so if you have a big group (more than 2), get there at least 20 minutes earlier than you'd like to. Otherwise, go super early or very late. 

I'm a huge fan on their so happy pancakes but the farmers & B.A.T scrambles, huevos rancheros, and chicken and waffles are always delicious too. Pair it with some fresh squeezed juice or lemonade to get in a super fresh start to your day!
author: Marissa S.

description:
Huevos rancheros - I suspected that I love you but Eats made me certain. So nice, crispy delicious. I felt bad for not going back there once more before I left San Francisco.

The place itself is rather small but nice & cozy. Service is a bit slow, but that's probably because they were busy.
author: Laura S.

description:
The food is great.

My experience waiting in a large queue to be seated was unpleasant. There were a lot of people ahead of me. I selected to be seated outside to hopefully get sorted quicker. I was a part of 1. The tables outside were dry and not occupied. I waited and waited, eventually they got to me, after seating everyone ahead of me for inside.
