When it was my turn, I could have been seated inside, but they inside seated me outside. That is fine, I guess they don't seat people faster if they choose outside. But then other people who put outside started getting seated faster, so be consistent with your practices, it is aggravating to me to have to wait and be seated outside anyway. 

It sucks to sit outside when other people are waiting and watching you eat. Sit inside if you can.
author: Nathaniel G.

description:
I guess maybe others have had a different experience than me, but I really kind of love this place.  The food is great, although i would not really think of it as a brunch spot as much as a breakfast spot.  It is just a smidge pricey, but really good.  Insider tip: Skip the salad they offer as a choice for a side with breakfast, go with the potatoes, you will thank me as they are freaking amazing!

Oh, one thing I noticed in some other reviews is complaints about the service.  I'm pretty shocked by this as I have never had a bad experience there.  If you show up at peak times you are going to wait for a while (um, popularity for a restaurant is a good thing, don't knock them for the wait time) but other than that it is generally pretty awesome.  I've personally seen the staff get harassed by jerk-face customers and take it in stride, so yeah, guess I've just kind of always been impressed with them.  Not saying others are wrong, just has not been my experience.

Okay, last thing, the Mushroom Benedict, breakfast sandwich, breakfast burrito, and spinach tomato scramble are all amazing.

Thanks Eats!
author: Jared J.

description:
This seems like the place to go for a Sunday brunch. Very hipster and gay friendly.

pros: bottomless mimosas, wide variety of foods, efficient service. 

cons: pricey based on the quality; I got the chicken and waffles and was high disappointed in the fattiness of the chicken & the nonstick beading. Last call is @14:25.

However, my gf got the shrimp po boy and highly enjoyed it and I was pleased to get 20% off my portion of the meal. If I came here again I would probably order something else.
author: Mel L.

description: So came at 10:30 waited for 1:45 for a table then ordered @11:50 only to wait another 40 before no food showed up. Not sure what's the problem but if your kitchen can not handle the volume you should not have that many tables....not worth the wait.
author: Tracie G.

description: I don't usually post reviews but I was so disappointed to come try this neighborhood spot and be told that we could only eat here ( inside or outside)if we put our infant in our lap-not always possible with a sleeping infant. The girl who told us was very nice but definitely have never experienced this at any other restaurant in this city.
author: catherine m.

description: Solid location, nice big mochas. Food is bland and had "poached" eggs twice that were cold and hard. Not worth the moderate line, would go there for a coffee and a small bite.
author: Micha B.

description: I absolutely love this place! It's literally one of my favorite breakfast spots. My husband and I recently moved to Sacramento and we still come out to the City to get some good  food. We've come here so often John (a waiter here) is more like a friend than a worker here! Definitely a spot to try if your in town
author: Angel B.

description:
I came here for the Chicken & Waffles before but I decided to try my hand at their breakfast options this time around. This time, I decided to get the BAT (Bacon, Avocado, Tomato) Scramble with home fries ($13) with a cup of coffee ($2.98). 

Prices are pretty high up there for what you get. There wasn't even anything memorable about the food, but $17.98 for breakfast? There are plenty of places to go in the city for delicious breakfast that doesn't cost so much. Service was very basic; nothing phenomenal to rave about. 
Seating in the place is also a little cozy. The place is small, so tables are packed pretty close to one another. 

I almost regretted coming for Chicken & Waffles last time, but this time I definitely regret coming for breakfast. Next time, I'll check out other breakfast places in the area.
author: Florence S.

description: Eats has become the go to brunch choice for my group of friends. It's just a great well-rounded place that checks all the major boxes you're looking for in a brunch spot. The chicken & waffles and waffle bacon are ridiculously tasty, there are tons of egg dishes and omelettes to choose from, the coffee is good, and I personally find the salads and sandwiches to be the hidden gems of the menu. We've been known to put down some mimosas as well, and they offer several different juice options as opposed to just plain old OJ. I'll be going at least once a month for the foreseeable future. There may be a short wait on the weekends, but it's definitely worth it.
author: Patrick N.

description:
Came by around 9am on Sunday and didn't have to wait (except that the 3rd person in our party of 3 was LATE and entire party needs to be present to be seated...)...

We all decided to go for fried chicken - two of us the chicken and waffles and one of us the chicken sandwich. 

The fried chicken was delicious! Big chunk of chicken breast deep fried in a saucey batter (not buttermilk?), I kind of felt like I tasted some sweet-and-sour type flavors after mixing with my syrup. My first bite was just alright, but when I mixed everything together (gravy + syrup + chicken) it was delicious and my entree disappeared in front of my face... The waffles were also really good, somehow it had a bit of texture like corn bread, but still light and airy. Wouldn't mind adding that recipe to my box!

Total (including a house coffee) after tax and tip was $54 for the three of us. A little bit pricey, maybe...
author: Jenn W.

description:
One of our favorite brunch spots...if you can wait for a while or go early enough this. Is. A perfect spot for breakfast !!

Our favorites are - spicy tomato skillet, Mexican scramble and huevos !!! Also their smoothies and juices are perfect.

Great place and family friendly specially in the early part of the day !
author: Amit D.

description:
Sometimes menus totally escape me. When I'm hangry #googlethat I really don't care - I just want to EAT, period. Serve me whatever. Bring random food to the table and bring it now.

Or sometimes menus don't have anything that particularly calls out to me, as was the case at Eats. A bunch of stuff sounded "good", but nothing was like #ohsnap gotta have it stat.

GRAPEFRUIT (JUICE): Tasted fresh. I would've preferred pulp. $5 was a bit much.
photo http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=2wyqyewihbRM1nqSI--cZg&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

ICED TEA: Bottomless. This is lifeblood for any Southerner. I just wish the refills were proactive rather than us having to flag someone down.
photo http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=frZDuNChP3gY4iHtgrnDkA&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

B.A.T. SCRAMBLE: Bacon? Yes, please. Avocado? Yzzir! Tomato? Tom-ah-to. It was okay.
photo http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=aVBy2WhkIdpfJw8FwAmYhQ&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

The funky part was when the smell of burnt took over the place and nothing could be done since the windows were at maximum openage and there were no fans or anything.

Was a stack of tires on fire outside? Was one of the stoves leaking gas? Who knows. Unappetizing. It dissipated after a while, though.
author: Dan B.

description:
I came here for the first time with a friend and it was definitely amazing experience.  We were staving and wanted a quick brunch. Picked this place out of random and no regrets. 

We got here around noon on a Tuesday and it wasn't that busy at all. The staff was EXTREMELY friendly. Although the guy with tattoos looked a little annoyed, he still did his best to hide and put his game face on. Customer loyalty!!!! Shoutout to all the other staff for being comforting and willing to honor all of our requests!

The blueberry pancakes and strawberry lemonade sold me! I was definitely satisfied with my order and the price of our meal. Definitely coming back to try the waffles.
author: Rayne J.

description: Food was delicious! Alyssa and Addy were very friendly and it was great service over all.
author: Kyla O.

description: Food was really good and service was great. Alyssa and Addy were super nice and helpful.
author: Connor B.

description: The food was amazing, but the service I had today was pretty lousy and disappointing. Would return just because the food is so good, but customer service that's up to par would be extremely nice too.
author: E. M.

description:
We had the eggs Benedict and pork hash and both were great. Very nice service and ambiance. Quick to order and get food after sitting down. 

We were 7th on the list outside and the wait was about 20 minutes, but they got people in and out pretty quickly. Worth the wait! Definitely will be coming back here for brunch.
author: Michael P.

description: Amazing breakfast with great service. Can be a little busy at time but the wait is not too too long!
author: Cassandra Z.

description: Came early enough on a Sunday didn't have to wait at all for a table which is uncommon. Food is good, I had eggs benedict with tomatoes and ham. The English muffin they use really sets this apart from everywhere else. The wife had Mexican scramble which she liked as well. Reason for only three stars is like others have said; price. The food is good, but price is a little high for what it is. I would visit here again, but next time may look for something that is a better value.
author: Mike S.

description:
Reason for two star?

I had one salad, one coffee, one small juice= Total $30 dollars (15% tip). 

How does this make ANY sense? please tell me.

Say no more i just won't be eating here again.
author: Moto B.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Friday afternoon, not too long of a wait. I had the spinach portabella eggs benedict and split a berries and creme waffle. The benedict was delicious and seasoned perfectly though I thought the muffin could have been toasted a bit longer to hold up to the veggies on top. 

The waffle was crisp and fluffy, but not amazing though if you're a fan of waffles, it's worth a try. I also tried a bite of the chicken sandwich and fries and while it was good, the seasoning on the chicken was not my favorite. For fried chicken and waffles, I'd go somewhere else. I'll definitely be back to try some of the other egg dishes though.
author: Melissa C.

description:
There were 8 parties ahead of us on a Sunday when I put my name down.  Wandered around the farmers' market on Clement St for a bit, then when I came back they had already seated the 4 tables after us!  (They seated us next, of course.)

Farmers Scramble: 4 stars
Delicious soft stew of mushrooms, zucchini and goat cheese.  Their house salad and sourdough toast are not just castaway sides, but well-seasoned toppings that really enhanced the meal.

Waffle Bacon: 3 stars
Home fries were good. The waffle was too peppery, cheesy and soggy from the fried eggs sitting on top to be able to taste the waffle itself, so it's a good thing I got the...

Buttermilk Waffle (Side): 3.5 stars
Crispy surfaces framing cakey innards, a standard yummy waffle but I bumped up half a star for how hard it is to find brunch waffles in SF.

Because they have so many other items on the menu, I'd love to come back and try some more!
author: Letitia L.

description:
Cute decor, great food, excellent quality ingredients but best of all : genuinely nice service from real, down to earth people... That's why I keep coming back.

- Sunday Farmers Market is right there on Clement... Expect a longer wait (& be patient with your servers!)
- Best for small parties

So happy to have Eats as my neighborhood (weekday) brunch spot!
author: Reishi A.

description:
What happened to this place? I've being going to Eats for the past four years and over the last year it's been getting worse and worse. They've changed the menu so many times and not for the better. The plates used to come out with a decent presentation and now it looks like slop and tastes like it too. 

I ordered the Lox Scramble and it tasted so fishy and salty that I couldn't finish it. I know how lox are supposed to taste and this was simply overwhelming. The server saw that I barely touched it and didn't even ask how it was. He probably knew is was terrible too. All my favorite things are off the menu now so I'm wondering why I still come here... 

Maybe my friends and inner Richmond neighbors were right. It might be time to say goodbye to Eats. RIP
author: Lyndsay P.

description:
My bf and me live super close by and have always wanted to go, but they are always crowded. We went super early one day with our dog and were able to get a table outside. The servers were super nice and recommended the burrito, which was DELICIOUS. And I think it was relatively healthy. Just writing this makes me want one.  
They also gave my doggy water. And I love dog friendly places! If you love my dog. I love you.
author: Julianna I.

description: absolute yumminess! this is hands down my favorite breakfast/brunch spot in the city. eats offers high quality, thoughtfully prepared food. seating is tight and there's usually a wait but it's so worth it! the staff is friendly and welcoming. you have to try the strawberry and goat cheese fancy toast, the huevos rancheros, divorced eggs, lemonade mimosas.... i have yet to have a bad meal. treat yourself to some delicious eats!
author: Fina B.

description:
Wanted to try a different breakfast place this morning in San Fran and decided to try Eats which was conveniently placed by a Farmers Market. 

The service was great and the staff was very friendly. Inside it's pretty tight and crowded. You almost feel like you are eating with the people surrounding you. 

The food was good but not amazing. It's a nice place to go if you live best by but I wouldn't come back in search of something amazing! They serve fresh fruit and the meals are the appropriate serving sizes.
author: Becky W.

description: We enjoyed our brunch soooo much today！The food was just fabulous ！I like the homemade waffles, berries and cream most, but I can't eat sweet food too much so I just ordered a half. Hope I can try more next time!
author: Yue K.

description: The waiter is awesome!!!  Some of the best hospitality in town for sure.  Hope he stays here forever.
author: Grace C.

description: I came here for an early breakfast with my boyfriend before he went off to work and luckily there was one open table for us as we were kind of on a time crunch.  He ordered the Benedict which he loved! It came with ham and asparagus on a sourdough English muffin which was unusual but really good. I got a half order of the chocolate chip banana pancakes and a half order of the Belgian waffle with berries.  I love that they have a half size option because you know me I want to try a little bit of everything! The pancakes were really good but I think I liked the waffle even better! The whipped cream on top wasn't overly sweet and it came with a generous amount of berries and bananas. What a good way to start the day!
author: Linz C.

description: No way should Eats be at 3.5 stars, definitely my favorite brunch spot in SF! Have enjoyed everything I have ordered/ tried. My favorite is the huevos rancheros, which comes loaded with Avocados and a crispy shell for a unique version of the item. I also love the skillets and Benedict's. GF loves the waffle with their whipped cream & fruit. Also, order their mimosa or just have the orange juice, it's freshly squeezed and delicious! It is small and can have a wait but so worth it.
author: Phillip H.

description:
I have been waiting for quite some time to try this place and finally last week my friend and I decided that we were going to try it for breakfast/lunch. We were seated immediately when we came inside. The place wasn't very packed at first, but then as soon as lunch started to roll around there was a little line forming outside. 

I got Zoe's Bacon & Fried Egg Sandwich, my friend got the Tri Tip Sandwich and we got the Homemade Waffle Berries & Creme to share. 

The fried egg sandwich was incredible. Every bite had me asking for more. The egg just spilled out throughout the entire sandwich and made it so warm and delicious. My friends sandwich was just as good. The meat was very juicy and tender and the aioli sauce made the taste unforgettable. As for the waffles they weren't anything really special, but they were very fresh and the fruit was generously laid out on the top. 

Each of our sandwiches came with either a side order of french fries or house salad. I got the salad which had such a yummy dressing and the fries that came with my friends sandwich were also very crispy and good. 

We really enjoyed coming to this place. Not only was the food really food, but the staff was also really friendly.

Quite often they would come to our table to ask us if we wanted a refill for our water or if we needed anything else to enjoy our meal. Now this is what I call good customer service.

Really great place and located in a great location. Easy to find parking outside. 

Will most definitely be coming back here to try the other yummy stuff!!
author: Julia K.

description:
This review is for the breakfast service today combined with my past impressions of Eat's. I came to the current incarnation of Eat's a few years back and while it was more expensive than the last version, the food and whole atmosphere was waaaaay better and I decided that I liked the new Eat's. They have great items with quality ingredients now, a focus to fresh and seasonings with a quality menu. 

Today, unfortunately, has moved my impression in a negative direction. The service was fine with zero complaints. Unfortunately the Ham & Tomato Benedict was terrible and had moved very far in the wrong direction. The ham seemed as though it came out of a pack of cheap deli meat, there was one clove of roasted garlic with potatoes (the garlic and seasonings really made the potatoes what they were), there wasn't enough hollandaise...just nothing extraordinary at all. 

I'm willing to give it another try, but it was kind of disappointing today.
author: Max R.

description:
Came here for brunch during fleet week weekend.

I really don't remember much about the caprese egg white omelette even though I remember liking it but it really isn't anything special. However, my strawberry and goat cheese fancy toast drizzled with honey was fabulous. If I could do it all over again, I would just order 7 plates of that and call it a day :)
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
It's a very cute restaurant decorated with a bunch of cups and Coke bottles. It made it feel a bit homie.

I ordered the Smoked Salmon Omelette which I thought was really good at first bite. After a few more bites, it just tasted like a normal plain omelette with smoked salmon in it. I did like how they put the ingredients together; it was made up of pickled onions, capers, cream cheese and smoked salmon. The capers made it taste good.

My friend ordered the Fiesta Omelette. I tried a spoon and it tasted like a non-spiced Mexican dish. And so I helped spice it up by adding hot sauce onto it, which of course tasted a bit better. (I liked my omelette better, hehe)

I would come back here to try there other plates.
author: Annie H.

description:
I still can't believe I haven't written a review of Eats...I've been coming here for over a year with my bf and the brunch at Eats is well worth the wait.

They have a semi-seasonal menu, so some of the items change every few months depending on what is in season. My bf is a huge fan of their Ham and Tomato Benedict, which they took off the menu late last year in favor of a Ham and Asparagus Benedict. The menu says no substitutions but even when we get a waitress who isn't familiar with the old dish the kitchen begrudgingly makes it happen, for which my bf is eternally grateful, the picky dork :). 

On the other hand, I like to mix it up.  I'm not too keen on the sweet-breakfast and opt for the  savory stuff most of the time. I've had their oatmeal with fresh berries (yummy, not gummy), B.A.T. scramble (scrumptious), Spanish scramble, two-egg special, and more recently their blueberry and plain pancakes. All of them are really delicious.  Recently they put a Cowboy Burrito on the breakfast menu that I'll have to try! 

They give you an option of salad or potatoes...while the salad is really delicious (LOVE the dressing), try to get the potatoes. They are super-crispy and not to be missed on your first go-round at Eats.

They also do a MYOM (Make Your Own Mimosa) and fresh squeeze all of their juices. We had the lemonade mimosa most recently and really loved it.
author: Liz G.

description:
I came here for lunch w a coworker today based on the Yelp reviews. Our experience was simply horrible.

We got there at 1pm, and was able to snag a seat outside.  Wanting to be considerate,  and never dinning here before,  I went inside to ask the waiter, ( Asian guy, w tattoos and a beard) if it was alright to sit there.  He rudely responded: " No, there isn't a seat out there.  I still have to set it up." ...umm ok.. well,  my co-worker was already sitting in a non occupied table. .. so I went outside and waited w her. And let me tell you what "set it up" means: literally, rudely throwing down a napkin and fork  and not even bothering to wipe down/clean off the nastyness of the food from the ones who dined before us.

Then when we asked for a straw for our drinks, this same idiotic waiter placed the unwrapped straw, down onto straight contact on the non-cleaned table. WHAAAAT? why don't you put that straw in your drink.  Let's see how you like it. Then he gave sooo much attitude when we asked for another straw? ??? REALLY?.  Even taking our order he had his sweater wrapped around his mouth..... I couldn't even understand him. 

At this point I was so disgusted with his sarcastic and rude behavior towards us,  I didn't even eat my meal based off the fear of what he could have possibly done to it. 

He was soo rude,  and completely unprofessional. I get it,  people have bad days...... but when you are in the hospitality field,  especially serving meals to people, put your bs aside, and do your job...

***Regardless how good the food may be, that means nothing if your waitstaff are complete ASSHOLES.

NOTE TO THIS SERVER: It's your job.  If you do not like serving or speaking to people, THEN GET ANOTHER JOB! You shouldn't act as if we are bothering you while taking our food order. We, just like others, paid for our meals, it was not given to us.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I dropped my car off for an oil change, then went looking for breakfast in the neighborhood.  Eats was about 10 blocks away, so I decided to give it a try.

Even though it was early morning on a weekday, it was half full.  But the service was still amazing, attentive but not obnoxious.  

At the waitress' suggestion. I chose the caprese scramble.  It was delicious, with a subtle blend of flavors that required no spicing up (I often smother eggs with hot sauce).  I ended the meal with a peppermint tea, which though good was steeped a touch too hot.

Overall a perfect breakfast experience.
author: Joey Y.

description: An excellent little diner-type brunch spot with high quality food and great service. The farmer's scramble tasted better than I expected, and the presentation was nice too. Vintage vibe. A little crowded inside so come early to get a table. Lots of meal options. Tables outside if you like too:)
author: Bridgett W.

description: Small, busy place. Got there for breakfast on Sunday around 11am with a party of 4. Waited for about 15 mins for something to open up which ended up not being a bad wait at all, since there was a farmers market going on right down the street.  We ended up losing a person in our party so it ended up at a small table for 3 in the corner which was not a bad spot to be.  Our waiter was this Japanese guy, forgot his name but he was the MAN!!! Very friendly, made it seem like we have known each other for years...even though we just met.. He guided us around the menu, gave us the insider information for each dish and guided us to a very very scrumptious breakfast! Thanks for the directions!
author: Taylor H.

description: A cute brunch place in Inner Richmond! My boyfriend and I came around 1:30pm on a Sunday and we barely had to wait. Parking was a bit tricky because of the farmer's market but possible! The prices are a bit expensive for the portion sizes but was made up with great service. We even left with their trademark mugs! ($10 each)
author: Breanna T.

description: my favorite lunch spot in SF! I had the crispy chicken sandwich this time around and it was so delicious! best vibes for a cute little lunch place, always feel welcome
author: Meghan O.

description:
Ordered: 
Waffles w/ honey butter, whipped cream, syrup, and berries (full size): Get the full size because the waffles are really small. One waffle won't cut it. Their whipped cream is homemade! I liked that they gave us a variety of berries&fruit, most places just give you one type of berry. I really enjoyed the waffles, they were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside which is perfect. They gave me the right amount of whipped cream and fruit/berries. Usually I have to ask for more. This was delicious! I highly recommend it!

Chicken & waffles: I was really disappointed in the chicken, it was way too dry. The sauce also tasted weird and the mushrooms were hard. I think it just came on a bad day because I've heard good things about this dish. I will have to come again to see for myself! The waffles were really good though. Waffles will never fail you. 

Service: My waitress was really sweet and attentive. I don't remember her name but she did a great job! She refilled our coffee and water whenever she stopped by. 

Definitely give this place a try!
author: Courtni W.

description:
The place is cute and has a nice neighborhood cafe feel. I had the chicken and waffles. Chicken was a tad dry because it was white meat but the gravy was delicious. It's smothered with mushrooms. The waffles were delicious though. It was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. 

Great breakfast/brunch place and the service was super friendly.
author: Ray W.

description: How do they only have 3.5 star average?? Eats is such a cute neighborhood brunch spot. They have constantly good service and good food. There is always a wait (but that means the food is really good) and the wait is worth it, especially on a Sunday when you can wander the farmer's market. The pancakes, the acai bowl, the spicy tomato skillet, and the tuna melt are all great options!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Came here for brunch, very small place and small and friendly staff. Took awhile for the servers to get us seated but it was understandable because they were very busy. So if you're on a hurry or impatient I wouldn't recommend you going here. 

Food: I had the spicy tomato skillet. Had amazing flavors and spices with every bite was worth it. Also had the fancy toast with Nutella, bananas slices, almonds and a drizzle of honey on it! Was delicious, the bread was quiet to hard for me to chew on but it couldn't stop eating it. 

I would love to come back here again once I come back in town and try it out for lunch or something. They have a great selection on they're menu.
author: Jerica T.

description:
Nestled in a quiet neighborhood, Eats is a hardy breakfast spot for the breakfast lovers alike. Cute decor of coca-cola bottles decorates this corner joint, giving it a unique American flair of divey diners mixed with traditional swag. 
Freshly squeezed Orange Juice and a mug of coffee is what i always begin with. 
As i'm deciding what to eat from the various menu options, loads of customers begin to line up by the door, anxious to get inside.  The smell of warm waffles must be what is luring them to come inside.
"i must hurry" i think to myself, as i make eye contact with the people waiting outside. This is always that awkward moment where you feel super bad for sitting at the bar counter facing the outside people. 
i quickly bury my face in the menu. i usually end up with the eggs Benedict or one of the omelets.
muy bueno.
must..come...again...
to do this all over again.
author: Sherry T.

description: Came here on a week day with one of my girlfriends. Rainy Rainy day. Nice and cozy. The food was great. The waiter was attentive. I'd come again.
author: Amalie A.

description: We tried the benedicts and some waffles here. The benedicts were not good, I mean they were not as delicious as the usual benedicts at the good brunch places. There was something wrong which I can't actually pinpoint. The waffles were delish.. so good also the outside patio allows dogs so that was a plus .. I wouldn't want to come back because I love Benedicts for breakfast and here they are not as good!
author: Karishma R.

description: Poor services. My husband and I came here on Sunday morning for brunch. We waited for our food for 45 minutes. The server didn't approach us nor say how much longer was our food. When our food came out, my husband waffles was cold. My order was incorrect. I told the server that they made my food wrong. Not just they didn't apologize, they said it was my fault. I ordered, "Season's scramble". My husband told them, egg whites and I said no cheese because I have allergies. The server even repeated saying no cheese and egg white. The server said to us that she didn't hear what I said. So she rudely took my plate and said they will remake my order and it will come out in 2 minutes. My food didn't come out till 5 minutes later. When my food came out, they skimmed on my egg. My food was so little. When we asked them for the check, they gave it to us so rude and walked off. Honestly this place isn't worth spending your money on. They aren't welcoming nor friendly with their customers. The food was mediocre.
author: Vanessa Q.

description:
My favorite brunch spot in the neighborhood! I usually get the chilaquiles, but have ventured out on their skillets, avocado toast and yogurt parfait. I have never been disappointed whenever I dine here.  

The ingredients are fresh, portions are good sized, and I never leave uncomfortably full. The service is fast and efficient and they really GSD (get shit done). 

The line could be a bit of a wait, but I like to get coffee around the area and hang around/window shop while I'm waiting for a table. I suggest to get there earlier (9am) to secure a table with a decent wait time. 

Love this place!
author: Victoria B.

description: The Mexican scramble is amaaaazing and same with the homemade waffle berries and cream. Super cute inside and the menu had a lot of items that I wanted to try! They have a ton of hot sauces at every table if you like your food spicy, like me. Waiters and waitresses are all very nice and helpful! Will definitely be coming back again when I'm in SF :-)
author: Irie C.

description: I had the spicy tomato breakfast skillet. It's spicy! In a good way. Highly recommend. Reminds me of shakshuka. Service was good too.
author: Noah D.

description:
Love the food. Their ability to seat people in order of their arrival is so challenged I get pissed every time I come!!!  They take people out of order and then casually leave you standing there when there are open tables. Really annoying. Too bad the good is good.

One hour later and we are still waiting for food.
author: Cindy O.

description:
Eats is another great, yelp-famous, a (somewhat quick) must wait in line (on weekends) with the other bay area hipsters breakfast spot.

Easy free street parking which was a plus. You write your name, # of parties and whether you have preference where you sit (inside or out) on the waiting board. Surprisingly on a Saturday brunch time we were seated in 15 mins.

Servers are quick on their feet to get your orders in, served out and table cleared out. The only somewhat confusing thing is they have another staff (in order for efficiency) who comes out and serves you your food (instead of the server who orders your food). Since I have never been there, no idea what my food would look like it was somewhat confusing to have food delivered with her not knowing who ordered what, and me now knowing which one is mine.

However it was still all good as food was delicious. If you are a big eater one plate would be a perfect portion for you. If not, there is definitely left over. I had their veggie egg sandwich. I love their bread, but the egg was supppppper greasssy, it comes with the option of red skinned potatoes, or salad. My d00d ate the waffles, bacon and eggs. Eggs was deliciously creamy and fluffy. waffles were just the right crunch and chewiness.

I most appreciate the fast food cooking skills and quickness of the serving experience. Thumbs up!
author: Doriancita X.

description:
Love this place - seriously one of if not the best breakfast places out there.

I love their polenta with eggs and veggies, but tried the vegi Benedict this time which was good. Also shared the lemon poppy seed pancake which was amazing!!! I think the polenta is still my fav tho. Service today was just ok but the food makes up for it!
author: Becca W.

description:
On my mission to try the best restaurants in my local Richmond district, I came across this brunch place on Yelp. Decided on coming here with a friend on a Sunday morning at 11am, and the best discovery is a farmers market on Clement that you can explore while waiting for your seat! Was seated in about 15 minutes. The wait for your food is kind of long, probably since it's packed.

I ordered the Famers' Scramble with a side salad, which was fantastic, and my friend ordered the Spinach Feta scramble with basil, which I tried and her and I agreed that the garlic was overpowering (there are chunks of seemingly raw garlic in the scramble). She also ordered a side of potatoes, which were great. The potatoes had whole cloves of garlic but it was roasted, which made it tasty versus the strong uncooked garlic in the scramble.

Portions are decent, nothing huge. For 2 dishes and 2 coffees, bill came out to $15 a person, what you would expect in SF. Besides my friend's dish, the place is quaint, the service is great, and overall a brunch place I would return to.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Great neighborhood breakfast spot. Tell your friends 30 minutes earlier than usual or longer on a weekend so you don't have to wait so long. Eggs polenta, pork hash are a few of the many winners here.
author: Rich S.

description: Came with my mom our 1st time and it's very good and large portions. Coffee was the best we've had in a long time better than Starbucks!!!
author: Christina S.

description: They were totally helpful when we asked for vegan options. I got the acai bowl and avocado toast. Both were delicious. The blood orange juice was amazing. I would definitely come back if I'm in the city, and in the area. I'm pretty sure their non vegan options are out of this world. The pancakes look too good. Definitely recommend trying it out for yourself.
author: Jessica W.

description: We haven't been here in a really long while. The really long lines outside doesn't really encourage us to go. Anyway, made it here for breakfast. The food is not bad. I ordered the breakfast suite. I do like my eggs (I added a lot of hot sauce on my eggs. It doesn't come that way), the chicken sausage, and coffee. The waffle is on the small side and they only give you one. My husband thought the breakfast was a bit too expensive for the portion. It's ok, but I think we won't be back for a while. The wait staff is really nice though.
author: Lisa X.

description:
Great little spot to enjoy your Sunday brunch!

It felt a bit like Velo Rouge's little brother on Arguello,
perhaps a little peppier, with cuter waitresses 
and fewer campers.. thanks to the lack of wifi
Smallish portions for my american sized stomach,
but I actually didn't leave hungry at all.
Good quality ingredients, and the bacon was manly.

3.5 for the experience because it was actually pretty noisy,
adding half a star because those conversations were interesting,
especially the Coffee-Meet-Bagel boy and girl behind us..
Oh the awkwardness when he asked "do you want to get outta here?"
and she said "YES!" enthusiastically, only to thank him and walk away.

Ouch. 

On a happier note, I'm coming back for the waffle with chicken and gravy!
author: Jade T.

description:
OMG GO HERE NOW 
*slow claps for the chefs in the kitchen 
Congratulations u did it 
I love u
author: Mali H.

description:
Live right around the corner and this is my go to. Worth the wait, though they get through the list quickly. Strong coffee, sweet power C, juice and healthy farmers scramble are my fav. They allow you to get just one pancake in addition to your meal. This is a great treat with a savory breakfast. Have come here with several friends and everyone always leaves happy

Polite service, good atmosphere, right on cute clement st. Come on Sundays and enjoy the farmers market after a yummy brunch!
author: Sharon R.

description: Love this spot! It's pretty close to our neighborhood but regardless probably my favorite breakfast/brunch place. There's outdoor seating so we can bring our dog, menu is great for everyone, and decently priced.
author: Jessica V.

description: They have increased their quality, service is great as always. I have gone on both slow and busy weekend days when hipsters are all in the house and it's increased overe past several years. They are very quick to seat and ACKNOWLEDGE your presence right away. I think they have increased in every way and ALL there food is very good. Been going regularly since 2008. It's worth both any wait and a drive from other area of city.
author: Jeff V.

description:
I adore this place. 

Simple as that. 

I adore the local feel that this place projects. 

I adore the food this place serves.

I adore the toaster in the bathroom with the succulent plants.

I adore the service this place provides. 

I came here on a Monday mid morning with my best friend for brunch. She recommended Eats to me. We were seated  pretty promptly... even with a unexpectedly busy day. 

"Let's split, shall we?"   

I ordered the Spicy Tomato Winter Skillet. Kale, leeks, potatoes, bell peppers with a sunny side egg on top... all hanging out in an iron skillet. This is a dish that warms your soul on a cold day. I loved it. 

My best friend ordered the Apple Walnut Cinnamon Raisin Brioche Waffle. The waffle was light and crispy with a milk buttery taste. The baked apple and walnut compliment quite nicely. With a dash of sour cream, we were set. 

WORD OF ADVICE: seriously consider the Spicy Tomato Winter Skillet. I still think about it today...
author: Mike D.

description:
Good spot for small groups or couples (it's small).

Went here for brunch on a Sunday morning and the wait was only about 20 minutes for a party of two. We walked around the farmer's market while we waited. We were seated at the counter at the window, which was ok, but not super comfy. The food was delicious however! I had the waffles with berries and creme and it was phenomenal. Waffles were perfectly crispy, berries were fresh and the whipped cream was just sweet enough and clearly not from a can. My husband enjoyed his huevos rancheros as well.
author: Brittany L.

description: My boyfriend and I came on a Tuesday morning and didn't have to wait too long to be seated. I ordered the Ham and Tomato Benedict and the Homemade Waffle with Berries and Cream, while my boyfriend ordered the Breakfast Suffle. We both found the food to be very bland. The only thing that was flavorful and that I enjoyed were the potatoes on the side. I was also looking so forward to eating the waffle but was disappointed to find that it was very hard and dry. Waffles are supposed to be soft and fluffy. I couldn't force myself to finish it and instead only ate the berries and cream. Overall, I'm disappointed with the food here and won't be coming back.
author: Christine K.

description:
3.5 stars upgraded to 4 stars. 

High school BFF introduced me to Eats recently. At 11am on Friday, the wait time was 15-20 minutes. We signed in on the chalkboard posted on the red pillar & waited outside. 

After going back & forth among all the delicious sounding items, I finally settled on their chicken & waffles (~$12.) Big surprise, I know, so unoriginal of me, but I was so pleased with my pick. A seemingly healthier version of any C&W I've ever had--panko crusted chicken filets & a crisp waffle with obvious vanilla notes--zero grease! Loved the mushroom gravy & real maple syrup...these condiments just tied the whole dish together, as weird as the flavor combo sounds. 

Our waiter, a blonde-haired-blue-eyed-all-American hottie is reason enough to return...but if he's not working that day, I'd still stay for the food!
author: Fancypants X.

description: This diner is amazing. Homemade creme on waffles, incredible huevos rancheros with hefty avocado. Mimosas in carafes...need I say more.
author: Michelle B.

description: Best breakfast in the Richmond. Worth the wait and the staff are super fun and friendly.
author: Sheharyar S.

description:
So, to be fair I was not in a perfect mood prior to sitting down, nonetheless I can't believe I'm writing this review. Or maybe I can.
I ordered a scramble. Everything was alright until it arrived and I first found out I had to butter my own toast, which ended up leaving me and the table greasy and then the real kicker MY SCRAMBLE WAS COLD!!! I told my waiter (I won't mention his name but it began with a J). He politely and enthusiastically said they would remake the entire order. And then the troubles only continued. My new scramble was delivered with potatoes (which I expressly didn't order) and an "I don't know why they made this with potatoes". At this point my toast from my original order was cold and dry but I had already given up so I went to my scramble. It was hot enough but I then got a bite of a green onion which is still lingering almost 30 minutes later and likely will leave me without any ability to taste anything else for the rest of my day. Yikes!!!!

My waiter (J) then went somewhere, I don't know where I didn't see him again. 

To be fair I was given a 'discount'; but $11.67 for the experience I had is; I don't know, outrageous? And I'm writing a review.
Ugghhh!!

Anyways, how do so many things go so sideways in one meal? Maybe a 3.5 star Yelp is legit. Or is it??

I hope Eats changes its ways so I can go back to experience whatever illusive experience so shockingly many seem to have had.
author: James F.

description:
A Visitor's Perspective: 

Perhaps because this was the first meal of the day and the first meal ever in SF for this visitor, anything edible would have tasted great at that moment. Upon entering what looked like a college-town type diner, I was ready to inhale the menu. Luckily for me, the food did not disappoint. The buttermilk pancake was soft and fluffy without any hints of the aftertaste of batter that typically plagues poorly made pancakes made from mixes. The Ham and Tomato Benedict was a fun choice, but any eggs benedict made without lox can no longer be appreciated by this egg lover!

The Bacon and Fried Egg sandwich was excellent. With the golden egg yolk oozing onto the plate after the first bite, this hot mess of a sandwich with the flavorful bacon and crispy bread certainly hit the spot. The bacon/fried egg sandwich was a fantastic recommendation by the waiter to make up for the unavailability of the ricotta pancakes. They were no longer part of the menu after Eats changed owners.

The service was excellent as our waiter was warm and friendly, but sitting at the counter that oversees the open kitchen wasn't necessarily a great spot. The cooks almost seemed nervous when they spot us gawking at them as they made our food. I wonder why that is...

Though I eventually found out that a few visitors had encountered roach problems at Eats during their visits, it really did not taint the recollection of my overall experience at Eats. The bacon/fried egg sandwich is definitely worth a try no matter what might be crawling next to you!
author: Nelson W.

description: Mediocre. Two stars is a bit generous to be honest. The proportions are tiny, they nickel and dime for any variation for the meal and the wait was much too long. I had the chicken and waffle and that's what they served to me but nothing was particularly memorable. There was an ounce of syrup (regular ol maple syrup), the chicken wasn't bad - a good sized breast, but the waffle was dry and unappealing. There's better places to eat in the City.
author: Latrel P.

description: Great, clean food! Delicious and the portion servings are perfect! Not too much but you won't leave hungry! Get there early if you don't like waiting, but the wait is definitely worthwhile! Staff is super friendly as well, which makes it the perfect way to start your weekend right! Enjoy!
author: Milan M.

description: Wow! My little nephew and I had brunch here today and I had the most amazing blueberry pancakes ever. So flavorful. Their homemade waffle is also very good. Service was very friendly. Can't wait to go back.
author: Lani P.

description:
I've been here a couple of times, both for Brunch. If you go early enough (around 9am) you will not have to wait, but when you do, it's usually only about 20 minutes. 

The portions are smaller than most brunch places, but the food is very tasty. I've gotten a scramble and the waffles, both were very fresh and flavorful. I think the egg dishes are their specialty, and would reccommend getting one of their scrambles. 

The wait staff is very attentive and friendly, the prices are a little steep for what you are getting, but if you're looking for a good, stereotypical SF brunch, this is the place.
author: Molly S.

description: Amazing waffles. Great people. The service is great and the cooks kill it. Well worth the wait.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I haven't been here in years. I've tried but it's always been on the weekend and there's always a long wait (usually a good sign). I decided to try today, a Monday, and got right in. 

I remember the food being good but not this good! I splurged and went for the Bacon Waffle. It was amazing! Eggs cooked perfectly and the cheddar/pepper combo was unexpected yummy. I asked for my home fries to be extra crispy and they made them exactly how I wanted them!

Cozy space inside too, especially on a rainy day. 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Jim T.

description:
It had been a while since I've had a legit breakfast - you know, the type with eggs, bacon, etc. It might be the fact that I don't know where to go, or that I'm afraid of ridiculous line-ups, or that I just never wake up in time (probably more of the latter). 

I finally came here with a friend of mine, and I was super excited. We got there at 10 AM on a Saturday. There was definitely a line-up, but we just put our names on the board outside, and waited for about 20 minutes. We quickly had a seat.

Truth be told, I was overwhemed with the choices. I just wanted EVERYTHING. What to do. What to do. I heard the chicken and waffles were amazing, however, I had already gorged in chicken and waffles the evening before. Despite that, I ended up having a Waffle Bacon (because it sounded SO similar to Adventure Time's "Bacon Pancakes"). It was pretty good - I was imagining that there would be bacon bits IN the waffle, but it turned out just to be bacon pressed into the waffles. 

Nontheless, it was quite delicious. I was quite happy (and full) while walking out of the restaurant.
author: Joanne W.

description:
I don't care for brunch. I never really understood it. Breakfast? Lunch? Brrrunch? The concept is still foreign to me, even though by all accounts I'm a yuppie through and through. Hey, if you can't fight 'em, join 'em.

Eats changed my perception of brunch. I had a half order of the banana chocolate chip pancakes and the avocado fancy toast. Both were absolutely delectable and healthy portions -- I left my meal completely and utterly satisfied. There were so many good options but this was a perfect duo for my sweet and savory palates.

I would come here all the time if it weren't so far from where I live. Alas, nothing can ever be perfect.
author: Aditi J.

description: Love the Mexican scrabble. Trying the Huevos Rancheros today. Their coffee will most definitely wake you up! Oh and their blood orange mimosas are delicious! Enjoy!
author: Dyan D.

description:
The food was good- nothing to rave about-  but we were dissapointed with the portion size!! :(

Berries and cream WAFFLE. we could tell the whipped cream was home made but for $10 we expected a whole waffle not a half!! (2 triangles of a belgian waffle is what we received) in order to leave full or at least satisfied you would have had to purchase two times what they give you and its not a $20 waffle people!! it also comes a la carte. 

Would i come back- maybe if i happened to walk by and there wasn't a wait - and not with anyone hungry!!, but other than that I can pay the same elsewhere with equally if not better food feeling full with the same bill.
author: Erin A.

description:
First of all, I should say that I went to Eats on a weekday for lunch, so my experience there was probably a lot different from the majority of the other reviewers'. I ate with just one friend, so the two of us got a table immediately (we even got parking right in front of the place!), so that's an automatic plus for me.

My friend had the eggs benedict with spinach and mushrooms (I think?). We saw it on Yelp, so I suggested she get it. I had the chicken and waffles because I really wanted to try Eats' "fancy" version. I'm a Roscoe's fan and I try to get chicken & waffles whenever I can. 

My friend's eggs benedict looked AMAZING. I'm just going to admit that I took a lot more than I was supposed to when she told me to try it. It was delicious. My chicken and waffles were good, but it's definitely different from what I've had in the past. The gravy on the chicken was DELICIOUS, but a little overwhelming.. I could barely taste the chicken. I wanted to eat the chicken and a piece of waffle in one bite, but the waffle was a bit too thick to my liking. I'm used to the flatter, circular ones that Roscoe's and other places use. Anyway, it was delicious but mostly I could only taste the gravy, hence my four (instead of five) stars.

Maybe I'll make a trip there again some time... on a weekday... at lunchtime... to try other dishes and see if they're deserving of one more star :)
author: Alyssa T.

description:
Not sure why I've been here a few times and had all bad to mediocre experiences and keep coming back, but it's in my neighborhood and convenient which is about the only explanation for that. 

Came this past Sunday during the farmers market. First, it was so hot and sunny, you need a small awning!!! We were on fire eating, so uncomfortable. 

Secondly, the prices are outrageous! 9 dollars for  literally less that a cup of cooked oatmeal. No maple syrup, brown sugar or milk given unless you ask. Juices? 6.50 for a small cup. Seriously? Might as well drink a mimosa at that rate. 

Third, my oatmeal and toast were completely cold, asked for milk and brown sugar from bus boy who delivered food. He tried to tell me they didn't have brown sugar and gave me the packets of sugar, showed up with milk after I was already finished, and I'm a pretty slooowwww eater. 

Although it should be a 1 star experience, our waiter was amazing, knew I was semi upset and brought a free oatmeal and was very apologetic. Although he probably thought I was beyond annoying - he played the game. Ha! He was the thin guy with a funky mustache and tattoos. 5 stars for him.
author: Alexis T.

description:
This is a nice little breakfast / brunch spot. As other reviewers have pointed out, there's usually a long wait, I had to wait for almost 30 minutes but the good part is that you don't have to stand in a line and you can at least take a seat on the bench right outside. The staff tries their best to get you a table asap.

My table ordered the smoked salmon omelette, spicy tomato skillet and buttermilk pancakes. The Salmon Omelette was a little bland for my taste but not too bad and the spicy tomato skillet was actually a spicy soup with kale and potatoes topped with a sunny side up egg, was one of the best breakfast items I have ever had and I will go back just for this again. The pancakes were also really good.
author: Saadullah S.

description: Was greeted with a smile and very attentive servers. Very warm and upbeat is what people need in the morning. I had the scrambled eggs, bacon, toast and potatoes which was a great portion and very tasty. Outdoor seating is a plus with this place and plenty of on street parking. I would definitely take friends and out of owner to this wonderful breakfast restaurant. Thumbs up!!!
author: Shar I.

description: My partner and I ate here for the first time on Wednesday, lunchtime. Great little place, great food! I love it. My partner, a picky eater, so enjoyed his waffle and berries he ordered one to go. I had the Season's Omelet with fresh veggies and goat cheese. YUM! And, roasted garlic in the potatoes! That alone won me over! Staff was friendly and fun. Even on a Wednesday we waited a short while to get in so I imagine it's packed on the weekend. But ... go there!
author: Richard A.

description:
Skillet!!!!  Hells yeah!!!

One of the missing puzzles to my American food adventure.  Brunch served in a skillet.  The Spicy Tomato Winter Skillet is a winner.  Make sure to request extra bed so you don't waste a single drop of that spicy tomato goodness.

And then wash it all down with some delicious fruit juice concoctions.
author: Angela Y.

description: This is probably my favorite place for breakfast brunch because not only is the food great , the menu has a wide breadth of choices- including fresh juices and other heathy foods. Lastly- the vib is super friendly .
author: Delfina P.

description: Best brunch place EVER. Love the garlic potatoes and the chicken and waffles! I've pretty much tried everything on the menu. The seating is really tight and the wait can be thirty minutes to an hour sometimes but it's worth it!
author: Fawn M.

description: No wait--finally was able to walk in and get a table (on a Tuesday.) Busy and noisy crowd as usual. Bacon avocado tomato  cheddar Omelet with fruit bowl (extra $) was good. The rye toast was highly enjoyable! Nice environment...just a little (lot) noisy with the juicer or coffee grinder going off every now and then. Wait person/Server was not very attentive though friendly enough taking order ...could not be flagged down ---a downer to an otherwise nice visit.
author: E W.

description: I like the atmosphere here. Went with a good friend here and it was pretty good. I also like how there is a "half ben" which is half the side of a regular meal which means u can just order a smaller size if you are not too hungry for food. I like the service here bc the waitresses were super friendly and nice! I would come back for some breakfast food. :)
author: Joanne C.

description: This place is great, the wait was short. When I got there the waitress was very polite. I ordered the Hobbs bacon and egg sandwich. It was so good!!!! The egg was cooked perfectly. When I cut through the yolk, the yolk gushed out. The orange juice was fresh squeezed. Overall, the food and service was good. I recommend going on a weekday so the wait isn't long for you.
author: Bailey C.

description: Was greeted quickly and friendly. Love the vibe. Food was delicious. Wish my waffle was bigger.
author: Travis F.

description:
Great menu and nice place. It takes some time to actually get in for Sunday brunch, but it's so worth it.

The chicken and waffles (with mushroom gravy) that my friend ordered looked awesome. I ordered a skillet which was super filling but I wasn't a huge fan of the sauce in it. Overall great brunch experience though! And sometimes there's a farmer's market next door which is also super cool.
author: Idk A.

description:
Super good breakfast. I got the breakfast suite and wished I had ordered an extra waffle. 

Loved the waffle! 

The line moved pretty fast. I think we waited about 20 minutes to get in. Restaurant is small, so doesn't have much room.
author: Dayna D.

description:
Seriously good breakfast grub in an unlikely location, service quality goes downhill when slammed during a farmer's market.

I've been going to the recent Clement Street farmer's market on Sundays, when you have to wait half an hour or more for a seat, fair enough. Everyone is happy and eager.

Here's how it suffers when over-busy: not just slow to wait, serve, etc., but the server forgets half of the requests and orders. Want a refill on water or iced tea? 50/50 that will happen. Order one kind of toast or another, maybe, maybe not. Not? Ten minutes later she takes the dish back to the kitchen and ten minutes after that it comes back, corrected, and not too warm for the process. In fact, nothing here was too warm. It wasn't just one mistake, but one after another: no water, no refills, misdone order, no utensils (had to dash in to service station and steal them for myself). So obviously the place won't function at capacity.

They're not bad staff, or unfriendly, or anything else, just not capable of handling the load when the place is busy.

The saving grace? The food. When my dish, a "spicy tomato" vegetarian thing, came out, it was utterly delicious, fresh, homemade, and all around memorable, if only moderately above room temperature. You could tell they made the stewed tomatoes in house, and many other fresh ingredients.I'll just say, there was nothing left on the plate, what I couldn't sop up with bread I used my fingers. Another dish with poached eggs, they really know how to poach an egg, if you are here and you order an egg, your egg has been poached.

Half the dishes com eon an unruly huge overflowing plate. The other half are skillet dishes on an iron pan that looks disappointing at first, but after you've started to eat it, you realize that's ore than enough food fior you. Presentation is actually very nice.

So this was two star service and four star food, and a very decent breakfast. Your choice.
author: Gil S.

description:
Baguette with strawberries, honey and goat cheese- what more do I need to say? 

We went mid morning on a Monday so we didn't have the long line issues other reviewers have mentioned. Instead, we grabbed two seats on the bar facing the window. It's a fairly small place and fairly basic. Our server was friendly. 

First thing on the menu: fancy toast- baguette with honey and either fresh strawberries and goat cheese or almond butter and bananas. Both were sweet and mouthwatering. I'm not talking a few berries here, I'm talking a whole huge pile. 

The caprese scramble was delicious. Calling it a scramble is a little misleading. All the ingredients were piled on top so you can mix the bites as you like. The tomatoes were cold- which is how I like them. There was both fresh shredded basil and pesto with large chunks of mozzarella.
author: Gretchen G.

description: Love the ambience of this cute brunch cafe, but sadly the food did not live up at all to my expectations.  From the line outside this restaurant, I would have expected the food to be far better tasting, but sadly I was very disappointed.  I ordered the pulled pork hash while my friend ordered the mushroom spinach benedict.  The pulled pork hash was absolutely inedible.  It consisted of a bland combination of pulled pork, a few potatoes, and onions. All of this was steeped in a super oily mixture of nonexistent spices and sauce. The only redeeming part of this dish was the crusty bread served on the side.  I literally only ate 1/3 of the dish before giving up completely.  My friend also said her benedict was at best average.  I'm giving this cafe 2 stars for it's decor and service, but it misses the mark completely with their food.
author: Evie P.

description: Really good! It's a very nice spot, especially for brunch. The service was great. I would definitely recommend the waffle berries and creme. Overall, a great place.
author: Cora M.

description:
This place seems like an ideal brunch place.  However, when I went it was a little confusing on how to get tables and how they were organized.  When I eventually found out there was this red erasable board right outside the door.  What I didn't like about it is that anyone could come up and erase your name because it's outside.  

When I went, the wait was a little long, which was prolonged by the slooow workers.  This is a small place so when I see 2 tables not being cleared with people standing in line it shows that the priorities of the restaurant is not in line.  There was also a little argument regarding the wait and how the servers sat diners.  When we did finally get seated, our server was nice, but not as attentive as he could have been considering how small this place was.

My table had the chicken and waffles, waffle bacon, banana chocolate chip pancake, the 2-eggs any style, and the chicken sausage.  The chicken and waffles was pretty good.  I think the chicken made the dish; it was juicy, warm, and not greasy!  The waffle bacon was pretty good.  Did like how the cheese was melted within everything.  The banana chocolate chip pancake tasted exactly what it sounds like.  It wasn't too sweet for me, but for some reason I wasn't in the mood too try too much.  The chicken sausage was pretty good.  I was pretty happy it.

If you have a pup and the tables are out, this place would be pretty nice to eat at.  But be warned about the wait time and the slow service.  Not sure if I'll be back here because I'm sure SF has much better places.
author: Sola L.

description:
Great breakfast for something beyond the standard dinner fare.

The polenta and sausage with little tomatoes was awesome! Definitely try that. We shared that with some blueberry pancakes and an added side of bacon. Oh get the bacon, some of the best I've had!

Great strong black coffee! 

Cute, small place. There was a wait for breakfast/brunch even on Friday, when I wrongly assumed other people had to work. You can creepily watch them eat their good-looking food from the sidewalk outside. Write your name on the column when you arrive to secure your spot on the waiting list.
author: Kelly T.

description: Amazing food and environment! Tasted like real food, I had berries and waffles while my brother and mom had eggs. They both were wounderful and made me feel like they were just made!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Great brunch place but go early during the weekend. The lines tend to be long. I ordered the polenta dish with customized addition of spicy sausages and it was delicious. The polenta is not as creamy as most with some melted parmesan cheese. The spicy sausage added a bit of kick in the dish which also stimulated one's appetite. The poached egg had the perfect texture, with runny egg yolk flowing on top of polenta once broken. An amazing concoction. Even though my stomach overreacted a bit, like with most southern food, i still enjoyed it immensely.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Definitely overhyped. Maybe because there aren't many American brunch options in this area? 

Unfortunately the quality of their brunch menu does not warrant the overly long lines here. However, I guess if you come during the weekdays in an off hour you'll probably be seated quite quickly so that is the only time I would suggest coming here. 

This is coming from someone who lives close enough to walk here so I don't even have to deal with the difficult parking situation on Clement street.
author: Heidi Q.

description:
Super popular breakfast/brunch spot.  Always a line from 9am.  Although coming at 9am, it wasn't too much of a wait, maybe 15 minutes.  I would say that's the longest I'll wait for this place.

Had the panko breaded chicken breast with mushroom gravy and two 3" square waffles.  The syrup wasn't hot and wasn't enough and wasn't anything special, similar to ones you buy off the shelf.  I wasn't sure the mushroom gravy albeit seasoned well worked with the waffles?  I love chicken and waffles but this ain't the fried southern version, more yuppie/hipster/healthy style.  The chicken breast itself was juicy but I wish it was a thigh, again different version.

I suspect it's the only brunch place around there and a neighborhood thing.  I'll try their huevos rancheros, waffle bacon and bacon and egg sandwich next time.  That sounded good too.

Coffee was plain.  Service was excellent.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I hate to do it but I have to knock a star off for Eats. While it's a cute and cozy brunch spot, their service leaves much to be desired. It took a little over 10 minutes for someone to come take our drink and food order. Later, I asked for some jam, because ya know...you need that for toast, and I never got it. 

I saw a sign that they are looking for a server so hopefully they get someone soon. I really do like this place, I just wish their service was better!
author: Stephanie C.

description: A lot of my friends have gone here and said that it was one of their favorite brunch spots to go to.  There is ALWAYS a line whenever I walk past their restaurant too.  So, my friend and I wanted to see what the hype was all about.  Overall, it was an alright experience.  The waiters were really nice and always refilled our waters and asked if we enjoyed the food.  I got a spicy tomato skillet.  It has kale, onions, potatoes, bell peppers, sunny side eggs, cheese, and grilled bread.  I LOVE spicy food but I just felt that the dish was overpowered by the spiciness.  I couldn't really enjoy the flavors of the tomato and onions, etc.  However, my friend had the breakfast suite (I think that was what it's called) and it was really good! So, definitely come to just try it out.
author: Sam L.

description: Went in for lunch in hopes of getting yummy breakfast options. They did not disappoint! I had 3 in my group and all of us were really happy with our selections. We had the Cowboy Burrito, The Breakfast Shuffle and 2 eggs any style with the addition of 1 pancake. Everything was delicious and came out hot. Our server was gracious and very attentive. The only downside is that it took awhile to get the food. This is definitely not a place to go for a "quick bite." It took us about an hour from start to finish. I will definitely be back soon!
author: Karen F.

description: John is a terrible waiter. He is rude to customers, does not listen well, and touches women on the shoulders unnecessarily.  He ruined our breakfast experience.  He has no self-awareness and was defensive when given feedback.
author: annabel l.

description:
Good ol' Richmond Eats.

There's nothing like a good American breakfast to start your day up right. Well, if your anything like me, chow is continuous, and you love the simple joys of sleeping in and having breakfast well past the afternoon. That's where Eats come in. A small brunchary located in my neighborhood, the Richmond. Quite one of the only traditional breakfast joints within the area too, unless your diggin' for some Denny's or Mel's Drive-In (noty)..

B.A.T. Scrambled Eggs - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/21wF1dQFS2bEL56DuqxRsw?select=jFblpkCkO7hpEdlRhqyzHg#lBRXByzfmXMEtjUuymRizQ
BACON!+Avocado+Tomato (the BLT of breakfast scrambles). The bacon was thick cut and crispy, they were very generous with the amount of avocado, and the scrambled eggs topped with the freshly chopped tomatoes made for a satisfying meal that didn't feel overly heavy. 

Jr. Pancakes - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/21wF1dQFS2bEL56DuqxRsw?select=jFblpkCkO7hpEdlRhqyzHg#Ea_rIhbZ0qr2gnKYpB4B9Q
With the use of freshly cut strawberries, blueberries, and bananas, it was cute how they plated it to look like bears (see picture). I think my little sister really enjoyed that. Hey, if my sister is happy, that makes me happy! 

Hummus and Eggs - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/21wF1dQFS2bEL56DuqxRsw?select=jFblpkCkO7hpEdlRhqyzHg#o_1UpXWxvb3GCUDh2tTleg
Surprisingly good. Don't get me wrong, I haven't converted into no vegetarian or anything (don't be absurd), but the hummus had a great spicy kick that jumped out of nowhere, which was also pretty filling. 

Chicken and Waffles - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/21wF1dQFS2bEL56DuqxRsw?select=jFblpkCkO7hpEdlRhqyzHg#rUINd1M_LLjKdNr5LICqHg
The waffles were cooked perfectly, warm, and soft on the inside, crispy on the outside, but the chicken was sadly over cooked.. the gray-brownish mushroom sauce didn't look too appetizing either.. However, the Eats crew happily replaced the meal for us, no frills. 

Eats is a nice cozy place to grab some homey morning food and with some minor tinkering, they can have breakfast down like Mama's. The service was nice and friendly, especially when we wanted to send the chicken back, and it was simply great just to have a place that I could take my little sister for breakfast (she never had pancakes before). Just be advised that coming early is recommended because a line WILL form during peak hours, and a +3.5% HealthySF fee is applied on all visits.
author: Albert L.

description:
Eats has been around for as long as I can remember but I've never eaten at the place up until recently.

You can't miss Eats, it looks like a bee hive, and by bee hive I mean there's always a swarm of people surrounding it waiting to get in.

I've only come on two occasions and both were only so-so. The first time I got the caprese scramble, who doesn't love a good caprese? I thought it was okay, didn't blow my mind or anything. The second time I got the chicken and waffles, the chicken had a nice crispy and crunchy breading all over but I would have like the chicken itself to be more moist, as for the waffles, they were alright too. Both times I've come in, I saw the other patrons order the homemade waffle berries and creme, and they look damn delicious.

The wait wasn't horrendously long, so I was able to get a table within 10-15 minutes.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Pretty solid breakfast. I had my usual bacon and eggs and my dude had some sort of hearty looking skillet. I should have just ordered one of those too since it's not every day that one can eat out of a skillet. 

I loved the homey casualness of the interior. 

It was a random weekday morning so were able to find parking and a place to sit rather quickly.
author: Loli L.

description:
I've been here twice and have had a great experience both times. Staff is fantastic. Super friendly, attentive, and fun. Menu is great. So many options, almost too many. I stare at it blankly for a solid 10 minutes because I want one of each. 

However, I have gotten the vegetarian brunch sandwich with which everyone at the table had food envy and the huevos rancheros. Both were amazing. Big fan of the rancheros. Bloody Mary's are top notch as well.

Ambience is great. I came with groups of 6 and 4, and they were able to accommodate us within 25 minutes both times at a prime 10:30 brunch time. I wouldn't come with more than 6 though.

Will definitely be back. Everyone who's been has only great things to say.
author: Lesley S.

description: Not worth the price. Went here with my bf, we ordered chx&waffles, a chx sandwich, 1 coffee and 1 hot tea which came to $36 plus tip.  The food is always just ok.  There are so many better breakfast/brunch spots in SF. This is always my last resort breakfast spot.
author: Kelia F.

description:
I have been going here since I moved to the neighborhood in 2010. If used to be my go to spot but over the last 6-2 months it has really fallen off; the food is grenadier and service is much worse. On my last trip, they never put my order in, which we discovered only after they delivered my gf's dish and I was waiting for another ten minutes. After complaining they rushed my huevos rancheros out, but it looked and tasted like grease soup and the waitress never apologized (or even came by). :(

In its hey day, it had great egg dishes with amazing home fries. However, after 3 consecutive trips of greasy food and horrible service, I am looking for a new neighborhood breakfast spot.

Update: lowered to 1 star. This place has only gotten worse. They don't even seem to care at this point and its popular enough that it doesn't matter apparently.
author: Joe G.

description: This place it's amazing one of my favorites around this block. They're food is great. Amazing customer service.
author: Lisseth C.

description:
I am sure all the food is amazing but the only thing I get when I am there is the huevos rancheros. It is seriously the best huevos rancheros I have ever had! Looking around the food always looks amazing but I just can't bring myself to stray from the huevos rancheros because it's so yummy.

The atmosphere is super cute and cozy. It's a great breakfast spot and always hits the spot. There can be a tiny bit of a wait but they generally do a good job of moving the wait list quickly and will serve you coffee while you wait which is much appreciated.
author: Lizzy U.

description:
Nothing too special. We went on a Sunday for brunch and there was a long wait. No biggie, you just write your name on the chalkboard column outside the door. Cool idea. 

We got sat at the table that the door to the bathroom opens up to which was definitely not ideal for eating. But we moved when another table emptied up. The food was good, I was expecting more from my succotash after looking at other yelpers' pictures but whatever. My friends liked their food so that's good, I guess.
author: Ally Y.

description: The tastiest Belgian waffles I've had in a LONG time. The service was great, our waiter had a great personality. The wait went by fast and the entire restaurant had great decor. Great for a breakfast date or family breakfast!
author: Quintin W.

description:
I got the half banana chocolate chip pancake and the boyfriend got the breakfast suite with scrambled eggs and chicken sausage. As a lover of all things sweet, I really liked my pancakes... I didn't even need to use syrup! Boyfriend's eggs were just all right but the chicken sausage was good with a nice kick to it. 

They are a little understaffed so things take awhile
author: Malia B.

description:
Came here on a Saturday mid-morning, there was a wait but it was not too bad for a party of five in such a small place. I'm giving 3 stars for a generally underwhelming experience, especially considering the price. I would go here again if someone wanted to, but I wouldn't suggest it.

I got the pulled pork hash ($13.50), which turned out to be a stew, not a hash. It was really not what I was expecting and I wasn't a fan of it. It was pretty warm in the restaurant and on the rare occasion when our water glasses were refilled it was with warm water. Overall I the service was indifferent.
author: Frank C.

description: Delicious bacon and egg sandwich. Everything on the menu looked good so I'm already planning my next trip. The roasted potatoes are really good and have a kick to them because of the black pepper. I love that they offer half plates so you can try various things. Excellent service too!
author: Semuteh F.

description: Pretty good cafe with outdoor seating.  Dog friendly, with a friendly waitstaff.  My pancakes were pretty solid.
author: Brian B.

description:
A gem of the inner Richmond. Yes, the wait can be long. It's a small restaurant with a small seating area, as to be expected in a San Francisco establishment. But the food is worth it.

I really like their brunch food. I love the Vegetarian Egg Sandwich. It's very filling and is a great options for vegetarians. The Juevos Rancheros are alright, nothing exceptional. The So Happy Hotcakes are incredible - I usually don't order anything sweet for breakfast but the strawberry glaze has an acidic quality to it that balances the lemon poppyseed pancakes perfectly.

I am giving them four stars because I love local businesses, but I wish I could give them a 3.5. Not quite a 3 because the food is awesome. But they don't really deserve a 4 either since their service can be really frustrating. I understand that it is a tight squeeze inside and adding another staff member would be just too many bodies. But it is so hard to get attention from their wait-staff. Even to get a refill on coffee or water is a struggle. Their service can be really, really slow and later in the afternoon it gets worse. That said, I understand they do the best they can with the amount of people they have and their servers are working really really hard to keep up. But I'd almost rather wait longer outside if they decided to take one or two tables out so that they can add another server for quicker service.

My suggestion: Go for the food. Go with company that you want to sit and talk with for a while (because you'll be waiting for service). Don't go if you're starving and need food immediately. And try to go before 9:30ish so you don't have to wait in a long line. And definitely avoid going in large groups!

Last comment, maybe families go there and sometimes it can be a bit much if there are screaming children in the small dining area.
author: Laura C.

description:
Great Breakfast/Brunch 

I went here with my grandmother who she told me about this place she the bowl size cappuccino.
author: Seaera T.

description:
I seriously don't get anyone giving Eats less than 5 stars. Ate here two Friday mornings in a row & had amazing service and food both times.

I ordered a typical breakfast...eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast. It was all delicious. Their bacon is just the right consistency (crispy but not burnt), their potatoes are BOMB - they have chunks of garlic throughout and their english muffin was the best english muffin I have ever had. My husband had Spicy Tomato Skillet  with kale, sauteed onions, potatoes, bell peppers, sunny up eggs, parmesan, grilled bread and the other time he got their  Caprese Scramble  -cherry tomatoes, pesto, fresh mozzarella, parmesan. Loved them both

Can't speak to their coffee- I'll admit I brought in my own coffee from Camaica-(formerly Martha's Bros. Coffee) one block away. 

I want to say something about the service. There were about 3 servers when we were there. Each one was more pleasant than the next & I observed how well they worked together collaboratively to keep things moving & customers happy. Seems like a pleasant place to work - you can tell when the servers aren't happy...

It's all that's important to me in a restaurant, cafe, etc. - good food and good service. Eats has it all & if you want a great breakfast, this is the place to go in the Inner Richmond. Seriously.
author: Dee B.

description:
Tips:

Sign in on the blackboard on the column in front of the front entrance. (counter, outdoor, or table seating)

They are NO LONGER serving their Brioche French Toast because they are temporarily perfecting the recipe. 

-----------------------------------------------------------
