I came here on a late afternoon with a couple of my friends and overall we had a good experience.

I personally think Eats is very under-staffed. There were only about 2 or 3 waitresses waiting on  a whole bunch of tables and it was hard to get their attention.

I was very much looking forward to the french toast and I was saddened to hear they were no longer serving it temporarily. I instead went with the regular pancakes and they tasted great.
author: Alice H.

description: Solid breakfast/brunch spot.  Long lines on weekends.  Food is good.  Outside seating for parties of 3 or more not permitted.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Service was great!

Food not so great!
Chicken n waffles- plain n dry. Came with a nasty mushroom sauce. Sauce tasted sour and pasty. 
Spicy hash skillet (something like that) : was more like a stew, tasted ok. 

Will not returning, less than mediocre food. Sorry Eats!
author: Jangalina J.

description: Food was ok but they didn't take the orders upon my request without those ingredients that I don't like.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Finally made it to Eats this past weekend!

Excellent, fun and attentive wait staff. The people who work here seem happy and enjoy what they do. After waiting a while outside in the rare, hot San Francisco sun it was great to have a very helpful person walks us through the menu and guide our stomachs to the most popular and scrumptious dishes. 

I ordered the chicken and waffles. As someone who has experienced Roscoes in Los Angeles probably more than a healthy amount of times, I'm really picky when it comes down to this dish. Having said that, I would say it was just about average, with other places in the city having the advantage on this particular dish. 

The food came out fairly quickly but it was a bit unfortunate that the waffles were cold and the chicken and gravy were piping hot. Other than that, the waffles weren't much to write home about but the chicken and gravy were pretty good.

It can be a bit cramped in here and you can expect a bit of a wait on the weekends but I do look forward to coming back and bumping up a star or two while ordering another dish.
author: Jonathan B.

description: I ordered a waffle, a spicy sausage, and a bagel with smoked salmon and avocado. 2 stars for a delicious sausage. Everything else was terrible. The waffle was tiny, lukewarm and mediocre. My bagel got cold while waiting more than 10 minutes for them to bring the smoked salmon. When they brought me a new bagel, it was clearly burnt. I even smelled something burning 30 seconds before they brought it to me and thought to myself "I hope that's not my bagel burning." But of course it was, and they just didn't care enough to remake it. The girl who brought it to me (who turned out to be the manager) said it wasn't her fault because she didn't even look at it, she just brought it to me, and some people actually like their bagels burnt.
author: Liam S.

description: Variety of sweet and savory options. Waffle Bacon rules. Be prepared to wait. Good coffee, poured frequently.
author: Ben A.

description:
The food is so so.

The service is great, but everytime I go there, we have to wait 30minutes to get a table and I always feel disappointed about the food.

I really try to go back there, my gf love that place but meh... No I just can't. And the place is so small that you have no intimacy. If you like to get the last gossip of a group of 20ish blond girl, please go ahead, but this is not for me.
author: Tarek A.

description:
This place has never let me down. If you don't mind a 15-20 minute wait then you'll have a great experience here. 

I have always gone for breakfast on the weekends so I knew that there would be some sort of a wait no matter what at any cute breakfast place. They have a chalkboard outside where you can write your name and specify if you want a private table or don't mind a communal table. I've sat at both and don't mind the coziness. You also have to be the kind of person that doesn't mind a loud happy atmosphere full of conversations and music (now that I think of it, is there music?) haha. 

They have regular mimosas as well as apple mimosas that give you a little buzz so you know they don't skip out on the champagne like some places. They have a great variety of breakfast items and a few sandwich options for those who are looking for more lunch choices. 

The only problem I've had here is during a busy Sunday morning my credit card was given to another table and charger $33 dollars when my bill was only $12. The people at the table realized it wasn't their card luckily so I was given it back and reimbursed, however it always takes about 4-5 business days to get it refunded. That can be a hassle for a struggling student or someone who always has to check their bank account when making a purchase like me. 

Overall I have always had a great experience here. The food is delicious and the eggs are cooked to perfection. I had a fried egg, arugula sandwich on ciabatta bread and my boyfriend had the caprese scrambled eggs...mmmm! Their home fries and french fries aren't bad either!
author: Ashley M.

description:
Who doesn't love brunch! 

I go there often on Sundays for brunch, just be prepared to wait a while. Sundays are great because there is a farmers market outside that you can wander around while you wait. Just don't wander too far from the restaurant and lose your spot! 

My boyfriend and I go there often and had a few different things on the menu.  We especially loved the chorizo.  I usually go for the pancakes or waffles choice.  Everything is great
. 
My bf especially likes that they have fresh lemonade.
author: Erin W.

description:
Just perfect.

If you are a breakfast/brunch fan -- then this is a must visit!  

It was also right in my neighborhood, and who doesn't love something walking distance?  

It also helps that the price is right!  I remember be surprised at the quality of the food for the price....I wish I had went here more often.
author: Red R.

description:
if you like eggs Benedict try their Ham & Tomato Benedict. [I'm already drooling]
And don't forget those awesome Ricotta pancakes, yummm
author: T M.

description: Super friendly, great hometown diner feel with California fresh cuisine and great oldies to listen to in the background.  Can't wait for my next breakfast there.
author: Michael G.

description:
Came here around 8:30 on a Tuesday morning and didn't have to worry about long lines or waiting for a table. Parked a block down in a two hour zone and had no problem finding that spot. 

Ordered the spinach eggs Benedict that comes with salad or potatoes, which I paid $16 total, including tip. Service was really good, as the host kept coming back to check on me as were other people working there. Portion was big--couldn't finish what I had and boxed it up for later. However, the flavors of the feta cheese spinach eggs Benedict were nothing too special and I wish they had found a way to make it more interesting. If the other foods on the menu are the same, I probably wouldn't come back again, but I'd be willing to give them another shot to find out.
author: Reanna T.

description: Pretty good eats!  Yes I just made a pun.  The place is small, but i came late on a Sunday so I didn't really have to wait.  I was actually most excited about the make your own mimosa option.  1 bottle of champagne and your choice of juice for $20.  But I was the only one drinking so I didn't want to commit myself to a whole bottle.  I loved the grilled bread in the Spicy Tomato Skillet with the tomato and eggs, but I found the rest of it kind of bland.  The waffle we ordered was the perfect size.  We got the half order so it was nice to have a little sweet with our salty dishes.  The fruit was fresh and the waffle was delish!  Nice neighborhood breakfast joint.
author: Elena N.

description: All I can say is DELICIOUS food! I've been here three times now and I love it. The food tastes amazing and so do the drinks. I usually come for brunch even though the place gets rather busy, but it's worth the wait. I just want to try everything on the menu. Trust me you won't regret coming here!
author: Amanda D.

description:
This place has been here like for evez... My cousin is town so we decided to try this place out.... From half a block away you can see a line out tha door, DAM!!! Hate that, but at least u can assume it's gonna be bomb shiggity. While waiting you know I has to be one of them people that stare at what other people are eating. We ordered the B.A.T bacon avocado tomato scramble, Waffle Bacon w/ potatoes and the Pulled Pork hash. Soo let me tell you, the pulled pork hash just blew everything we ordered out the water. I'll get to that later, let's talk about the bacon waffle, it was just a thick slab of waffle with a thick slab of cheese and sunny side up eggs on top and my plate was pretty cold like u can tell the melted cheese got hard again, first bite was koo and then it just became a bit much of un satisfaction, at least the potatoes were garlicky but a tad bit dry. The B.A.T was eehh! Alright it's basically  scrambled eggs with big pieces of bacon, 2 dollops of avocado and a sprinkle of diced tomatoes. WTF! "The food prolly had me feeling some type of way!"  because I was starring at someone else's order of the Chicken and Waffles... That was lookin right for my type, smothered in mushroom gravy. Dam I should have ordered that. Oh wells! Let's get to the good part this pulled pork hash came in a little skillet okay, the only hot plate out of the 3 that we ordered it had potatoes,bell peppers and I think that's it. Maybe it was so bomb because it was seasoned with some Latino spice! (Andalay andalay areeba senior) umm ummm good!!! Most def a try there.

P.s the water could have been a little better service was good though the employees are nice. 

If I come back I'm getting the chicken and waffles
author: YennyMack L.

description:
3.5 stars

Cheap eats that are good eats?

Breakfast items range from $6 to $8. Depending on if you get pancakes, omelettes or the typical 2 eggs with meat on the side combo.  The home fries are greasy but it tasted ok, and those are included with the combos except for the pancakes. 

There is a bit of a wait even though we arrived here at 12:30pm on a Sunday.  This place is small and they only have a couple of tables that can sit parties of 4 or more.  (the ventilation is not good either, I ended up smelling like my breakfast after I left!)

But really, we are here for the delicious Ricotta pancakes, yes?

Oh and the corned beef hash and eggs, yes?

also the huge omelets that they have, yes?

Yes. 

Go here for huge portions that will leave you stuffed until dinner time.
author: Janice C.

description: I love this place. Great when I work from home. Now that they renovated it though, they took away the bar table top seats for one. Kind of a bummer because this is a place I normally go alone. Many folks do. The wait wasn't too long, but i rarely ever had to wait and it feels like a waste. There are s lot of people who are two. So then they also have a longer wait. Love the food and the servers. Nice that they upgraded but was nice to have the one person spots.
author: Liza F.

description:
Went for brunch on Sunday. Didn't get there until about noon and was sat within about 20 minutes. I got the Huevos Rancheros and my friend got the kale salad. The huevos rancheros were good, although I would have liked/preferred black beans (ugh, who's this picky chick writing the review...i know...). I felt that it was a little overpriced for what you got, although it was filling. The beans were mostly sauce, so it felt like the dish was made cheaper than it should have been. 

Otherwise service was nice. I may be back at some point, but I'm not going to be running around telling everyone to get there ASAP.
author: Maggie F.

description: I went on a really nice day so we ate outside. The Waffle Bacon was so good and service was quick and polite. Definitely eating brunch here again!
author: Connie D.

description:
Service and food was exceptional. Place is small and cozy. You might have to wait a while to get a table but once you do it's worth the wait. 

The bowl of fruit is generous, fresh, and delicious. The Power C juice is refreshing and tasty. The server was fun, kind, and attentive. 

Will definitely return!
author: Chris O.

description: Great breakfast in a cool, cozy, hipster environment. I liked their breakfast dishes. Being a foodie, everything tasted great! Enjoy because I did.
author: K C.

description: Cowboy burrito was fab, mimosa was good, but it great. Disconnected eggs were very good.
author: Lance M.

description:
Waited for ~15-20 min on a random Wednesday morning.

I ordered the waffle with berries and cream...holy mother of God the WHIPPED CREAM was fantastic (and my friends agreed). I think I would've paid just to eat that cream. I mean, the waffles were good (crispy and fluffy), but the CREAM. I was basically licking my plate at the end.

My friends got the chicken and waffles. I tried a bit of the chicken, and while it is good, I would suggest getting the gravy on the side like other reviewers have mentioned, because it may not be for everyone.

All the waitstaff seemed genuinely happy to be there and even accommodated our larger party (so we didn't have to wait as long) by offering us a smaller table--which we still fit at.

Also, all of us paid with separate cards even though we didn't ask our waitress for separate checks, and there were no problems/questions/snooty attitudes with that.

But really though. Just go for the whipped cream.
author: Deborah S.

description: AYYYEE FIRST TIMER. First off, Jonathan was THE BOMB. His service was great and he was very friendly, definitely coming back for the energetic atmosphere!! I am a picky eater so this place gets 4 stars for basically the service. When I called in to see if they had any open tables, I had the first impression that it wasn't going to be a good experience because some guy literally just said it depends and hung up on me. BUT our waiter made me think otherwise!! EXTRA TIP FOR YAH MAN, YOU DESERVE IT. The food was alright. I ordered the waffles and crème and it was just as expected, another waffle I've had at any other restaurant but decorated nicely. I also got a cappuccino which wasn't too bad!  The food wasn't necessarily bad, I am just a REALLY picky eater! So if yah want decent brunch and some bomb ass service, come here.
author: Katrina C.

description:
I'd be lying if I said I didn't come here for the chicken and waffles. Funny thing about that, I actually didn't end up ordering it. My bf and I came here on a Monday morning, around 11am. Metered parking was open right outside Eats and no wait to get in. 

We seated ourselves by the counter and our menus were  immediately brought to us. We glanced over the menu and my bf decided to go with the chicken and waffles while I had apple cinnamon french toast with candied walnuts. I added a side of house potatoes for about $3-4. My half order of french toast was about $6. I added a detox juice with apple, beets, ginger, and carrots for about $5 a glass. The chicken and waffles were about $13. Our food arrived promptly. 

We shared half our portions and the chicken and waffles were different and a nice kick. I love the saucy gravy with mushrooms and the chicken was absolutely crunchy. The waffles weren't fluffy like I like but also still a bit crunchy in texture. My half order was really tiny, like one slice of bread tiny. I thought it was overpriced after looking at my portion. The apples were soft and paired well with the walnuts and french toast. 

I did love my breakfast here and will definitely return on a weekday!
author: Connie C.

description: The food is very plain, I would say Denny's is a good analogy. The wait is also over an hour, surprising since the food quality is pretty low end. The prices sadly are not Denny's. :(
author: Yev G.

description: Came here for lunch today and my sandwich did not cut it for me unfortunately. Have been here plenty of times since it is pretty close to my alma-mater (USF) and my friends seem to be obsessed with it. I think this is definitely a better breakfast food spot than lunch. The place is small but there is definitely enough seating for you to come in a large group. The waitresses and hostess are always very nice and attentive which is a good plus. I usually stick to breakfast food here (chicken and waffles and the bacon infused waffle) they are very good and I highly recommend them along with the pancakes. However today I decided to get a sandwich and went with the Cobb sandwich. The chicken was very dry, it made it difficult to chew which is never a good experience. The bacon was also very well cooked and crunchy which to some may be good but to me signifies its burnt and not appetizing. It just was not tasty and for the first time at eatz I had a tough time finishing my meal due to taste. The potatoes were pretty good and gave my meal a plus which was nice. I will definitely be sticking to breakfast foods here, I highly recommend their breakfast foods and mimosas!
author: Josue V.

description: They don't do hot chocolate. What breakfast joint won't do hot chocolate?!? In the end though, the food was good and I got to show my kid how to deal disappointment
author: Katrina R.

description: The spicy polenta breakfast is super yum. The best part? The humble cherry tomato. They have been roasted to perfection. Great place and the service is fast and friendly.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Delicious breakfast spot! They serve fresh juices and a great variety of sweet and savory dishes. You can expect a line on the weekends but it's well worth it.
author: Tamara D.

description:
Expect a long line if you're going on the weekend. We made the mistake and went at 11am, and it was a busy busy hour. We had to wait... 30-40 min? Somewhere around there. 

We ordered the Belgian Waffles with Berries & Cream to share as a appetizer for the table. And it was sooo soo good. The Belgian Waffle was so crisp and delicious with the sweet cream. Mhmm makes me want to buy a Belgian Waffle maker but I don't have the room to store it. The only downside to this dish was the pomegranate seeds. It's a little disconcerting munching down on this item when you have to worry about chomping into a pomegranate seed. Otherwise it was a delicious! 

I ordered the Fried Chicken sandwich and it was indeed huge like other reviewers have mentioned. But I was expecting a chicken breast breaded and fried, instead it seemed like a chicken patty. I think it's the same chicken patty they use for the Chicken & Waffles. Think of it as a chicken katsu since I think it is using Panko breading. But yummy nonetheless. 

My husband got the steak sandwich and that was loaded with steak meat but was also dripping with juices. I believe there was grilled onions mixed into it. I couldn't tell because it was just dripping with juice. He loved it though. 

Our cousins both got omlettes, one got the Omelette with Salmon and the other one got the Spanish Omelette. And both of them said it was really good and they both looked really yummy. 

Overall good people and hardworking people that work here.
author: Grace L.

description:
After craving breakfast food, a friend and I decided to go to Eats for brunch.  

I ordered the Chicken and Waffles.  I'm used to the less healthy version of Chicken and Waffles, so I was surprised when I got a couple cute mini waffles and a chicken breast breaded with panko crumbs and topped with mushroom gravy.  

The food at Eats is good quality.  There are a lot of healthy options on the menu and the food seems very fresh!

The service there is good too.  A lot of friendly servers.  It does get very busy in there, but the wait isn't too bad.

If you enjoy breakfast or brunch, check out Eats!
author: Mary B.

description:
Like other neighborhood locals, I remember Eats before it got too popular for its own good. There was a brief honeymoon period where it actually felt like a local's-only-secret restaurant.

The food is still delicious (I love the mix of healthy and indulgent items on the menu) and the prices are still a bit ridic, but now you should expect to wait close to an hour on weekends. Then, once you're in there, the service is adequate at best. To be fair, the service was never amazing (this IS San Francisco, after all) but at least there was a "hey we're happy to have you here" vibe a few years ago.  Oh, they also used to have a coffee station for people waiting outside, which made the wait more bearable.

Advice to management: step up your service and you might see more turnover. And bring back the coffee outside. It gives some of us a reason to wait 45 minutes for a $20 breakfast entree.
author: Ashley C.

description: the food here is really delicious but you won't ever see me waiting in one of those weekend lines. better to just visit Clement's farmers market and make your own fantastically decadent breakfast at home. (or just come here on a weekday.)
author: Ronny K.

description:
This place is awesome from the friendly service to wonderfully cooked dishes. I can be considered a regular here every Sunday. My favorite dishes are the spicy tomato skillet with polenta (v), pulled pork hash served in a mini skillet and the fried chicken sandwich. Lately I been favoring the spicy tomato skillet as it is delicious and lite on fat. 

This place is highly rated. I'd go back again and again.
author: Marv M.

description:
As a new resident to the san francisco area, I was looking for a great breakfast spot and came across eat's. I got there a little before they opened, and there was already a line out the door! I considered not waiting, especially because it was freezing outside, but after I peeked at their menu, I had to stay. 

About ten minutes later, the sign flipped to 'open', and the huge group of people swarmed into the restaurant, practically filling it completely! As a server myself, I noticed there were only two girls working the floor. At first this concerned me, but once I saw them take charge and do one big sweep of the floor, giving everyone coffee and waters, I knew they had their system down. My order was taken about 5 minutes after sitting, ( I had to wait about another 5 minutes for my fresh juice, but when one of the girls explained to me that she was also my bartender, my food runner and my busser, I didn't mind waiting, and actually gave her props). 
However the table next to me did not seem to understand there wasn't a secret elf in the back making their lattes for them, and were constantly asking where they were. (and I think they thought they were the only table in the whole place) 

About ten minutes later my spinach feta benedict arrived with a side of potatoes. It usually comes with mushrooms on it, but my server told me she liked it with tomatoes and avocado instead, (which is what I got). It was amazing. The fluffiest english muffin I've ever met. I really liked that instead of giving me a generic answer of what to get, she actually told me how SHE orders her food, and was able to get it special, no problem. The fresh squeezed OJ was a perfect compliment too.

Overall Eat's is my new favorite breakfast spot in the city. Not only do these girls work super hard, they are very friendly and helpful, and actually take a minute to chat with you. A few more employees arrived as I was getting ready to leave, and they seemed just as pleasant, thanking me on my way out. 
Eat's you have a new regular!
author: Megan D.

description:
The boyfriend and I came here around 9:15AM on a Sunday and we were seated in 5 minutes. By 9:30 there were tons of people waiting outside so try to get here early.

Chicken & Waffles:
Not your typical chicken & waffles-it's a chicken breast with a panko crust. I personally think the mushroom gravy seems out of place. It just didn't work for me. The waffle wasn't anything special and I think they forgot my honey butter. I appreciated the different take but it didn't really satisfy my chicken & waffles craving.

Zoe's Bacon and Fried Egg Sandwich:
Boyfriend got this and since he wasn't hungry I finished it. I enjoyed this more than my chicken & waffles. The bread was chewy and the egg was nice and runny. The spicy aioli also gives it a really nice kick. The potatoes were also very crispy and had a nice flavor.

Overall it was ok. The service was fine, my coffee was always filled to the top but we were never pestered to leave or hurry up. I'd come back here again because I'm close to the neighborhood and there's other items on the menu that look good.
author: Justin T.

description:
On a rainy Sunday recently, we decided to visit this place after my wife saw the reviews and had a craving for "chicken and waffles".  When we arrived, we were told there was a wait and needed to sign in (on the dry erase board that my daughter HAD to sign because she loves to write her name).  Huge, HUGE props to the female server who was kind enough to offer us a corner seating area (possibly because she saw us with the kids and didn't want us to stand out in the rain).  It was a small table near the window with two chairs and a bench, but it worked for us.  After checking the menu, we decided on the following:

For the boys:
Bacon, Avocado and Tomato Scramble with Sourdough Toast and a side salad.  Definitely was a great choice.  The photo I posted really says it all.  My son and I both enjoyed it.

For the girls:
Chicken and Waffles.  The waffles were nice and thick.  The chicken actually was a flattened chicken breast (2 pieces) with breaded coating and was served with a mushroom gravy (which you can ask to have on the side).  My wife was looking more for an actual bone-in chicken breast, but she said it tasted good regardless.  The waffles were also great according to my daughter.

For the kids to drink:
Hot Chocolate - they couldn't believe how big the cup was (looked like a small soup bowl)!  They used spoons to drink it!  LOL!

For me to indulge:
Tartine - a small toasted baguette with your choice of spreads.  I chose walnut butter and Nutella.  Enjoyed it very much.  It was like a twist on a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup.

The service was friendly and prompt, considering how completely packed the place was.  Glad to see they had plenty of servers on hand.  Our server was a nice guy as well and brought out the food very quickly.

I would definitely like to come back to try other dishes here.  Suggest coming early for the parking and the seating.

FYI - I was able to get a wifi signal from a place nearby that was not secured, so "check in" when you get there.
author: Mario P.

description:
This place has a great vibe and lovely food. I went here for breakfast and we were seated right away. Granted it was during the week so I can only imagine there is a line out the door on the weekends. The service was very attentive and totally welcome to us substituting a bunch of stuff. I had an egg Dish and a waffles which was the perfect size. There is a pork breakfast dish that is amazing and all the fruit is very fresh.

Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the price. Great food and portions are just right but the bill was pretty shocking for three people for breakfast.  With that said I would totally go back
author: Heather S.

description: Great Huevos Rancheros!! Great vibe!! Great service!!
author: Loukas P.

description: Eats offers good food and passable service.  The fried chicken sandwich is my favorite.  The weekend brunch vibe goes in two waves:  The stroller crowd from opening-10am and the hungover hipster crowd from 10am-close.  Expect a wait at most times.
author: Bucky P.

description:
This is a solid neighborhood breakfast/lunch/brunch spot. Their chicken and waffles is a nice version- made with panko and served with a mushroom gravy. Their eggs benedict is a solid choice. An interesting pick is the fig bruschetta- generous pieces of fresh fig over crunchy bread and drizzled with a slightly sweet sauce.

Service is friendly but can be a bit slow. One major bonus is they serve equator coffee and offer free refills!
author: Carmen L.

description:
Eats is slowly becoming one of my favorite brunch spots in the city.....primarily because it's right in my hood!  I only come on the weekdays to avoid the crazy weekend lines.  

My favorites so far are probably the BAT (bacon, avocado, tomato) scramble and the spinach and roasted mushroom benedict....yum yum!

The food is tasty, they give generous portions, wonderful attentive staff, and a warm vibe.  Not too shabby, Eats.
author: Carmen Y.

description:
Eats may very well be my favorite breakfast spot right now. The menu isn't overly large, but every item I've tried has been delicious. Best of all? They offer chicken and waffles. 

They also offer something called a waffle bacon or bacon waffle - I can't remember the order of the words. However, they put slices of bacon on the griddle with the waffle batter and cook it all together. Sounds delicious, doesn't it? The pancakes are also nothing to shake a stick at. And the fruit and yogurt parfait is made with figs among other fruits, which shoves it right into the divine category for me.

The only downside is it's small so you may have to wait a bit for a table. But, that is something I'm easily willing to do for these goods.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Chicken & Waffles is legit!  The mushroom gravy is awesome, but I would get it on the side next time so I can have the Chicken with maple syrup like I like it.  The gravy would be better on something like chicken fried chicken.  Not complaining, just offering suggestions.  The dish is amazing as is!

My girlfriend got the lemon poppy-seed pancakes, which we were worried might be too sweet to start the day with, but they were spot on.  

The waitstaff were all genuinely friendly girls who seemed to work well with one another.  We were pleased with our service, but I can see how some people might not like the tight spot were in.  We, however found it warm and quaint.
author: Kyle S.

description:
We have loved eating at eats for over the last 3 years. But after 3 bad experiences I believe this was our last. 
The food, service, and atmosphere has gone down hill. We used to wake up early to get a table and loved eating the yummy breakfast potatoes with fresh garlic. Today when we got there the potatoes weren't even ready to eat the waiter said and we had to choose different sides. Then when the potatoes were finished toward the end of our meal the waiter brought us some which was nice but we only had one piece of garlic and the potatoes were cooked different than before. Our standard menu item was cooked different too and my eggs were cold and covered with too much pesto sauce and not enough tomatoes. 

Seems like all the "old" and wonderful cooks and servers have left and the new are not up to the same quality. A bummer that mediocrity draws waiting lines.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
My girl & I went to this place on a Wed morning around 10am. Afraid this place would have a line, I called 1st and the friendly lady on the phone said, don't worry, just come in, we have room.

As a waffles fan, and hearing so much about their waffles I had to order some. My girl ordered the "Chicken & waffles" and it was off the charts. I never knew that this combination of food could be this finger licking good. The waffles were fluffy and crisp, and the chicken was tender and whatever batter they used was perfect. 

I ordered the "Waffles & berries" and the whip cream melted on the bananas, berries, and strawberries in a way that could not be described.  

And the Power C drink is not too bad either.

A great place with wonderful food and service. We will definitely be back because its the best place I've had waffles so far.
author: Tony P.

description:
I know the lines here are ridicks but luckily my friend and I got seated pretty quickly on a Sunday. 

This place is sooo delicious. Their potatoes are so good. Roasted with whole garlic. Noms. 

Will definitely be back.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Delicious chicken and waffles but a bit too heavy before a long day at work.

I think we only came here one morning because well...
1 - the boyfriend didnt have work
2 - the lines are nonexistant on a weekday morning

I've always wanted to try it, but whenever we want to go on the weekends, its packed and this one day I didn't need to show up to work...ontime for some reason.

the boy hates green drinks because he does not believe in blending veggies, but they had a green drink (something with apples, lettuce, and pineapple, I think) and he enjoyed it...for once.

Cute place in the Inner Richmond - will be back later other stuff =)
author: Nina Y.

description:
First, the bad:

Cramped and slow. Takes a while to get your food. I guess it's expected on a Sunday brunch, but they sure pack you in like sardines in a can there.

Now, the good:

Food was scrumptious. I had the Spanish Scramble and it was deeeelicious. Chicken sausage was... chicken sausage, but the bell peppers saved it. A little too many onions for my liking, but at least they weren't raw. 

The potatoes on the side were great! Better than Crepevine for sure. I like the hint of garlic, but there sure were a lot of garlic cloves around... it was like 3/4 potatoes and 1/4 garlic cloves :\

The girlfriend had banana chocolate pancakes. They were very good as well. Definitely filled my sweetness quota for the day. It inspired us to get some pancake mix, bananas, and chocolate chips ourselves! (the total cost to make it yourselves will have you making banana chocolate pancakes for weeks for the same cost at the restaurant!!!)

The food saves the day for this place, as it always should... even if it's way too busy there :p
author: Timothy L.

description:
First time I'd been back since the ownership changed. The bacon waffle, as great as it sounds, was disappointing and lacked cohesiveness. It was a pile of eggs on top of a waffle with a strip of bacon baked in. Sounds like it would be good right? It wasn't.
My best tip to you: if you order a dish with a side, get the fruit cup. Even if you love home fries(also weren't very good) they've got a great little fruit cup, and you'll feel o so good about yourself.
author: Christopher B.

description:
Love that we can bring our dog and baby, soak up the sun and enjoy some great food!

Waffle bacon! 
Benedicts

Oh the pancakes!!
author: Christina L.

description:
What to eat at Eats?
Get the smoked salmon omelette with the strong house coffee. 
It was tasty without being overpowering.
I thought it was worthy of a meal.
3.65 rounding up to 4.0 stars.
[Props for the Eats logo-design]
author: Derek N.

description:
Two stars for what was once a solid 4 star restaurant to me...I have been going to Eats since they day they opened under the new management. As a Burma Superstar fan i knew that this place would soon become a fave. They have the same owners and for some time had the same servers.  It is with great sadness that i have fallen out of love with Eats due to their bad service. I mean I expect hipster crap in the mission but seriously on Clement St...it don't fly with me I don't care how great your food might be...the old servers are now gone and with them went the fun, chill atmosphere. It has been replaced with sarcastic...almost rude...I don't want to be working here but i have no choice servers.

After my last two visits the service has left a lot to the be desired. My husband wanted one pancake...so he asked our server "Teal" (yes that's her name)...if he could get just one pancake...she then decided to "school"  him on how to order one pancake. She told him "next time just say you want a side of pancakes not one.." I mean her attitude and demeanor was flat out STANK!! He ordered the "side" of pancake...not "pancakes" as there is only one in a side...be sure to order correctly along with his other food. Guess what never made it to the table...yeah the side of pancake...luckily we were full and did not need the additional calories but the fact that she took the time to educate him on the proper way to order and forget to put in the order was not just an oversight on her part but I believe done out of spite!!

When we told her after our meal that she forgot DA pancake her overreactive attitude and apologies to the moon and back confirmed to me that she was well aware of not putting in the order. She even offered to discount our bill but at that point we were not looking for apologies or a discounted meal. Just a pleasant dining experience would have been good enough...ya know the kind of experience where you are not educated on how the best order your food!!
author: T H.

description: They attempted to poach my eggs twice and failed.  After the second time, I started to explain to the waitress how to poach an egg and she immediately replied with, "Oh...I don't have anything to do with that...it's the cook's responsibility."  Then I said, "Yes, but wouldn't you like to know for future reference as an employee of a food establishment?"  She must have thought I was crazy!  Over-priced food that's not that good, long wait, and over-crowded.  This is all true!
author: Phil B.

description:
My son and I stopped in for brunch as it's close to his home here in the Inner Richmond. Sort of reminds me of Mama's in Washington Park, but minus the long wait. 

I tried the Huevos Rancheros, which included over easy eggs topped on crispy tortillas. Garnished with sliced tomatoes, beans and avocado. Different from what I expected , but tasty.

Service was slow and we had to ask for everything. Really only one bad table in the whole place (sitting right at the entryway, separated by a curtain) and, you guessed right, they put us there. Generally not a complainer, but we quickly tired of people bumping into us.

I recommend you give Eats a try, but refuse to sit at the butt bumping table.
author: Jeff L.

description:
I came here on Tuesday afternoon and there wasn't any wait time. Got seated in the back and ordered a cup of coffee and some chicken and waffles.

They really did things well over here. The waffle came out crispy-soft with just a touch of syrup and powdered sugar with a little container for some extra syrup. Got to love the texture of that waffle. Very well done. 

The fried chicken was just as good. It was a thick piece of white meat and was fried amazingly. It was a nice light airy kind of deep fry that gave the chicken a really great feel. It was covered in a mushroom gravy sauce which I think was the dish's only weak point. Something about it tasted dilute and felt a little watery in my opinion. It wasn't bad but it just didn't surprise me as much as the chicken and the waffle. 

Cup of coffee was better than your average drip. Not sure what coffee they used but it had a little more bite to it. I saw they had an espresso machine. I'll have to try their espresso drinks next time.

Delicious overall. 

$$$ though.
author: Jess E.

description: Absolutely love this place! It's great to go out to brunch with friends and the food is fantastic! I definitely recommend an egg dish or eggs benedict. Also their fresh squeezed orange juice is great as well!
author: Hailey D.

description:
Looked for a brunch place in the Richmond area - so glad I found Eats!

The brother and I were later brunch goers on this Saturday, arriving here a little after 1pm. We waited a total of about 5 minutes, and shared a table with two others. I was pleasantly surprised that this place is owned by the same people of Burma Superstar and B Star. I also really like the ambiance of a small neighborhood place. 

On to the food, I ordered the B.A.T scrambled eggs (bacon, avocado, tomato, white cheddar) and the brother had the waffle bacon. I loved the scallions that came with the eggs, it gave great flavor to every mouthful. The brother's dish looked amazing, and if I wasn't sick I would have definitely ate half of his as well. Service was fast, and we got many refills on the coffee.
author: Jennifer J.

description: The menu itself is very impressive and unique. As I looked around at what everyone else was eating, I just couldn't decide because it all looked good too. I ordered  the waffle egg plate with bacon and a side salad. Everything was perfectly cooked. And they were great sized portions. I hate leftovers, especially breakfast leftovers because eggs are usually gross later on. The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is because we weren't given coffee creamer when our coffee came (the coffee was AMAZING too) our table also didn't have sugar in the raw, and the Cholula bottle was empty. We also had to ask twice for water refills. Service wasn't the best, but the food kind of made up for it.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Huevos rancheros were bomb. I used to get the breakfast suite but I gave up gluten. Both are equally amazing to be honest. Make sure you put your name down early and that your party is there when they call you, or they'll move on to the next person on the list.
author: Tania C.

description: Eats is a cozy cafe on the corner with friendly and energetic staff. My boyfriend and I are regulars there due to the delicious food and consistently fabulous service. They frequently go above and beyond to accommodate us. My favorite foods are the Eggplant Sandwhich and the Banana Chocolate Chip Pancakes but there are lots of lovely choices. Be sure to check them out but if you are going to weekend brunch get there early to put your name on the list. :)
author: Erin D.

description:
The food here is pretty darn good. However, considering the price of rent for a corner spot on Clement, it has to be to stick around. I wouldn't say the food is special or extremely different from any other good breakfast place. 

Every time I go, on Saturday mornings of course, there is a huge line but I have gotten lucky the last 3 times and have been seated within 2 minutes :) 

Don't expect nice friendly service, they're not rude at all, but it's apparent they want you in and out asap.
author: Laura F.

description:
I have no idea why there are two Eats when I searched for this place on yelp but anyways......

I got the spanish omelette and the bf got the B.A.T. ... both were bomb.... I highly recommend this place even though we had to wait like 30 min... but that's alright Clement has a lot of coffee places and stores that you can look at. The service was great and I just loved the food.

However, the bf complained that there was too much pepper on the potatoes and eggs... but i love pepper! oh and they give you cloves of garlic that are crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside with the potatoes. 

Yes go here now!
author: Regina L.

description: We wanted a decent breakfast and decided try this place. We were seated quickly and the place was sort of full. We had Spanish Scramble and Spicy Tomato Winter Skillet. Both were really good. Friendly service and good coffee. Coming back for more!
author: Sara S.

description:
I thought this was a delish place to eat even tho the first server we came across was kinda attidude-y but everyone else we dealt with was nice.  The said attitude-y server lightened up after we were seated so all was good after that.    

We ordered the waffle and the sausage polenta and a detox drink.  I loved the waffle and the sausage polenta was good.  I wasn't crazy about the drink but then again, I'm a pretty simple gal and the detox drink was a bit too fancy for me.

I can't tell you about the price because I don't remember and my friend paid for our meal.  Luckily, we had good timing and got there before there was a wait although it was busy inside.  We would have preferred a non-community table but we were starving and luckily, we ended up sitting by ourselves anyway.  

I'm giving this place 4 stars because I had a good experience but technically, if we could give a 1/2 star, I would deduct that half for the attitude-y server.  Overall, I would eat there again tho.
author: Joyce C.

description: Had the banana chocolate chip pancakes and they were great!  Courteous and prompt wait staff in a small intimate environment.  Will be back the next time I am in the City!
author: Mike S.

description:
Very friendly staff. I called in to ask how long the wait was and in return,  I was asked if I wanted to put my name down so that I wouldn't have to wait as long when I arrived. Super cool.

Kinda cramped inside, but the vibe in there's cool. 

Chicken and Waffles were delicious. The waffle was a belgian waffle, way better than the standard type. And the chicken was butterfly'd and breaded. AND you get TWO pieces. AND it's covered in this shiitake (I think) mushroom gravy. It really hit the spot.

Tri Tip Sandwich was super tender. They give you a lot of meat (which is good) and it just breaks away on each bite. The sauce they use is pretty good too, although I can't remember what it was.

Good place for Sunday/Saturday brunch without the ridiculous long wait.
author: Patrick P.

description: Amazing breakfast joint in S.F.  Great service, the girls moved us in to the sun as a table became available after we sat down. Great food and good value for $. Will come back.
author: Frankie F.

description:
I can't wait to bring the friends, except place is crowded and probably a group of 6 will take forever to get seats. Never the less, I like this place.

I enjoyed their MYOM-make your own mimsa. I never tried champagne with blood red orange, but it was delicious. I recommend it so much.

I loved their chicken and waffles. Good flavors. The chicken was marinated and the flavors meshed well with their waffle. I give them double thumbs up for their chicken and waffles.

I loved their spinach mushroom tomatoe omelette. I really like the fresh salad and melon it came witih. More so, I like the fluff in the egg. It was great and fresh.

My least favorite, but still pretty good. But least favorite was their french toast with apple and nuts and topped with sour cream. The dish was clever, but I think I would have liked a more traditional style french toast. No apples and no nuts for me.

I can't wait to go back to try their benedict.
author: Janice T.

description:
Worth the trip from Tampere, Finland, to San Francisco, CA!

We were a group of 6 people, and we had to wait about 20 mins to get seating, so as others have said, get there early!
author: Sam L.

description: Very good breakfast.  I had the spinach tomato and feta scramble. Everything very fresh...down to the coffee!  Very personable staff. My husband had the two eggs and chose egg whites, prepared perfectly. Check it out!
author: Denise M.

description:
I am fighting every urge in me that wants to write this review as a LOLCat. 

I go to Eats every couple of months, usually with friends. Unless you hit some sort of sweet spot either late in their hours or very early in the morning, before most people roll out of bed, be prepared for an inordinately long wait. The staff do their best to keep the list moving, but that's one of the things that's most frustrating about eating here. Everything else is copacetic. Coffee is Equator brew, really good actually. The polenta scramble is unusual and zesty. Their chicken and waffle is also a nice update to the old classic. And they have waffles with bacon cooked into them. I can haz bacon.

Dammit.
author: Tanya F.

description: First timer here and I love eggs benedicts  but I decided to order something different. I had the spicy sausage over eggs easy & grits. My friend had the spicy pull pork omelette. Spicy sausage was mild but maybe hot for others the eggs over easy was prefect it mix very well with the oninons tomatoes and the grits.  THe pull pork was juicy and tender it mix well with the omelette and bake potato if your not a garlic lover then tell the cook to easy down on the gralic potato. Overall great service and great food. I would totally come back here and try the eggs benedicts.
author: Linda B.

description:
E xpect a long wait on weekends, it gets packed!
A mbiance is a bit noisy and cramped
T asty, tasty home fries -- one of the best I've had
S tandard brunch fare with the rest of their menu
author: Anthony N.

description: Walked in for the very first time. Loved the decor which reminded me of Pacific NorthWest eateries. I ordered the Spinach & Roasted Mushroom Benedict, which was served within 7 minutes and this was during busy lunch-hour! It came with white cheddar, hollandaise sauce, and with a side of either potatoes or salad available ($9.95). In all it was very nice BUT (a big BUT here): hollandaise sauce looked like liquidy salad dressing, and the potatoes I selected instead of the salad were pre-fried, refried and refried again. As a result there were chunks of potatoes so refried it seemed more like biting into a concrete block of potatoes! This poor cooking of the potatoes turned this otherwise great meal into a poor experience. The service and attention however was great, checking every few minutes.
author: Tony L.

description:
I walk to Eats for breakfast 3 or 4 times a month, and it's long been my go-to breakfast spot; I walk past a number of closer restaurants on my way there. The food is great and the staff is always 110% friendly. What's not to love?

Make sure to give the huevos rancheros a shot.
author: Kent H.

description: Excellent breakfast. Chicken and waffles and yogurt with fruit and granola are not to be missed. Great service, super friendly staff.
author: O.J. W.

description:
Eats is great breakfast food with a great location too. On Sundays they have a farmers market on clement street. It is very conveniently close by. 

Chicken and waffles. To die for. Yuuuum! It's a lot bigger than I thought it would be. I would definitely come back!
author: Christine V.

description:
Eats is the bomb!  Great menu with something for everyone.  Expect lines on the weekend.  Attentive staff. 

Favorites:
Chicken and waffles
Ham asparagus Benedict (best English muffins ever)
Kale salad

Note to Eats- please bring back your ricotta cheese pancakes from your old menu!
author: Jessica K.

description: Eh. Nothing special. Very loud environment. If you have a large group you are going to have to wait awhile for a table. I wouldn't come back here again. If anything this would be a "back up" for a breakfast restaurant.
author: Anthony G.

description:
I can't help my feelings. The diner concept is refreshed and the under-25 set decides its OK to eat here. Waitlist grows longer. NIMBY rage grows.

Putting that aside, I like that you can get a side salad instead of potatoes. You have your bacon waffle and chicken n waffle options, but their renditions are off-putting to me. You got a perfectly good bacon waffle, but then let's put some melted cheese on top of it? Is there such a thing as a bacon waffle purist? This creature may be me, then.

Also, the fried chicken has a mushroom gravy. I like fried chicken. I like mushrooms. I like gravy. But all these things all together are not anything I wait an hour in the Richmond chill for.

Breakfast stuff is good. But, it's hard to mess up breakfast stuff. You go out for breakfast stuff not because of the amazingness of it all, but because last night's activities have sapped you of all will power and wherewithal, and food prepared by someone else is the path of least will power and wherewithal.
author: Stacy J.

description:
Came one a weekday, when it wasn't very crowded. Services was okay and friendly. 

I got a sandwich with portabello mushrooms, bell peppers, cheese, sauce, and I'm drawing a blank on the rest of the ingredients...Anywho, the flavors were u fresh and interestingly different for my taste buds. 

It is a bit pricey, but I'll come back to try other things on their menus.
author: Mandy D.

description:
The wait is worth it.  The menu is interesting and the lemonade mimosas are fantastic.  The staff is friendly and polite.  I love that they serve every meal with a piece of fruit.  The menu is eclectic and interesting.  The ingredients are fresh and quality.
I wish I could give them all of the stars.
author: Tristen C.

description:
Even with babies screaming and throwing tantrums at the table next to ours, I still had a great experience here.  I was told not to come here because the food was expensive and the service was lousy.  

Given those expectations, I still came here because there really aren't any good breakfast places in the Richmond.  Upon arrival, we were greeted and given a table promptly. Both Sara D. and I were drawn to the chicken and waffles and a Cobb salad. 

The Waffles here were crispy yet fluffy.  Probably the best waffles I have had in a while.  The maple syrup was amazing as well.  The savory chicken with gravy was good but it could've used some seasoning.  I love restaurants that use panko on fried chicken.  It's not your typical fried chicken where you get a drumstick, thigh, and breast piece.  It was just a boneless chicken breast.  It was moist and crispy.  The mushroom gravy sauce was good as well.  A must try.

The Cobb salad was good just not great.  It would be a lot better if they made their diced chicken made to order rather than precooked dried up chicken pieces.  Q down the block makes a really good salad.  How come there aren't any great salad places in the Richmond district?

Overall, a cool little diner in the Richmond District.
author: jason g.

description:
Went with friends last year on a Saturday (oops! saved this review and forgot to post it afterward). Arrived around 10:30 and wrote our names down. It seems we were between rushes as our names were called soon after, so we didn't experience as bad of a wait as others have written about.

I ordered the Cream Cheese Stuffed Apple Walnut Cinnamon French Toast with a side of Chicken Cracked Pepper Sausage. The french toast was yummy (especially when I added slices of chicken sausage to my fork, but you'll have to be into that...and if you're not, why are you at a chicken waffle joint?) with perfect apple slices on top and frosty walnuts. I thought the sausage was too salty, but like I said earlier, it was a great balance when combined with the french toast.

Bf ordered Ham & Tomato Eggs Ben and really enjoyed it. 

We all liked the juices: detox, power-c, grapefruit.

Space was super-cramped, but I think we forgot about it once we started talking and eating.

I plan on returning specifically to order more of the items on the seasonal list next time.
author: Michelle D.

description:
I came here for lunch last week and upon entering found this place to be a cute little family place. 

I ordered the eggplant sandwich which consisted of eggplant, red and yellow bell peppers, portobello mushrooms, and goat cheese. I ordered my sandwich with a side of fries and a refresher (lime, cucumber, grape, ? forgot the last ingredient). I really enjoyed my sandwich especially with the sweet bell peppers and the goat cheese. My refresher though...yikes, so sour! I only really tasted the lime and cucumber and not the other two ingredients. 

My aunt and grandpa ordered the eggs benedict with a side salad and the fried chicken sandwich. Man, that fried chicken sandwich was huge!  

Overall, the food was tasty and fresh too. I wouldn't mind coming back but I won't be ordering another refresher.
author: Tracy Y.

description: THIS is as good as it gets. Amazing food, good coffee, long ass line but super super worth it. I go here regularly and enjoy it each time.
author: Ashley R.

description: The cook can't poach an egg to save his life.  The prices are too high for a simple breakfast. And it is not a comfortable place--too many tight spots and too many rickety tables. Plus the service is not soooo good.
author: Cathy L.

description: It's a great place for brunch, but be aware that it gets busy. If you're a couple, they might seat you at a round table with another couple, but it's not intrusive. The food is great. Probably the best American style brunch place in the neighborhood, with a hipster twist to it.
author: Brian M.

description:
This is one of the best little places in San Francisco to have breakfast. So, that makes it one of the best places in the Richmond District (where there really aren't that many breakfast places from which to choose), too.

I had the Spicy Tomato Skillet this morning. If you are a kale fan, like me, you could also call this a Spicy Kale Skillet, too. It's served with two eggs sunnyside-up atop a sort of vegetable stew consisting of lots and lots of kale, sliced red potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and green and red bell peppers. It was all very good, and made even better with a side order of their roasted home potatoes ~ the secret is (or not so secret, as it's chock full o') whole cloves of roasted garlic, too. These can be used in place of butter on your toast if you like (and I like).

If you would like to read my more detailed take on today's breakfastary repast, you can click on my account here and check out my stupid little breakfast 'blog.
author: Brian M.

description:
Almost  exactly a year later my coworker chums and I made our way back to Eats.  We walked in on a very not busy Thurs since it was Chinese New Year.  We ordered the chicken and waffles, the bacon and waffles (the one where the bacon is baked into the waffles), and the spicy tomato skillet thing.  Chicken and waffles, delicious, like they were last year.  But the chicken gets soggy with all that mushroom sauce so get it on the side.  The bacon and waffles was good!  The cheese they melted on top was odd but I guess you really can't go wrong with a bacon and cheese combo.  The skillet thing was a mess.  With the runny sunny side up eggs on top and the tomato soupy thing it sat on, I ended up barely touching it.  Most of it was liquidy anyways; not what I expected.  

The bacon and chicken/waffles dishes I give 4 stars, the skillet thing, 2.  Add in the SLOW service, it took us about 30 mins to get our food, I'm giving Eats 3 stars.  If we had more time to sit around and eat slowly during our lunch hour break I would enjoy the food more.  But scarfing it down in 15 mins after waiting 30 mins sucks.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Interesting twists on brunch favorites. I came here at about 10:30am and we immediately got a table outside since it was a sunny day. Fortunately, we avoided being included in the crowd that is a waitlist by about 15 minutes. 

Started my day off with their Power C drink, which consists of orange, pineapple, and grapefruit juice. Next, I ordered Panko fried chicken with mushroom gravy and waffles. The chicken was fried nicely and the mushroom gravy kept it moist, unfortunately, not too flavorful. Served with a side of two Belgium style waffles and powdered sugar. This dish did not blow my mind , but the restaurant's originality definitely intrigues me enough to come try other items on the menu.

The only thing I have to nitpick on, was the fact that the two parties that sat down after us, got their orders first. I understand that some dishes take longer to prepare, but it just seemed like we were being ignored.
author: Benson T.

description: Came here to have lunch with my officemates. I ordered the chicken and waffles which i found disappointing.  I do like the waffles, but the chicken was smothered with this mushroom gravy that I'm not crazy about.  It had a funky taste which left me feeling unsatisfied with my meal.  And they're not cheap either.  Coffee was good, nice and strong.   All in all, the long wait to get a seat wasn't worth it for me.  I may or may not come back.
author: Anj K.

description:
I'm not going to lie, I never wanted to give this place a chance when I first saw it. This is definitely just my opinion, but the only people I saw who ate there were stuck-up yuppies. There were about a billion, mid-thirties couples with newborns just living there perfect lives. I guess that's just not my scene. Although, the first time I decided I was going to try the place, my friend and I waited for about an hour and started seeing people that came after us being seated first. I will give them the benefit of the doubt that my friend and I just didn't hear them call my name out. Although, we didn't feel like waiting anymore so we left.

On a day that wasn't so busy, I went to go check the place out. The food was actually quite delicious. I can really appreciate a breakfast joint if you can tell the food is good quality and that your stomach is satisfied at the end of your meal. Eats passed my two essentials.

The picky part of me that has to take a star away is that the portions could be a little bigger, especially for the price. I suppose this goes back to the scene I'm not super in to. I could see someone that doesn't really care so much about spending $20 on breakfast giving this place 5 stars. However, I'm a guy who likes to eat and who likes to eat without breaking his wallet.

The employees here are awesome!! Andrew, Emily, and Olivia are genuine folks. The food here is awesome! Got to try the Spanish Scramble!
author: Greg S.

description: Decent waffle and home fries. Its a little pricey but as I've learned its difficult to get an individual meal in this town anymore for under $14 a person. Portions relatively small for the waffle. A "half order" is "one" waffle compared to a "full" which is "two". We're not in IHOP no more...
author: Frank B.

description: Made the "trek" out here last weekend to get brunch with some girlfriends from college. I had the quinoa kale salad with tahini dressing, which was really tasty. Nice ambiance and servers. Minus one star for over priced beverages.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Only giving it 2-stars for now based solely on the chicken and waffles.  

The chicken was a little dry, breaded nicely but lacked seasoning.  Added my own salt and pepper and it was much better.  Comes with a mushroom gravy, meh.

The waffles were ok, nothing to write home about.  Two small waffles, with honey butter.  

There are a lot of other places that have better chicken and waffles.  I think next time there I'll try the breakfast dishes.  I saw other people eating and it looked a lot better.  Maybe I can increase my rating.
author: Jason Y.

description: We love going to eats for breakfast and the food is always great, which is why we come back. But we always end up wondering if it is really worth it because the service is atrocious. I don't know how it could be so difficult to manage 30 seats but this past time it took 20 minutes to get a cup of coffee, which frankly should come immediately. The wait staff always looks overwhelmed and confused. I wish Eats would fix this - it totally deters from the experience.
author: Lucy A.

description:
In the  nineties So I remember this place being known for their lunch and sandwiches now I think it is good for for brunch breakfast and Lunch 

I went with my mom and we sat down next to the front next to a couple with a little toddler. Our waitress's brought water and asked what drinks we would like to get I ordered a oj and my mom ordered a coffee.
My mom ordered the hummus and egg and I orders he poppyseed pancake I think it's called. Me so happy.  I ate my pancaked in under five minutes they were so good so sweet flavorf creamy and fresh tasting they almost tasked like cupcakes or lemon poppyseed bread or cake so good and so bet yummy
My and delisheouis. My mom tried my pancakes and said they were good.  I tried her hummus and I eat some of her toast. I ran out of water and my mom wanted some jam so we had to get the waitresses attention in order to come over to us 
That hummus my mom got. Was way too spicy and hot tasting I didn't try the egg.
I will go back here again next time I might try ordering a sandwhich, salad,starter or a waffle and maybe a drink that will pair well with one of those.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I made the mistake of coming here on the week I forced my husband to go gluten-free and therefore had to give up gluten as part of the team. 
I had the tri-tip sandwich sans the delicious-looking ciabatta bread. It was delish and the side salad was a great accompaniment. 
Service was slow for a Tuesday afternoon but certainly friendly. 
I'll be coming back for breakfast once I'm back on gluten!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday morning to grab brunch. My friend was visiting from SoCal and we wanted to find a place to eat close to my work. There's a board in the front of the restaurant and you write your name down w/ the amount of people in your party. Then you get to pick whether you want to be seated indoors or outdoors. There was a bit of a wait around 11AM. I don't know if it was just this day or what, but service was fairly slow. Not sure why it took them so long to set up our table. The previous customers left a looooong time ago.

As far as the food goes, it was pretty delicious. I ordered the Chicken & Waffles (not dry at all, good w/ the mushroom gravy) while my friend ordered the Waffle Bacon (cheese melted into the crevices of the waffle) and I forgot what her friend ordered -__-... We also shared the Banana Chocolate Chip Pancakes (fluffy and delicious).

Other than the lag in wait/service and the fact that I shouldn't have eaten such a fairly heavy meal (I could barely stay awake at work!), I would definitely come back/
author: Justine O.

description:
Finally tried this place.  Was worried about seating for our party of seven since its a pretty small place.  It was a bit tight in there but service was really good.  I had to try the Chicken And Waffles ~ panko crusted all natural chicken, mushroom gravy, honey butter.  Chicken was juicy and not greasy.  It was good especially with the not too heavy gravy if you want to do a somewhat healthier chicken and waffle.  I really liked the waffle and honey buttter.

The group seemed to like their orders.

Banana Chocolate Chip Pancakes

Huevos Rancheros ~ fresh tomato salsa, beans, eggs over easy, gruyere, avocado, sour cream yum

Spinach & Roasted Mushroom Benedict ~ white cheddar, hollandaise, side potatoes or salad

Waffle Bacon bacon pressed in a waffle, cheddar, hungarian peppers, sunny up eggs, potatoes or salad
author: she q.

description:
Roommate's go to brunch spot. 

I like it, but I'm not a real breakfast person. So I cannot say too much. 

Scrambles are very tasty. Sides are expensive ($1.50 for a side of avocado which is probably the size of 1/3 or 1/4 avocado). 

It gets super packed here on Sunday mornings, which makes it uncomfortable, cause this place is so small, so don't expect to have a intimate conversation, cause half the restaurant could pick up on it. 

They have DIY Mimosas, score! A bottle of sparkling and a pitcher of orange juice!
author: Helen D.

description:
Eats was just alright.  The SF brunch market is pretty saturated and Eats doesn't stand out that much in my mind.

Not a big fan of the host.  Signed in as a party of 3 on their cool metal white board outside.  40 minute wait.  So one of my friends goes to the Chase down the street maybe 15 minutes into our wait.  A table comes for 3 comes up.  Crap!  Hostess drops us to the end of the list.  At least our waitress turned out to be friendly.

Anyway, I had the panko-Chicken and waffles.

I stayed at a Best Western in the OC a few weeks ago and Eat's waffles were comparable to the ones I made at the self-serve waffle maker at the Best Western's complimentary breakfast.  The honey butter at Eats though one-uped the Best Western's waffles.

On to the chicken:  The chicken was a dry and flavorless.  I probably should have requested an additional side of gravy in hopes of moistening up that chicken!

Oh and btw, this review is for the "new" Eats, which I hear is under the management of Burma Superstar....it's funny because when a couple asked the host about the wait time and discovered that the wait would be too long, the host said to them "I hear Burma Superstar is pretty good"  Womp womp.

Anyway, Eats was just alright.  If I had to choose between Eats and Q (which is a block or so away from Eats)...I'd go to Q hands down.
author: Matt S.

description:
This place has a good menu and vibe. Service is ok, food is ok, creativity of menu and fresh juices are great. I like the chicken and waffles. 

Eats basically gets an extra star because it is one of the few places of its kind in the neighborhood.
author: Mary C.

description:
So, the chicken part of chicken and waffles was the highlight, but nothing to write home about.  The spinach and mushroom benedict was lousy, and I was surprised that the server didn't even ask when she took my plate away less than half eaten, but maybe they are used to it.

Service was really slow too, seemingly forgetting we were there. Asked for water soon after being seated and didn't see our server for over ten minutes before she returned to take our food order without bringing the water. 

The questionably "maple" syrup was lousy too.  Maybe it was just Canadian, but it was almost flavorless and seemed diluted.  As a Vermonter, I take my syrup seriously... not to mention that the menu said it was supposed to come with honey butter not syrup.

Two stars is starting to feel generous. Not sure why anyone waits on the sidewalk for this place.
author: Quinn S.

description: I have a few favorites at this restaurant: succotash polenta, huevos rancheros (sometimes with pull pork), and the seasonal spicy skillet entree.  These few entrees are very nicely prepared and pretty nutritious. I enjoy them a lot and the neighborhood feel of this place. Definitely a regular go-to.
author: Olivia A.

description:
My boyfriend and I ate here around 11:30AM on a Tuesday. We chose it both because it was near another place we were heading and because of the good reviews on Yelp. 

It wasn't super busy and we got a spot right near the door. I got some coffee, and it was probably the best restaurant coffee I've had so far. Strong, not dishwater. We split a spinach-tomato omelet and the cream cheese stuffed apple french toast. Both dishes were delicious and the portions were perfect for us to split the dishes, as we usually do. I loved the fresh berries in the fruit cup that we ordered with the omelet in place of potatoes. The french toast was the right amount of sweet and rich, not overpoweringly so like you'd get at a place like IHOP. 

The atmosphere was chill, not too loud. It was comfortable and cosy, though I don't recommend sitting right next to the door like I did (even though they place a tarp "divider"). The service was a little on the slower side and the prices a bit more expensive, but we both loved it.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Food is always good: fresh with a little creativity, but not goofy. Servers are always friendly. 

One thing that has never happened however, I have NEVER received a warm-up/refill for my coffee in 6 visits without having to flag someone down. That is a serious matter for brunch.
author: doug d.

description: Little bit of a wait on a Sunday, late-morning. Sat at a community table. But dude, the food was totally worth it. So very pleased to finally discover a wicked awesome brunch place.
author: Bam A.

description: The bf and I love to brunch and he decided to take me here because he used to go here a lot as a kid with his family. Love the atmosphere, there was so much to look at inside the restaurant while we waited for our table. We were seated at the bar and boy was it a show. The chefs are so quick yet meticulous. Cudos to them! We had the huevos rancheros and this dish with grits, sausage, fresh roasted veggies and eggs. I don't remember what the dish was called but it was so flavorful. Spicy and creamy. I was scared to order it because I've never had grits before but lets just say I'm a fan now. Nice little neighborhood place with great service and amazing food!
author: Sarah L.

description:
I ordered the chicken and waffles, and while it looked amazing, the chicken was a little dry and under seasoned.  One waffle was completely soft, while the other one was almost brick hard.  Very odd, how you could have to quarters of a waffle come out so differently.

The service was good, until I asked for an itemized receipt, and had to ask three people before I got it.

Ultimately though, I've made a personal decision to stop frequenting restaurants in SF that include the Employer Mandate service charge instead of folding the costs into the prices of the menu.

I have not read about one restaurant that actually used all this money for their employees healthcare, and I feel it's really just the restaurant ripping their customers off.  So until they get rid of the 3.95% "mandate", which by the way they include in the pre-tax amount, as if you are supposed to tip on it, I won't be back.
author: P K.

description: Typical SF bullshit. Long line, meh food, slow service, filed with people who say "like" every other word
author: Jordan d.

description: I absolutely LOVE Eats! Everything I have had here is great. The Huevos Rancheros are my favorite! The only downfall, is the space. Its super small and you have to wait in line outside almost every time you go. BUT, it's definitely worth it!
author: Natalia H.

description: Great pulled pork hash and fast service even with a busy crowd but putting SF Mandate charge on the check is tacky. I'm not going to be mad at kitchen workers for wanting healthcare.
author: Jacob T.

description: The food is good the atmosphere is expected. see: #hipster #handcrafted #curated #ontrend So if you are in for that sort of thing, and you're close to the way out, go for it. Cheers!
author: Sean D.

description: Honestly some of the worst service I've ever experienced. We had to ask for our tea 2 times, a side of bacon twice, and I finally gave up on a water refill. It seemed like there were 4 different people serving us, and yet none of them were capable of helping us get what we needed. Why the 4 stars, you ask? Eats introduced me to my new obsession, the acai smoothie bowl. Normally when I eat brunch, all my healthy habits fly out the window. EGGS! BACON! FRIED THINGS! Bring them ALL TO ME. For some odd reason, the smoothie bowl sounded delicious and refreshing, so I went for it. Holy bowl of all things good and right in the world. If you aren't familiar (which I wasn't), an acai bowl is made with a base of frozen smoothie ingredients, layered with granola, fresh fruit, toasted coconut and cinnamon. Oh em gee. It's really good, y'all. And it kept me full for 2 hours of intense hiking, and didn't leave me begging for a nap. I will always have good thoughts of Eats for this introduction, but I probably wouldn't go back just based on the chaotic way this place is run. But hey, there's a line out the door every morning, so I guess they're doing fine with the way things are.
author: Vanessa B.

description: The spicy sausage polenta is WHERE IT'S AT! John provides the a positive and entertaining environment. Some of the best service I have seen in this city. Great neighborhood, great food, great service.
author: Rachel C.

description: we like traveling a lot and we enjoy eating this place has the best breakfast excellent
author: Carlos C.

description:
Delicious but expensive.

This place is the "Zazie" of Inner Richmond IMO.

Well worth the wait. Put your name in and then go look at some stores for a bit.
author: Cruz K.

description: Protip for the Asian girl hostess/waitress that was working around noon on Tuesday July 29th: if you're going to be a total bitch to me when I'm just trying to ask a simple question about whether or not you have to be on the list to sit at the counter, it's actually really easy for me to take my business elsewhere.
author: r. e. m.

description:
Delicious!!

 I was up visiting a friend and we decided to go for breakfast. I had the vegetarian breakfast sandwich, she had the fried chicken sandwich, and our other friend had the smoked salmon platter. We also got the goat cheese fancy toast and everything was an A+

It's a small place right on the corner but the service was quick and the food was good. I'll be back to eat at Eats on my next SF trip!
author: morgan t.

description: I love the coffee mug, the strong coffee, fresh juices, huevos rancheros and the spicy tomato skillet.  I don't love the line but c'est la vie. life is beautiful.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I don't know what planet T.H. was from or what bug what up this person's bum, but MY experience with this restaurant, and the hard-working servers (and ESPECIALLY the sweet Teal and her co-workers) was completely opposite. I can only guess T.H. was a plant from a competing restaurant.

Ignore ALIEN ORDERS. THIS PLACE ROCKS!

It's fun and wonderful to be recognized as a regular, and I am one now having been here 4 times this month. The location is in the sunny end of Clement St. and outdoor dining is a pleasure as there is little traffic and although I take the bus, there seems to be plenty of parking here before 12pm weekdays.

This is the breakfast place in the Richmond that I have been looking for many years, as the Outer Richmond has nothing like this. This place has class, and the chefs are artists with food. Every dish seems to have a master's touch, and a lot of love.  It's a happy place and worth any small wait. 

I've been working my way around the menu each time, finding MANY vegetarian - based dishes (although there are plenty of bacon, chicken, and chicken-apple sausage based ones too..).

The prices? I can't complain - one pays for quality and they seem competitive to other places I've liked in the MIssion, where there's a lot more competition.  If yelp will let me, I'll add some photos of the dishes I've had - so far the presentations were SO beautiful that I had to take a photo, EACH TIME...

The food, the staff and the wonderful vibe are reasons why I'll bus across town to go to this place.  And to Teal - You and your co-workers are the best.
author: Stephen B.

description: There are some places that are worth waiting outside for an hour or more in the foggy old city of San Francisco, and EATS is surely one of those places.   I came here on a Saturday afternoon and we wrote on names down and waited eagerly for the names above us to be crossed of one by one.  And finally it came to be our turn! We were seated and  the waitress took our drink ordered really quick.. Of course, after waiting outside for so long we quickly ordered our tea.  I didn't know what i wanted to order, but i saw their white board advertise their Stuffed French toast.   That sounded really good just reading the description.  I was head over heels for it! it wasn't too sweet and it was very fluffy.  The waitress asked us how i like my meal, i didn't even give my friend a chance to reply and all i said was " OMG, WOW, this is so damn good!"  Even the waitress was taken away from my response.  The serve here is pretty good, the servers check up on you from time to time.  Overall, i will def. come back here. I won't even mind waiting for a table even if it's pouring outside. So eat up!
author: Belinda C.

description:
The new and improved Eats gets 4 stars! The place looks great, which drives business and attracts good-looking people. Huge improvement in the last year.

I love that this place has taken their own spin on southern-style breakfast.
