description: Anyone who lives within three blocks of this place has inevitably stumbled, sunglasses on, to the corner of Clement and 2nd for this fantastic, greasy, huge portioned hangover remedy.  The food is really good, portions are large enough to share with a hungry girlfriend and the bill will make you feel better about spending $12 a pop on last nights cosmos.  The wait can take around 30 mins on weekends though, so bring people you want to stand around talking to.
author: Jessica M.

description: Went last week with an out of town friend based on location and Yelp! reviews.  Food was decent, service was good considering it was busy, crowded, and there was only one person waiting tables.  I gave it three stars because eveything about this place is average. Nothing exceptional here, but it's convenient.
author: Ann W.

description: This place is great for a simple breakfast or brunch. Service is good, food is what you'd expect from diner breakfast food. However, expect to wait in line if you come here around 10 or 11 on the weekends.
author: Emily F.

description: The food is solid, not great.  The service is fine and the cook seems fast.  The place could have less dusty fake flowers and flies though.
author: Tamsen S.

description: the only reason I ate here was to try the waffle bacon....it was delicious!  there was a wait with people standing outside, and that kind of popularity usually comes from a good rep.  My only gripe was the price.  $15 for breakfast...but it was worth it for a once in a while rewarding breakfast
author: James C.

description: Great place in the inner richmond.  Ricotta pancakes are yummy!
author: Russ B.

description: I called and got on the waiting list around 11am on a Saturday, which I thought was a great thing! So the wait was pretty minimal in my opinion (about 10 minutes once we arrived after walking 5-6 blocks from my place). We were seated at the community round table and shared it with another party of two (I was glad the couple with the baby turned the community table down). I got the ham and tomato eggs benedict and they were delicious! My friend got the eggs ranchero and I've never seen her inhale a dish so fast. We thoroughly enjoyed the food. The service was just okay in my opinion and because the space is so small, the atmosphere is nothing special. But I'll go back for the food for sure.
author: Erika S.

description: This is a great breakfast place that you have to plan on going to before you are actually hungry, because the wait is horrendous (hence the 4 stars), but man the great greasy spoon food that you get after?  Priceless, I can still taste the yummy over easy eggs, with pancakes I had but two weekends ago.  Word to the wise there is a list on the door outside that you should add your name to immediately upon arrival, (the first time I went here I didn't realize this vital piece of information).
author: Cassie L.

description: Yum yum give me some.  This place is so close to my house, which is very convenient for me!  Anyhow, the o.j. is freshly squeezed.  Service is fast.  I ordered the pancake special (2 buttermilk pancakes, 2 eggs, sausage or bacon).  It hit the spot.  My friend had the teriyaki chicken, and it was not so appetizing.  It looks how it tastes, he said.  The home fried potatoes were a bit oily, but addicting.  This is a non-pretentious, great neighborhood diner (they close at 3).
author: Sarah F.

description:
Raves: I love breakfast food, and this place makes GREAT breakfast food.  If I'm waking up early on the weekends, it's coz I wanna enjoy a good breakfast and this place does it for me.  I always always get the omelettes or scramble.  I've tried the seafood scramble, the veggie omelette, the spicy sausage omelette, and the Club Sandwich (has yummy potato salad that comes with it).  All omelettes and scrambles come with toast and potato wedges.  Looked up the inspection card score from the SF Dept of Public Health and they got 98%!! Very impressive.

Rants: Service is on and off...I guess it depends on how busy they are and how many ppl they have staffed.  As with all my reviews, refill of water/coffee is a huge thing for me...and they're not consistent enough with this the many times I've been there.  The wait is long if you go weekend mornings, and someone is always waiting for the bathroom! Parking is hard to find in this area too.
author: Connie Y.

description:
Not quite the greatest breakfast place of all time (that title belongs to the marvelous taraval cafe), but good nonetheless. 

Highlight of my breakfasts there: Ricotta Cheese Pancakes. Eats is probably the only place that would ever dare such a feat, and they pull it off rather well. The flavor confuses you at first, but then you slowly realize that it tastes good. And then you give them money! So everyone wins.
author: Joey Y.

description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon, had to wait for almost 30 minutes. Was a first time visitor. The staff was nice and the food was delicious. A bit pricy, but I liked it!
author: Linda C.

description: Awesome breakfast spot. You can't go wrong. They even burned my bacon just like I asked them to! Most places can't cook bacon properly.
author: Dre D.

description: Great breakfast, spectacular huevos rancheros, delicious fresh OJ.  Just look out for the insane line out the door.  It's like a general admission concert at the Fillmore
author: Jack H.

description: Eats has long been a favorite of mine.  For the last few months it was closed for renovations and I was delighted to see it recently re-open!  I went over excited for my ricotta pancakes and seafood scramble, only to find out that they are under new ownership and the old menu does not exist!  The prices went up and it is now a trendy brunch place with mediocre food and NO RICOTTA PANCAKES!  It now looks exactly like every other brunch spot in the city- why is it that every gem gets replaced by a flashier restaurant? I miss the old Eats, a chill inexpensive place with great food...
author: Heather M.

description: I think I'm pretty much addicted to this place. There was a time when I went every weekend straight for just about three months. The samurai omelet is to die-for and the home fried potatoes are amazing. Good service. Saturday mornings there's usually no wait. Sundays, expect to sit on the fire hydrant for awhile.
author: Steven K.

description: I didn't know that there was a new owner and that it was remodeled. I had not gone here for a while, but I loved the old Eats so, we decided to go. Unfortunately, it took almost 35 mins to get our food and something was burning in the kitchen so, the whole place got really stuffy. The dish that I liked the most out of our group was the tri tip sandwich. It didn't have much meat as I thought it would, but the horseradish sauce and the aoli was really good. Also, I ordered the cream of asparagus soup that was really good (although I thought I have ordered artichoke when the waitress mentioned the soup de jour). It might be a while for me to go back again.
author: Erica U.

description: Just finished the best breakfast to date, from Eats! We enjoyed a fun sit at the bar by the cooks. It's fun watching the cooks work, they do a fantastic job on the food (my banana pancakes were incredibly tasty!) and they're speedy but precise with the orders. Not to mention, my boyfriend happily devoured his bacon-waffle with sunny-side up eggs and potatoes, as well as, my pancakes (surprising because he is NOT a fan of bananas but these pancakes fixed that.) Lastly, our server (I believe his name is Kent) is always AMAZING!!!!
author: C S.

description: We just finished a delicious breakfast at Eats. Friendly staff, great coffee, excellent waffle and egg dishes. The communal table provided lots of good conversation with strangers as we ate a yummy meal.
author: Ellen F.

description: I used to walk by Eats en route to another local place and wondered what the line was all about...but I got tired of eating breakfast in a wine bar so I gave Eats a shot and now it is my go-to breakfast spot.  Like your favorite sweater that is a bit wonky but you love to wear it because it is comfy and you can count on it.
author: Laura F.

description: After reading Katy's yelp from yesterday I am so saddened to learn of the fate of my beloved Eats... :(  I am really at a loss as to what to say except that you, Eats, will be sorely and surely missed! I have not been to Burma Superstar and now probably won't even though I have heard its great... That little corner and our beloved Richmond district will never be the same.  We lost another great one... Here's to all your wonderful years of dedication to filling up the stomachs of many a San Franciscan! Thanks!
author: william w.

description: When we lived in the city, we would always come here for the ricotta cheese pancakes.  They are the best.  They give you nice size portions and the service is pretty good.  The prices are ok and you should try to get there early.  Sometimes you have to wait because the place is small.
author: Susan W.

description:
Went looking for a simple breakfast on Saturday moring and dropped in on this place since I'v eaten there sometime in the last 10 years.
Sat down along a wall with some molding shelf and ordred coffee in the same breath I told the waitress that they had RAT DROPPINGS ALL ALONG THE SHELF AND EVEN ON OUR TABLE.   We stood up and left and called the health department.
author: Patrick G.

description:
Once was enough.

The ricotta pancakes intrigued me, as I'd never seen them on a menu before, and they would have been decent if it weren't for the entire plate of them being burned.  I was kind of surprised that a restaurant would even serve food that was that charred, and on both sides no less. 

Since those were pretty much inedible, I went for some potatoes on my friend's plate, only to find them cold and pretty bland and (surprise, surprise) kind of burned-tasting.  

Oh, and the coffee may be plentiful, but it's more like drinking coffee-flavored tea because it's so weak.  

Redeeming factor: the orange juice was excellent.
author: Andrea M.

description: I used to live right across the street from this place. It was fine to go to once in a while, and I generally liked it because it was laid back and the coffee wasn't bad. Some time around 2003 it got to be a real destination, with lines out the door and people willingly waiting over half an hour (in that cramped setting) for their orders. The kitchen there cannot accomodate that kind of volume.  If you're into that kind of energy on Sunday morning, then go for it.
author: Steve F.

description: place was pretty nice service wise and the menu wasn't bad. I got what I thought was the most food for my money (2 french toast, 4 sausage, 2 eggs, and potatoes for 6.50 i think). when i came home and opened my box, i got it to go, i was kinda let down because i had visualized a mountain of food and it was more of a hill and that they had also given me pancakes instead of french toast. The food wasn't bad, I mean i did eat it all, I think I was just hoping for more.
author: Eric C.

description: Now that EATS is all new and improved- I think its time for an update.  I like the new decor- it's nice to have a pretty place to eat breakfast.  There is much more counter space, leaving more room in between tables (only about 10 maybe).  The menu is pretty good- except no pancakes!  They could use some more standard American breakfast fare.  They do have some delicious looking scrambles and the traditional eggs, bacon and potatoes.  I went wild and had the "waffle bacon". Yummy to the max.  In short it was a waffle cooked around bacon slices and topped with Hungarian peppers, white cheddar cheese and eggs. The peppers were what made it so unique and delicious.  It is not at inexpensive as the old EATS, the waffle bacon was about 10.50 or so and the standard breakfast listed above was about 8.50 maybe?? Coffee 2$ - so our meal for 2 was 26 + tip.  I would rather go out less and get better food than have cheap greasy food that the old EATS served.  All in all- its a great improvement! Thanks Burma Superstar people for helping a breakfast loving girl out!
author: cece S.

description: Awesome food, efficient, friendly, and energetic staff!  Big portions and lots of variety!  Great bacon waffle, and lattes, too!
author: Lara M.

description: I had placed Eat's on the breakfast B-list due to the fact it's always hot and stuffy, and the food was only mediocre. But now that it been remodeled, and I've experienced the unbridled majesty of "waffle bacon", Eat's is on the A-list. Sadly though, despite the remodel it's still stuffy inside. Adding a shade to the Clement st. window or a ceiling fan would be appreciated.
author: Pete J.

description: I love this place! I go there every weekend with my bf. If you want a yummy big breakfast this is the place to go. The homefries are super tasty and they are generous with the portions. The decor is pretty bad...old chairs and table..its pretty tacky but I go there for the food and not the ambiance. The service is quick and the servers are friendly.
author: Jasmine M.

description: Greasy diner style brunch breakfast food. Always a line. Awesome hash.
author: Matt G.

description:
my boyfriend and i went to Eats for the first time this past weekend -- and we LOVED it!!  the servers were friendly, service speedy, and good coffee for a "greasy diner".  (i actually didn't think their food was that greasy, but then again, i only ordered two eggs and a fruit bowl.)
but people, their ricotta pancakes are to DIE for(and to ruin my diet for too, apparently, because one bite of it sent my mind straight to this "must eat" mode and i just couldn't stop!!)
my boyfriend had eggs benedict and thought it was very good.  he often times complains about how some places make their hollandise sauce too over -the- top creamy, but at Eats it's just perfect.
and we're so lucky because it's a nice walk from where we live!  we love the richmond..  :)
author: kristina h.

description: i do like this place. a great breakfast spot with a whole menu of good stuff. it get a bit crowded sometimes, but the wait is never that long.
author: Andrew D.

description: Joycelyn Lee has done again! The new Eats matches the taste and excellence of her other restaurants, Burma Superstar and B Star. I had the chicken, avocado, aioli sandwich and my partner had the spinach omelet. The sandwich was a great fusion of flavors, the spinach omelette a fine blend of fresh tastes. The herb roasted potatoes that came with the omelette were to die for! I think this is the best brunch place in the neighborhood now, as well as some nearby neighborhoods. Instead of Ella's on Presidio, go to Eats on Clement. It's smaller and not as upscale but worth the trip.
author: Sandy S.

description: we had the scrambled eggs #10 and #12. i got the vegetarian, in white  (#12)and my friend got the joe's (#10), and we both enjoyed our dish. the scrambled eggs are tasty, however, their potatoes did not impress me that much......something was lacking and i was thinking they need to put more spice, such as paprika/cummin, thyme/parsley maybe? and it will make it enjoyable to eat, though satisfying and fulfilling.  moreover, they are generous with their portions.
author: Nelle A.

description: Not sure how I slack so badly on places I eat regularly for review but eh, a girl has to work right?  You can count on this place for consistency for sure.  It's good, filling and that comfort kind of food you crave now and again.
author: Misti L.

description: i wasn't too hot about the old EATS but it was okay, all things considered.  in regards to the old EATS: the prices were affordable but it took FOREVER to get a standard breakfast and i'd always need to take another shower because i reeked of bacon afterwards.  but now, the new EATS... well, i've gone once and will probably not go again.  the prices are just stupid.. i think it's over 2 bucks for a typical cup of coffee!! yeah yeah, i'll admit that the oatmeal was pretty good but i only got that because i couldn't order standard pancakes!  i not only dislike pretentious eating establishments, i really dislike being surprised by them.  basically EATS have the same worn out awning, that part hasn't changed, but it's just a totally unexpected and not in a good way.  When I went they had recently reopened and i overheard someone ask the waitress where an ATM was (because, get this, it's CASH ONLY... at those prices? sure) and the waitress said that she didn't know where it was.  it was just funny, imo.  plus they had 4 chefs behind the counter... i don't know.  i guess i wasn't expecting that at all.  i wouldn't recommend it unless you feel like throwing some money away.
author: Nix B.

description: For me, two things in particular stand out at Eats.  One is their ricotta pancakes.  "wait, wait... lemme get another bite of that... ok, now, kiss me!" mmmm!  Second, their Hollandaise.  Funny, considering I actually had the server explain to me this morning why some people DON'T like it (sometimes lumpy). I've worked in many a restaurant on Oahu while in college.  From coffee shop to banquets to short order to steakhouses to 4 and 5 star fine dining houses.  Eats has by far the best hollandaise I've ever had.  Funny.  I mean, crap.  What is Hollandaise?  Freakin butter, lemon juice, and egg yolks.  I only eat it when I have Eggs Benedict.....or Florentine.... and, I go to Eats specifically for something covered with that wonderful artery clogging french concoction.  Sucky thing is, they only have Benedict on their menu for Sunday Brunch.  I didn't even realize the many times I'd been there happened to be on Sundays, as my last two trips there were on a Monday and Saturday, narrowly missing my rendezvous with triple bypass bliss.  Alas, the next visit will have to be a Sunday. Hopefully with less than a one block walk, twenty minute wait, and one lump in my Hollandaise.
author: Barry A.

description: Alright, this place is not the best quality of food, but it's one of the few affordable brunch places in the neighborhood. The waitresses are always friendly and it's a "sit where you want" comfortable vibe. It's at the quieter end of Clement, so it's nice and peaceful in the morning on the weekends. They have these awesome pancakes with fresh fruit and light syrup (it's not drenched, but they put just enough on to flavor it)...but I think it's a seasonal special. Great place to wake up over some coffee or cider on a Sunday.
author: Tami H.

description: Yummy breakfast, but the wait is hard to deal with!  The service is mediocre and they don't even have eggs benedict!  It could be improved on.
author: L M K M.

description: in my opinion, a basic american breakfast place. sure bet.
author: Meegs P.

description: They must be reading the negative comments left here because I didn't experience none of it today. I passed by a few times but didn't have the patience to be on a waiting list. I must have came at the right time because we were seated immediately with a choice of tables. Shorly after, there was a line at the door. The service is phenomenal. Genuinely kind staff and my cup of coffee was always full. Even after I paid the bill already. If they are making good money on tips, they certainly deserve it. The environment had a home like feeling to it which is a huge plus. All the condiments you can possibly need are right next to you. Maybe because I've had way too many American breakfast on counters. As for the food, fantastic! This place definately raised the bar for how American breakfast should be. Now for the bad news. I think they should invest in new silverware. My fork was bent almost completely flat. If I was in Denny's, I'd bent it into shape. But this time, I left it alone hoping they notice and correct this issue.
author: Butch M.

description: i ordered the spicy omelet (italian sausage w/ sour cream) on a crowded saturday noon. i ended up waiting 30 minutes for my order to arrive. the home fries were dripping with grease. i wished i had make breakfast at home.
author: Sam Y.

description: i love this place...i love breakfast so when i want a good one walking distance from home, EATS is where i go...their ricotta pancakes are so good, especially if you get the breakfast with 2 of them, eggs, bacon, and potatoes...i wish they had some sort of other hot sauce other than tabasco, but those are my own issues..EATS rocks
author: Erin S.

description: After reading some of the reviews here, I am in shock!! This place is absolutely dreadful!!!! If I could give no stars I would. My friend and I have wanted to go here forever but for some reason never have, now we know why......Went in here on Sunday with my friend, got seated fairly quickly considering the place was jammed. It took 20 mins before anybody came near us. We ordered food & drinks at the same time, which my friend didn't like as she likes to have her coffee while reviewing the menu. We ordered, 2 cokes, 1 coffee... a different waitress brought the drinks... NO coffee! After about 40 mins our food eventually arrived.  We both ordered sandwiches so there was really no cooking involved besides frying the fries and melting cheese, 40 mins??? I don't think so! I ordered the curry chicken salad open face sandwich which was totally inedible, I mean first, impossible to eat as the mixture was falling all over the place and second I didn't really want to eat it, it lacked flavor, and was actually making me sick to look at. I ate my fries, but was also disgusted at the ketchup, in a little half empty ketchup crusted container on the counter and it wasn't even proper ketchup! My friend ordered the tuna melt with no Chile pepper. She wasn't particularly enamored with her choice either. Firstly there was Chile peppers.....maybe if they took the orders with a pen and paper they might remember the proper order!!! and secondly the bread was fried, which wasn't stated on the menu. Nobody checked on us to see if we needed anything, or a refill on the coffee, oh sorry we never got the coffee!!!!! We finally got somebody's attention to get our check and escape!! Upon removing my plate, I was asked 'did I want a box', I said no and he asked 'did I not like it' to which I wanted to reply" If I had liked it I would have eaten it, I did come here for food after all" but, declined I just wanted to get the hell out of there. Service, food, atmosphere everything is lacking here and needless to say we will NEVER go to Eats for food again..... What a waste of $35!!!
author: Cassidy K.
